" title="Filename extension">filename extensions</a></th>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<td style="vertical-align: top; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t.java, .class, .jar</td>\r\n\t\t\t\t</tr>\r\n\t\t\t\t<tr>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<th scope="row" style="vertical-align: top; text-align: left; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\tWebsite</th>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<td style="vertical-align: top; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<a class="external text" href="http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/" rel="nofollow" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(51, 102, 187); background-image: url(data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAoAAAAKCAYAAACNMs+9AAAAGXRFWHRTb2Z0d2FyZQBBZG9iZSBJbWFnZVJlYWR5ccllPAAAAFZJREFUeF59z4EJADEIQ1F36k7u5E7ZKXeUQPACJ3wK7UNokVxVk9kHnQH7bY9hbDyDhNXgjpRLqFlo4M2GgfyJHhjq8V4agfrgPQX3JtJQGbofmCHgA/nAKks+JAjFAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC); background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; padding-right: 13px; background-position: 100% 50%; background-repeat: no-repeat no-repeat; ">For Java Developers</a></td>\r\n\t\t\t\t</tr>\r\n\t\t\t\t<tr>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<td colspan="2" style="vertical-align: top; text-align: center; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<a class="image" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Wikibooks-logo-en.svg" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Wikibooks logo"><img alt="Wikibooks logo" height="14" src="http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/7c/Wikibooks-logo-en.svg/14px-Wikibooks-logo-en.svg.png" style="border-top-style: none; border-right-style: none; border-bottom-style: none; border-left-style: none; border-width: initial; border-color: initial; vertical-align: middle; " width="14" /></a>&nbsp;<a class="extiw" href="http://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/Java_Programming" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(51, 102, 187); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-left: 0px; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="wikibooks:Java Programming">Java Programming</a>&nbsp;at&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikibooks" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Wikibooks">Wikibooks</a></td>\r\n\t\t\t\t</tr>\r\n\t\t\t</tbody>\r\n\t\t</table>\r\n\t\t<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t\t\t<b>Java</b>&nbsp;is a&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Programming_language" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Programming language">programming language</a>&nbsp;originally developed by&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_Gosling" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="James Gosling">James Gosling</a>&nbsp;at&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sun_Microsystems" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Sun Microsystems">Sun Microsystems</a>&nbsp;(which is now a subsidiary of&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oracle_Corporation" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Oracle Corporation">Oracle Corporation</a>) and released in 1995 as a core component of Sun Microsystems&#39;&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_(software_platform)" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Java (software platform)">Java platform</a>. The language derives much of its&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syntax_(programming_languages)" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Syntax (programming languages)">syntax</a>&nbsp;from&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/C_(programming_language)" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="C (programming language)">C</a>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/C%2B%2B" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="C++">C++</a>&nbsp;but has a simpler&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Object_model" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Object model">object model</a>&nbsp;and fewer&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Low-level_programming_language" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Low-level programming language">low-level</a>&nbsp;facilities. Java applications are typically&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Compiler" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Compiler">compiled</a>&nbsp;to<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_bytecode" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Java bytecode">bytecode</a>&nbsp;(<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Class_(file_format)" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Class (file format)">class file</a>) that can run on any&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_Virtual_Machine" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Java Virtual Machine">Java Virtual Machine</a>&nbsp;(JVM) regardless of&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Computer_architecture" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Computer architecture">computer architecture</a>. Java is a general-purpose, concurrent, class-based, object-oriented language that is specifically designed to have as few implementation dependencies as possible. It is intended to let application developers &quot;write once, run anywhere.&quot; Java is currently one of the most popular programming languages in use, particularly for client-server web applications.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-8" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_(programming_language)#cite_note-8" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>9<span>]</span></a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-9" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_(programming_language)#cite_note-9" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>10<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n\t\t<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t\t\tThe original and&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reference_implementation_(computing)" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Reference implementation (computing)">reference implementation</a>&nbsp;Java&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Compiler" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Compiler">compilers</a>, virtual machines, and&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Library_(computing)" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Library (computing)">class libraries</a>&nbsp;were developed by Sun from 1995. As of May 2007, in compliance with the specifications of the<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_Community_Process" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Java Community Process">Java Community Process</a>, Sun relicensed most of its Java technologies under the&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/GNU_General_Public_License" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="GNU General Public License">GNU General Public License</a>. Others have also developed alternative implementations of these Sun technologies, such as the&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/GNU_Compiler_for_Java" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="GNU Compiler for Java">GNU Compiler for Java</a>,&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/GNU_Classpath" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="GNU Classpath">GNU Classpath</a>, and&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dalvik_(software)" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Dalvik (software)">Dalvik</a>.</p>\r\n\t\t<table class="toc" id="toc" style="font-size: 12px; border-top-style: solid; border-right-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); border-right-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); border-left-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); padding-top: 5px; padding-right: 5px; padding-bottom: 5px; padding-left: 5px; ">\r\n\t\t\t<tbody>\r\n\t\t\t\t<tr>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<td>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<div id="toctitle" style="direction: ltr; text-align: center; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<h2 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; font-weight: bold; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.6em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; border-bottom-style: none; width: auto; font-size: 12px; display: inline; border-top-style: none; border-right-style: none; border-left-style: none; border-width: initial; border-color: initial; padding-right: 0px; padding-left: 0px; border-width: initial; border-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\tContents</h2>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t&nbsp;<span class="toctoggle" style="font-size: 11px; ">&nbsp;[<a class="internal" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_(programming_language)#" id="togglelink" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; ">hide</a>]&nbsp;</span></div>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<ul style="line-height: 1.5em; list-style-type: none; margin-top: 0.3em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-left: 0px; list-style-image: none; text-align: left; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-1" style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_(programming_language)#History" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span class="tocnumber">1</span>&nbsp;<span class="toctext">History</span></a>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<ul style="line-height: 1.5em; list-style-type: none; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<a class="internal" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Wave.svg" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none !important; background-attachment: initial !important; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t\t\t<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_Gosling" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="James Gosling">James Gosling</a>, Mike Sheridan, and&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Patrick_Naughton" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Patrick Naughton">Patrick Naughton</a>&nbsp;initiated the Java language project in June 1991.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-10" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_(programming_language)#cite_note-10" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>11<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;Java was originally designed for interactive television, but it was too advanced for the digital cable television industry at the time.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-11" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_(programming_language)#cite_note-11" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>12<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;The language was initially called&nbsp;<i><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oak_(programming_language)" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Oak (programming language)">Oak</a></i>&nbsp;after an&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oak" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Oak">oak tree</a>&nbsp;that stood outside Gosling&#39;s office; it went by the name&nbsp;<i>Green</i>&nbsp;later, and was later renamed<i>Java</i>, from Java coffee, said to be consumed in large quantities by the language&#39;s creators.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-12" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_(programming_language)#cite_note-12" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>13<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;Gosling aimed to implement a&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Virtual_machine" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Virtual machine">virtual machine</a>&nbsp;and a language that had a familiar&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/C_(programming_language)" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="C (programming language)">C</a>/<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/C%2B%2B" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="C++">C++</a>&nbsp;style of notation.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-13" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_(programming_language)#cite_note-13" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>14<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n\t\t<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t\t\tSun Microsystems released the first public implementation as Java 1.0 in 1995. It promised &quot;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Write_once,_run_anywhere" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Write once, run anywhere">Write Once, Run Anywhere</a>&quot; (WORA), providing no-cost run-times on popular&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Computing_platform" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Computing platform">platforms</a>. Fairly secure and featuring configurable security, it allowed network- and file-access restrictions. Major web browsers soon incorporated the ability to run Java&nbsp;<i><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Applet" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Applet">applets</a></i>&nbsp;within web pages, and Java quickly became popular. With the advent of&nbsp;<i>Java 2</i>&nbsp;(released initially as J2SE 1.2 in December 1998&ndash;1999), new versions had multiple configurations built for different types of platforms. For example,<i>J2EE</i>&nbsp;targeted enterprise applications and the greatly stripped-down version&nbsp;<i>J2ME</i>&nbsp;for mobile applications (Mobile Java).&nbsp;<i>J2SE</i>&nbsp;designated the Standard Edition. In 2006, for marketing purposes, Sun renamed new&nbsp;<i>J2</i>&nbsp;versions as&nbsp;<i><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_Platform,_Enterprise_Edition" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Java Platform, Enterprise Edition">Java EE</a></i>,&nbsp;<i><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_Platform,_Micro_Edition" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Java Platform, Micro Edition">Java ME</a></i>, and&nbsp;<i><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_Platform,_Standard_Edition" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Java Platform, Standard Edition">Java SE</a></i>, respectively.</p>\r\n\t\t<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t\t\tIn 1997, Sun Microsystems approached the&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO/IEC_JTC1" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="ISO/IEC JTC1">ISO/IEC JTC1</a>&nbsp;standards body and later the&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ecma_International" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Ecma International">Ecma International</a>&nbsp;to formalize Java, but it soon withdrew from the process.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-14" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_(programming_language)#cite_note-14" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>15<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;Java remains a&nbsp;<i><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/De_facto" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="De facto">de facto</a></i>&nbsp;standard, controlled through the&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_Community_Process" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Java Community Process">Java Community Process</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-15" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_(programming_language)#cite_note-15" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>16<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;At one time, Sun made most of its Java implementations available without charge, despite their&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Proprietary_software" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Proprietary software">proprietary software</a>&nbsp;status. Sun generated revenue from Java through the selling of licenses for specialized products such as the Java Enterprise System. Sun distinguishes between its&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Software_development_kit" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Software development kit">Software Development Kit (SDK)</a>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HotSpot" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="HotSpot">Runtime Environment (JRE)</a>&nbsp;(a subset of the SDK); the primary distinction involves the JRE&#39;s lack of the compiler, utility programs, and header files.</p>\r\n\t\t<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t\t\tOn November 13, 2006, Sun released much of Java as&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Free_and_open_source_software" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Free and open source software">free and open source software</a>, (FOSS), under the terms of the&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/GNU_General_Public_License" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="GNU General Public License">GNU General Public License</a>&nbsp;(GPL). On May 8, 2007, Sun finished the process, making all of Java&#39;s core code available under&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Free_software" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Free software">free software</a>/open-source distribution terms, aside from a small portion of code to which Sun did not hold the copyright.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-16" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_(programming_language)#cite_note-16" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>17<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n\t\t<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t\t\tSun&#39;s vice-president Rich Green has said that Sun&#39;s ideal role with regards to Java is as an &quot;evangelist.&quot;<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-17" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_(programming_language)#cite_note-17" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>18<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n\t\t<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t\t\tFollowing&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oracle_Corporation" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Oracle Corporation">Oracle Corporation</a>&#39;s acquisition of Sun Microsystems in 2009&ndash;2010, Oracle has described itself as the &quot;steward of Java technology with a relentless commitment to fostering a community of participation and transparency&quot;.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-18" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_(programming_language)#cite_note-18" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>19<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n\t\t<h3 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; font-weight: bold; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.3em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: initial; border-bottom-style: none; border-bottom-color: initial; width: auto; font-size: 17px; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; ">\r\n\t\t\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Java_(programming_language)&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: Principles">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="Principles">Principles</span></h3>\r\n\t\t<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t\t\tThere were five primary goals in the creation of the Java language:<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-19" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_(programming_language)#cite_note-19" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>20<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n\t\t<ol style="line-height: 1.5em; margin-top: 0.3em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 3.2em; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-left: 0px; list-style-image: none; ">\r\n\t\t\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\tIt should be &quot;simple, object-oriented and familiar&quot;</li>\r\n\t\t\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\tIt should be &quot;robust and secure&quot;</li>\r\n\t\t\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\tIt should be &quot;architecture-neutral and portable&quot;</li>\r\n\t\t\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\tIt should execute with &quot;high performance&quot;</li>\r\n\t\t\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\tIt should be &quot;interpreted, threaded, and dynamic&quot;</li>\r\n\t\t</ol>\r\n\t\t<h3 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; font-weight: bold; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.3em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: initial; border-bottom-style: none; border-bottom-color: initial; width: auto; font-size: 17px; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; ">\r\n\t\t\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Java_(programming_language)&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: Versions">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="Versions">Versions</span></h3>\r\n\t\t<div class="rellink relarticle mainarticle" style="font-style: italic; padding-left: 2em; margin-bottom: 0.5em; ">\r\n\t\t\tMain article:&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_version_history" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Java version history">Java version history</a></div>\r\n\t\t<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t\t\tMajor release versions of Java, along with their release dates:</p>\r\n\t\t<ul style="line-height: 1.5em; list-style-type: square; margin-top: 0.3em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 1.5em; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-left: 0px; list-style-image: url(data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAUAAAANCAMAAABW4lS6AAAAGXRFWHRTb2Z0d2FyZQBBZG9iZSBJbWFnZVJlYWR5ccllPAAAAAZQTFRFAFKM////QIUK9QAAAAJ0Uk5T/wDltzBKAAAAGklEQVR42mJgBAEGokgGBjBGBxBxsBqAAAMACHwALd5r8ygAAAAASUVORK5CYII=); ">\r\n\t\t\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\tJDK 1.0 (January 23, 1996)</li>\r\n\t\t\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\tJDK 1.1 (February 19, 1997)</li>\r\n\t\t\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\tJ2SE 1.2 (December 8, 1998)</li>\r\n\t\t\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\tJ2SE 1.3 (May 8, 2000)</li>\r\n\t\t\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\tJ2SE 1.4 (February 6, 2002)</li>\r\n\t\t\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\tJ2SE 5.0 (September 30, 2004)</li>\r\n\t\t\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\tJava SE 6 (December 11, 2006)</li>\r\n\t\t\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\tJava SE 7 (July 28, 2011</li>\r\n\t\t</ul>\r\n\t</div>\r\n</div>\r\n	2	2011-10-20 17:42:13.194613	2011-10-20 17:42:13.194613	0	\N	latest
7	Java Servlet	1	<p>\r\n\t&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tA servlet is a Java programming language class used to extend the capabilities of servers that host applications accessed via a request-response programming model. Although servlets can respond to any type of request, they are commonly used to extend the applications hosted by Web servers. Thus, it can be thought of as a&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_Applet" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Java Applet">Java Applet</a>&nbsp;that runs on a&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Server_(computing)" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Server (computing)">server</a>&nbsp;instead of a browser.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-0" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_Servlet#cite_note-0" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>1<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tA&nbsp;<b>Servlet</b>&nbsp;is a&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_class" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Java class">Java class</a>&nbsp;in&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_EE" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Java EE">Java EE</a>&nbsp;that conforms to the&nbsp;<b>Java Servlet API</b>, a protocol by which a Java class may respond to requests. They are not tied to a specific client-server protocol, but are most often used with the&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HTTP" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="HTTP">HTTP</a>&nbsp;protocol. Therefore, the word &quot;Servlet&quot; is often used in the meaning of &quot;HTTP Servlet&quot;.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-r1_1-0" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_Servlet#cite_note-r1-1" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>2<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;Thus, a&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Software_developer" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Software developer">software developer</a>&nbsp;may use a servlet to add&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dynamic_web_page" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Dynamic web page">dynamic content</a>to a&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Web_server" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Web server">Web server</a>&nbsp;using the&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_platform" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Java platform">Java platform</a>. The generated content is commonly&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HTML" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="HTML">HTML</a>, but may be other data such as&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/XML" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="XML">XML</a>. Servlets are the&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_(software_platform)" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Java (software platform)">Java</a>&nbsp;counterpart to non-Java dynamic Web content technologies such as&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Common_Gateway_Interface" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Common Gateway Interface">CGI</a>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Active_Server_Pages" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Active Server Pages">ASP.NET</a>. Servlets can maintain&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/State_(computer_science)" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="State (computer science)">state</a>&nbsp;in<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Session_(computer_science)" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Session (computer science)">session</a>&nbsp;variables across many server transactions by using&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HTTP_cookie" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="HTTP cookie">HTTP cookies</a>, or&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/URL_rewriting" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="URL rewriting">URL rewriting</a>.</p>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tTo deploy and run a Servlet, a&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Web_container" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Web container">Web container</a>&nbsp;must be used. A Web container is essentially the component of a Web server that interacts with the servlets. The Web container is responsible for managing the lifecycle of servlets, mapping a URL to a particular servlet and ensuring that the URL requester has the correct access rights.</p>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tThe servlet&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Application_programming_interface" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Application programming interface">API</a>, contained in the&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_package" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Java package">Java package</a>&nbsp;hierarchy&nbsp;<code style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); "><a class="external text" href="http://download.oracle.com/javaee/6/api/javax/servlet/package-summary.html" rel="nofollow" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(51, 102, 187); background-image: url(data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAoAAAAKCAYAAACNMs+9AAAAGXRFWHRTb2Z0d2FyZQBBZG9iZSBJbWFnZVJlYWR5ccllPAAAAFZJREFUeF59z4EJADEIQ1F36k7u5E7ZKXeUQPACJ3wK7UNokVxVk9kHnQH7bY9hbDyDhNXgjpRLqFlo4M2GgfyJHhjq8V4agfrgPQX3JtJQGbofmCHgA/nAKks+JAjFAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC); background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; padding-right: 13px; background-position: 100% 50%; background-repeat: no-repeat no-repeat; ">javax.servlet</a></code>, defines the expected interactions of the&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Web_container" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Web container">Web container</a>&nbsp;and a servlet.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-r1_1-1" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_Servlet#cite_note-r1-1" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>2<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tA&nbsp;<code style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); "><a class="external text" href="http://download.oracle.com/javaee/6/api/javax/servlet/Servlet.html" rel="nofollow" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(51, 102, 187); background-image: url(data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAoAAAAKCAYAAACNMs+9AAAAGXRFWHRTb2Z0d2FyZQBBZG9iZSBJbWFnZVJlYWR5ccllPAAAAFZJREFUeF59z4EJADEIQ1F36k7u5E7ZKXeUQPACJ3wK7UNokVxVk9kHnQH7bY9hbDyDhNXgjpRLqFlo4M2GgfyJHhjq8V4agfrgPQX3JtJQGbofmCHgA/nAKks+JAjFAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC); background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; padding-right: 13px; background-position: 100% 50%; background-repeat: no-repeat no-repeat; ">Servlet</a></code>&nbsp;is an&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Object_(computer_science)" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Object (computer science)">object</a>&nbsp;that receives a request and generates a response based on that request. The basic servlet package defines Java objects to represent servlet requests and responses, as well as objects to reflect the servlet&#39;s configuration parameters and execution environment. The package&nbsp;<code style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); "><a class="external text" href="http://download.oracle.com/javaee/6/api/javax/servlet/http/package-summary.html" rel="nofollow" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(51, 102, 187); background-image: url(data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAoAAAAKCAYAAACNMs+9AAAAGXRFWHRTb2Z0d2FyZQBBZG9iZSBJbWFnZVJlYWR5ccllPAAAAFZJREFUeF59z4EJADEIQ1F36k7u5E7ZKXeUQPACJ3wK7UNokVxVk9kHnQH7bY9hbDyDhNXgjpRLqFlo4M2GgfyJHhjq8V4agfrgPQX3JtJQGbofmCHgA/nAKks+JAjFAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC); background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; padding-right: 13px; background-position: 100% 50%; background-repeat: no-repeat no-repeat; ">javax.servlet.http</a></code>&nbsp;defines&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HTTP" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="HTTP">HTTP</a>-specific subclasses of the generic servlet elements, including session management objects that track multiple requests and responses between the Web server and a client. Servlets may be packaged in a&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/WAR_(Sun_file_format)" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="WAR (Sun file format)">WAR file</a>&nbsp;as a&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Web_application" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Web application">Web application</a>.</p>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tServlets can be generated automatically from&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/JavaServer_Pages" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="JavaServer Pages">JavaServer Pages</a>&nbsp;(JSP) by the&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/JavaServer_Pages_compiler" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="JavaServer Pages compiler">JavaServer Pages compiler</a>. The difference between Servlets and JSP is that Servlets typically embed HTML inside Java code, while JSPs embed Java code in HTML. While the direct usage of Servlets to generate HTML (as shown in the example below) is relatively rare nowadays, the higher level MVC web framework in Java EE (<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_Server_Faces" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Java Server Faces">JSF</a>) still explicitly uses the Servlet technology for the low level request/response handling via the FacesServlet. A somewhat older usage is to use servlets in conjunction with JSPs in a pattern called &quot;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Model_2" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Model 2">Model 2</a>&quot;, which is a flavor of the&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Model-view-controller" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Model-view-controller">model-view-controller</a>&nbsp;pattern.</p>\r\n<table class="toc" id="toc" style="font-size: 12px; border-top-style: solid; border-right-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); border-right-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); border-left-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); padding-top: 5px; padding-right: 5px; padding-bottom: 5px; padding-left: 5px; ">\r\n\t<tbody>\r\n\t\t<tr>\r\n\t\t\t<td>\r\n\t\t\t\t<div id="toctitle" style="direction: ltr; text-align: center; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<h2 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; font-weight: bold; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.6em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; border-bottom-style: none; width: auto; font-size: 12px; display: inline; border-top-style: none; border-right-style: none; border-left-style: none; border-width: initial; border-color: initial; padding-right: 0px; padding-left: 0px; border-width: initial; border-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\tContents</h2>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t&nbsp;<span class="toctoggle" style="font-size: 11px; ">&nbsp;[<a class="internal" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_Servlet#" id="togglelink" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; ">hide</a>]&nbsp;</span></div>\r\n\t\t\t\t<ul style="line-height: 1.5em; list-style-type: none; margin-top: 0.3em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-left: 0px; list-style-image: none; text-align: left; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-1" style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_Servlet#History" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span class="tocnumber">1</span>&nbsp;<span class="toctext">History</span></a></li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-2" style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_Servlet#Advantages_over_CGI" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span class="tocnumber">2</span>&nbsp;<span class="toctext">Advantages over CGI</span></a>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<ul style="line-height: 1.5em; list-style-type: none; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 2em; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-left: 0px; list-style-image: none; text-align: left; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-3" style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_Servlet#Life_cycle_of_a_servlet" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span class="tocnumber">2.1</span>&nbsp;<span class="toctext">Life cycle of a servlet</span></a></li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-4" style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_Servlet#Example" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span class="tocnumber">2.2</span>&nbsp;<span class="toctext">Example</span></a></li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t</ul>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t</li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-5" style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_Servlet#Usage" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span class="tocnumber">3</span>&nbsp;<span class="toctext">Usage</span></a></li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-6" style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_Servlet#See_also" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span class="tocnumber">4</span>&nbsp;<span class="toctext">See also</span></a></li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-7" style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_Servlet#References" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span class="tocnumber">5</span>&nbsp;<span class="toctext">References</span></a></li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-8" style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_Servlet#External_links" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span class="tocnumber">6</span>&nbsp;<span class="toctext">External links</span></a></li>\r\n\t\t\t\t</ul>\r\n\t\t\t</td>\r\n\t\t</tr>\r\n\t</tbody>\r\n</table>\r\n<h2 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.6em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-bottom-style: solid; border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); width: auto; font-size: 19px; ">\r\n\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Java_Servlet&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: History">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="History">History</span></h2>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tThe complete servlet specification was created by&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sun_Microsystems" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Sun Microsystems">Sun Microsystems</a>, with version 1.0 finalized in June 1997. Starting with version 2.3, the servlet specification was developed under the&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_Community_Process" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Java Community Process">Java Community Process</a>. JSR 53 defined both the Servlet 2.3 and JavaServer Page 1.2 specifications. JSR 154 specifies the Servlet 2.4 and 2.5 specifications. As of March 26, 2010, the current version of the servlet specification is 3.0.</p>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tIn his&nbsp;<a class="external text" href="http://weblogs.java.net/blog/driscoll/archive/2005/12/servlet_history_1.html" rel="nofollow" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(51, 102, 187); background-image: url(data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAoAAAAKCAYAAACNMs+9AAAAGXRFWHRTb2Z0d2FyZQBBZG9iZSBJbWFnZVJlYWR5ccllPAAAAFZJREFUeF59z4EJADEIQ1F36k7u5E7ZKXeUQPACJ3wK7UNokVxVk9kHnQH7bY9hbDyDhNXgjpRLqFlo4M2GgfyJHhjq8V4agfrgPQX3JtJQGbofmCHgA/nAKks+JAjFAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC); background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; padding-right: 13px; background-position: 100% 50%; background-repeat: no-repeat no-repeat; ">blog</a>&nbsp;on java.net, Sun veteran and&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/GlassFish" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="GlassFish">GlassFish</a>&nbsp;lead Jim Driscoll details the history of servlet technology.&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_Gosling" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="James Gosling">James Gosling</a>&nbsp;first thought of servlets in the early days of&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_(programming_language)" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Java (programming language)">Java</a>, but the concept did not become a product until Sun shipped the Java Web Server product. This was before what is now the&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_Platform,_Enterprise_Edition" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Java Platform, Enterprise Edition">Java Platform, Enterprise Edition</a>&nbsp;was made into a specification.</p>\r\n<table class="wikitable" style="font-size: 13px; margin-top: 1em; margin-right: 1em; margin-bottom: 1em; margin-left: 0px; background-image: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); border-top-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); border-right-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); border-left-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); border-top-style: solid; border-right-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-collapse: collapse; color: black; ">\r\n\t<caption style="font-weight: bold; ">\r\n\t\tServlet API history</caption>\r\n\t<tbody>\r\n\t\t<tr>\r\n\t\t\t<th style="border-top-color: rgb(170, 170, 170);
