border-right-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); border-left-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); border-top-style: solid; border-right-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; padding-top: 0.2em; padding-right: 0.2em; padding-bottom: 0.2em; padding-left: 0.2em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t&nbsp;</td>\r\n\t\t</tr>\r\n\t</tbody>\r\n</table>\r\n<h2 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.6em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-bottom-style: solid; border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); width: auto; font-size: 19px; ">\r\n\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Java_Servlet&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: Advantages over CGI">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="Advantages_over_CGI">Advantages over CGI</span></h2>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tThe advantages of using servlets are their fast performance and ease of use combined with more power over traditional&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Common_Gateway_Interface" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Common Gateway Interface">CGI</a>&nbsp;(Common Gateway Interface). Traditional CGI scripts written in Java have a number of disadvantages when it comes to performance:</p>\r\n<ul style="line-height: 1.5em; list-style-type: square; margin-top: 0.3em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 1.5em; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-left: 0px; list-style-image: url(data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAUAAAANCAMAAABW4lS6AAAAGXRFWHRTb2Z0d2FyZQBBZG9iZSBJbWFnZVJlYWR5ccllPAAAAAZQTFRFAFKM////QIUK9QAAAAJ0Uk5T/wDltzBKAAAAGklEQVR42mJgBAEGokgGBjBGBxBxsBqAAAMACHwALd5r8ygAAAAASUVORK5CYII=); ">\r\n\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\tWhen an HTTP request is made, a new process is created for each call of the CGI script. This overhead of process creation can be very system-intensive, especially when the script does relatively fast operations. Thus, process creation will take more time than CGI script execution. Java servlets solve this, as a servlet is not a separate process. Each request to be handled by a servlet is handled by a separate Java thread within the Web server process, omitting separate process forking by the HTTP daemon.</li>\r\n\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\tSimultaneous CGI request causes the CGI script to be copied and loaded into memory as many times as there are requests. However, with servlets, there are the same amount of threads as requests, but there will only be one copy of the servlet class created in memory that stays there also between requests.</li>\r\n\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\tOnly a single instance answers all requests concurrently. This reduces memory usage and makes the management of persistent data easy.</li>\r\n\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\tA servlet can be run by a servlet engine in a restrictive environment, called a&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sandbox" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Sandbox">sandbox</a>. This is similar to an&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Applet" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Applet">applet</a>&nbsp;that runs in the sandbox of the Web browser. This makes a restrictive use of potentially harmful servlets possible.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-r1_1-2" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_Servlet#cite_note-r1-1" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>2<span>]</span></a></sup></li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<h3 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; font-weight: bold; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.3em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: initial; border-bottom-style: none; border-bottom-color: initial; width: auto; font-size: 17px; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; ">\r\n\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Java_Servlet&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: Life cycle of a servlet">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="Life_cycle_of_a_servlet">Life cycle of a servlet</span></h3>\r\n<ol style="line-height: 1.5em; margin-top: 0.3em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 3.2em; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-left: 0px; list-style-image: none; ">\r\n\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\tThe container calls the&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nullary_constructor" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Nullary constructor">no-arg constructor</a>.</li>\r\n\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\tThe Web container calls the&nbsp;<code style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); ">init()</code>&nbsp;method. This method initializes the servlet and must be called before life of a servlet, the&nbsp;<code style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); ">init()</code>&nbsp;method is called only once.</li>\r\n\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\tAfter initialization, the servlet can service client requests. Each&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HTTP_request#Request_message" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="HTTP request">request</a>&nbsp;is serviced in its own separate thread. The Web container calls the&nbsp;<code style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); ">service()</code>&nbsp;method of the servlet for every request. The&nbsp;<code style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); ">service()</code>&nbsp;method determines the kind of request being made and dispatches it to an appropriate method to handle the request. The developer of the servlet must provide an implementation for these methods. If a request for a method that is not implemented by the servlet is made, the method of the parent class is called, typically resulting in an error being returned to the requester.</li>\r\n\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\tFinally, the Web container calls the&nbsp;<code style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); ">destroy()</code>&nbsp;method that takes the servlet out of service. The&nbsp;<code style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); ">destroy()</code>&nbsp;method, like&nbsp;<code style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); ">init()</code>, is called only once in the lifecycle of a servlet.</li>\r\n</ol>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t<b>Three methods</b>&nbsp;are central to the life cycle of a servlet. These are&nbsp;<i><b>init( )</b></i>,&nbsp;<i><b>service( )</b></i>, and&nbsp;<i><b>destroy( )</b></i>. They are implemented by every servlet and are invoked at specific times by the server. Let us consider a typical user scenario to understand when these methods are called.</p>\r\n<ol style="line-height: 1.5em; margin-top: 0.3em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 3.2em; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-left: 0px; list-style-image: none; ">\r\n\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\tAssume that a user enters a Uniform Resource Locator (URL) to a web browser.\r\n\t\t<ul style="line-height: 1.5em; list-style-type: square; margin-top: 0.3em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 1.5em; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-left: 0px; list-style-image: url(data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAUAAAANCAMAAABW4lS6AAAAGXRFWHRTb2Z0d2FyZQBBZG9iZSBJbWFnZVJlYWR5ccllPAAAAAZQTFRFAFKM////QIUK9QAAAAJ0Uk5T/wDltzBKAAAAGklEQVR42mJgBAEGokgGBjBGBxBxsBqAAAMACHwALd5r8ygAAAAASUVORK5CYII=); ">\r\n\t\t\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\tThe browser then generates an HTTP request for this URL.</li>\r\n\t\t\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\tThis request is then sent to the appropriate server.</li>\r\n\t\t</ul>\r\n\t</li>\r\n\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\tThe HTTP request is received by the web server.\r\n\t\t<ul style="line-height: 1.5em; list-style-type: square; margin-top: 0.3em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 1.5em; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-left: 0px; list-style-image: url(data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAUAAAANCAMAAABW4lS6AAAAGXRFWHRTb2Z0d2FyZQBBZG9iZSBJbWFnZVJlYWR5ccllPAAAAAZQTFRFAFKM////QIUK9QAAAAJ0Uk5T/wDltzBKAAAAGklEQVR42mJgBAEGokgGBjBGBxBxsBqAAAMACHwALd5r8ygAAAAASUVORK5CYII=); ">\r\n\t\t\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\tThe server maps this request to a particular servlet.</li>\r\n\t\t\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\tThe servlet is dynamically retrieved and loaded into the address space of the server.</li>\r\n\t\t</ul>\r\n\t</li>\r\n\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\tThe server invokes the&nbsp;<code style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); ">init()</code>&nbsp;method of the servlet.\r\n\t\t<ul style="line-height: 1.5em; list-style-type: square; margin-top: 0.3em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 1.5em; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-left: 0px; list-style-image: url(data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAUAAAANCAMAAABW4lS6AAAAGXRFWHRTb2Z0d2FyZQBBZG9iZSBJbWFnZVJlYWR5ccllPAAAAAZQTFRFAFKM////QIUK9QAAAAJ0Uk5T/wDltzBKAAAAGklEQVR42mJgBAEGokgGBjBGBxBxsBqAAAMACHwALd5r8ygAAAAASUVORK5CYII=); ">\r\n\t\t\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\tThis method is invoked only when the servlet is first loaded into memory.</li>\r\n\t\t\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\tIt is possible to pass initialization parameters to the servlet so it may configure itself.</li>\r\n\t\t</ul>\r\n\t</li>\r\n\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\tThe server invokes the&nbsp;<code style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); ">service()</code>&nbsp;method of the servlet.\r\n\t\t<ul style="line-height: 1.5em; list-style-type: square; margin-top: 0.3em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 1.5em; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-left: 0px; list-style-image: url(data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAUAAAANCAMAAABW4lS6AAAAGXRFWHRTb2Z0d2FyZQBBZG9iZSBJbWFnZVJlYWR5ccllPAAAAAZQTFRFAFKM////QIUK9QAAAAJ0Uk5T/wDltzBKAAAAGklEQVR42mJgBAEGokgGBjBGBxBxsBqAAAMACHwALd5r8ygAAAAASUVORK5CYII=); ">\r\n\t\t\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\tThis method is called to process the HTTP request.</li>\r\n\t\t\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\tYou will see that it is possible for the servlet to read data that has been provided in the HTTP request.</li>\r\n\t\t\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\tIt may also formulate an HTTP response for the client.</li>\r\n\t\t</ul>\r\n\t</li>\r\n\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\tThe servlet remains in the server&rsquo;s address space and is available to process any other HTTP requests received from clients.\r\n\t\t<ul style="line-height: 1.5em; list-style-type: square; margin-top: 0.3em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 1.5em; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-left: 0px; list-style-image: url(data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAUAAAANCAMAAABW4lS6AAAAGXRFWHRTb2Z0d2FyZQBBZG9iZSBJbWFnZVJlYWR5ccllPAAAAAZQTFRFAFKM////QIUK9QAAAAJ0Uk5T/wDltzBKAAAAGklEQVR42mJgBAEGokgGBjBGBxBxsBqAAAMACHwALd5r8ygAAAAASUVORK5CYII=); ">\r\n\t\t\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\tThe&nbsp;<code style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); ">service()</code>&nbsp;method is called for each HTTP request.</li>\r\n\t\t</ul>\r\n\t</li>\r\n\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\tThe server may, at some point, decide to unload the servlet from its memory.\r\n\t\t<ul style="line-height: 1.5em; list-style-type: square; margin-top: 0.3em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 1.5em; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-left: 0px; list-style-image: url(data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAUAAAANCAMAAABW4lS6AAAAGXRFWHRTb2Z0d2FyZQBBZG9iZSBJbWFnZVJlYWR5ccllPAAAAAZQTFRFAFKM////QIUK9QAAAAJ0Uk5T/wDltzBKAAAAGklEQVR42mJgBAEGokgGBjBGBxBxsBqAAAMACHwALd5r8ygAAAAASUVORK5CYII=); ">\r\n\t\t\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\tThe algorithms by which this determination is made are specific to each server.</li>\r\n\t\t</ul>\r\n\t</li>\r\n\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\tThe server calls the&nbsp;<code style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); ">destroy()</code>&nbsp;method to relinquish any resources such as file handles that are allocated for the servlet; important data may be saved to a persistent store.</li>\r\n\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\tThe memory allocated for the servlet and its objects can then be garbage collected.</li>\r\n</ol>\r\n<h3 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; font-weight: bold; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.3em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: initial; border-bottom-style: none; border-bottom-color: initial; width: auto; font-size: 17px; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; ">\r\n\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Java_Servlet&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: Example">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="Example">Example</span></h3>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tThe following example servlet prints a &quot;Hello world&quot; HTML page.</p>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tNote that&nbsp;<code style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); ">HttpServlet</code>&nbsp;is a subclass of&nbsp;<code style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); ">GenericServlet</code>, an implementation of the&nbsp;<code style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); ">Servlet</code>&nbsp;interface.</p>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tThe&nbsp;<code style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); ">service()</code>&nbsp;method dispatches requests to the methods&nbsp;<code style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); ">doGet()</code>,&nbsp;<code style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); ">doPost()</code>,&nbsp;<code style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); ">doPut()</code>,&nbsp;<code style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); ">doDelete()</code>, and so on; according to the HTTP request.</p>\r\n<div class="mw-geshi" dir="ltr" style="padding-top: 1em; padding-right: 1em; padding-bottom: 1em; padding-left: 1em; border-top-width: 1px; border-right-width: 1px; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-left-width: 1px; border-top-style: dashed; border-right-style: dashed; border-bottom-style: dashed; border-left-style: dashed; border-top-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); border-right-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); border-bottom-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); border-left-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); color: black; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); line-height: 1.1em; text-align: left; ">\r\n\t<div class="java source-java" style="line-height: normal; font-family: monospace; ">\r\n\t\t<pre class="de1" style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New' !important; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-left: 0px; border-top-width: 0px; border-right-width: 0px; border-bottom-width: 0px; border-left-width: 0px; border-top-style: none; border-right-style: none; border-bottom-style: none; border-left-style: none; border-top-color: white; border-right-color: white; border-bottom-color: white; border-left-color: white; color: black; background-color: initial; line-height: normal; font: normal normal normal 1em/1.2em monospace; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; vertical-align: top; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; ">\r\n<span class="kw1" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">import</span> <span class="co2" style="color: rgb(0, 102, 153); ">java.io.IOException</span><span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">;</span>\r\n \r\n \r\n<span class="kw1" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">public</span> <span class="kw1" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">class</span> HelloWorld <span class="kw1" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">extends</span> HttpServlet <span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">{</span>\r\n  <span class="kw1" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">public</span> <span class="kw4" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 102); font-weight: bold; ">void</span> doGet<span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">(</span>HttpServletRequest request, HttpServletResponse response<span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">)</span> <span class="kw1" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">throws</span> ServletException, <span class="kw3" style="color: rgb(0, 51, 153); ">IOException</span> <span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">{</span>\r\n    <span class="kw3" style="color: rgb(0, 51, 153); ">PrintWriter</span> out <span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">=</span> response.<span class="me1" style="color: rgb(0, 102, 51); ">getWriter</span><span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">(</span><span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">)</span><span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">;</span>\r\n    out.<span class="me1" style="color: rgb(0, 102, 51); ">println</span><span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">(</span><span class="st0" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 255); ">&quot;&lt;!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC <span class="es0" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 153); font-weight: bold; ">\\&quot;</span>-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.0 &quot;</span> <span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">+</span>\r\n                <span class="st0" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 255); ">&quot;Transitional//EN<span class="es0" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 153); font-weight: bold; ">\\&quot;</span>&gt;<span class="es0" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 153); font-weight: bold; ">\\n</span>&quot;</span> <span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">+</span>\r\n                <span class="st0" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 255); ">&quot;&lt;html&gt;<span class="es0" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 153); font-weight: bold; ">\\n</span>&quot;</span> <span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">+</span>\r\n                <span class="st0" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 255); ">&quot;&lt;head&gt;&lt;title&gt;Hello World&lt;/title&gt;&lt;/head&gt;<span class="es0" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 153); font-weight: bold; ">\\n</span>&quot;</span> <span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">+</span>\r\n                <span class="st0" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 255); ">&quot;&lt;body&gt;<span class="es0" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 153); font-weight: bold; ">\\n</span>&quot;</span> <span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">+</span>\r\n                <span class="st0" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 255); ">&quot;&lt;h1&gt;Hello, world!&lt;/h1&gt;<span class="es0" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 153); font-weight: bold; ">\\n</span>&quot;</span> <span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">+</span>\r\n                <span class="st0" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 255); ">&quot;&lt;/body&gt;&lt;/html&gt;&quot;</span><span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">)</span><span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">;</span>\r\n  <span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">}</span>\r\n<span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">}</span>\r\n</pre>\r\n\t</div>\r\n</div>\r\n<h2 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.6em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-bottom-style: solid; border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); width: auto; font-size: 19px; ">\r\n\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Java_Servlet&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: Usage">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="Usage">Usage</span></h2>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tServlets are most often used to</p>\r\n<ul style="line-height: 1.5em; list-style-type: square; margin-top: 0.3em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 1.5em; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-left: 0px; list-style-image: url(data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAUAAAANCAMAAABW4lS6AAAAGXRFWHRTb2Z0d2FyZQBBZG9iZSBJbWFnZVJlYWR5ccllPAAAAAZQTFRFAFKM////QIUK9QAAAAJ0Uk5T/wDltzBKAAAAGklEQVR42mJgBAEGokgGBjBGBxBxsBqAAAMACHwALd5r8ygAAAAASUVORK5CYII=); ">\r\n\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\tprocess or store data that was submitted from an HTML form</li>\r\n\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\tprovide dynamic content such as the results of a database query</li>\r\n\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\tmanage state information that does not exist in the stateless HTTP protocol, such as filling the articles into the shopping cart of the appropriate customer.</li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<h2 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.6em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-bottom-style: solid; border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); width: auto; font-size: 19px; ">\r\n\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Java_Servlet&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: See also">edit</a>]</span></h2>\r\n<div>\r\n\t&nbsp;</div>\r\n	2	2011-10-20 17:43:47.471614	2011-10-20 17:43:47.471614	89	\N	latest
9	Java Programming/JSP	1	<p>\r\n\t&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tThe&nbsp;<b>Java Server Pages</b>&nbsp;is a technology for merging&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/HTML_Programming" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="HTML Programming">HTML</a>&nbsp;with Java to produce dynamic web content. To enable this, an HTML page is given the file extension&nbsp;<code style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); ">.jsp</code>&nbsp;and an XML markup page is given the file extension&nbsp;<code style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); ">.jspx</code>, so that the Java server (container) will recognise that the file requires JSP processing before sending it to the client. The Java is inserted either as embedded scriptlets or as standard/custom tags, thus producing an HTML page that can be displayed on a web browser. If used correctly, the source file can be read and interpreted by WYSIWYG editing programs or HTML programmers that have little to no experience with Java, while still giving the server side functionality of a servlet. In fact a JSP page becomes a standard Java servlet at compile time. JSP pages embed tags within a HTML or XML document that are evaluated by the compiler. This can be done through the use of scripting tags similar to those used in&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/PHP" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="PHP">PHP</a>&nbsp;or<a href="http://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/ASP.NET" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="ASP.NET">ASP.NET</a>, or by importing a JSP Tag Library.</p>\r\n<table class="toc" id="toc" style="font-size: 12px; border-top-style: solid; border-right-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); border-right-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); border-left-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); padding-top: 5px; padding-right: 5px; padding-bottom: 5px; padding-left: 5px; ">\r\n\t<tbody>\r\n\t\t<tr>\r\n\t\t\t<td>\r\n\t\t\t\t<div id="toctitle" style="direction: ltr; text-align: center; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<h2 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; font-weight: bold; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.6em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; border-bottom-style: none; width: auto; font-size: 12px; display: inline; border-top-style: none; border-right-style: none; border-left-style: none; border-width: initial; border-color: initial; padding-right: 0px; padding-left: 0px; border-width: initial; border-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\tContents</h2>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t&nbsp;<span class="toctoggle" style="font-size: 11px; ">&nbsp;[<a class="internal" href="http://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/Java_Programming/JSP#" id="togglelink" style="text-decoration: none; ">hide</a>]&nbsp;</span></div>\r\n\t\t\t\t<ul style="line-height: 1.5em; list-style-type: none; margin-top: 0.3em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.3em; margin-left: 0px; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-left: 0px; list-style-image: none; text-align: left; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-1" style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href="http://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/Java_Programming/JSP#Example" style="text-decoration: none; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href="http://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/Java_Programming/JSP#JSP_2.0" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span class="tocnumber">8</span>&nbsp;<span class="toctext">JSP 2.0</span></a>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<ul style="line-height: 1.5em; list-style-type: none; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 2em; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-left: 0px; list-style-image: none; text-align: left; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-15" style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href="http://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/Java_Programming/JSP#JSP_Technology_in_the_Java_EE_5_Platform" style="text-decoration: none; "><span class="tocnumber">8.1</span>&nbsp;<span class="toctext">JSP Technology in the Java EE 5 Platform</span></a></li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t</ul>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t</li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-16" style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href="http://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/Java_Programming/JSP#Environment" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href="http://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/Java_Programming/JSP#Model-view-controller_paradigm" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span class="tocnumber">10</span>&nbsp;<span class="toctext">Model-view-controller paradigm</span></a></li>\r\n\t\t\t\t</ul>\r\n\t\t\t</td>\r\n\t\t</tr>\r\n\t</tbody>\r\n</table>\r\n<h2 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.6em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-bottom-style: solid; border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); width: auto; font-size: 19px; ">\r\n\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikibooks.org/w/index.php?title=Java_Programming/JSP&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: Example">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="Example">Example</span></h2>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tRegardless of whether the JSP compiler generates Java source code for a servlet or emits the byte code directly, it is helpful to understand how the JSP compiler transforms the page into a Java servlet. For example, consider the following input JSP and its resulting generated Java Servlet.</p>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t<b>Input JSP</b></p>\r\n<div class="mw-geshi" dir="ltr" style="padding-top: 1em; padding-right: 1em; padding-bottom: 1em; padding-left: 1em; border-top-width: 1px; border-right-width: 1px; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-left-width: 1px; border-top-style: dashed; border-right-style: dashed; border-bottom-style: dashed; border-left-style: dashed; border-top-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); border-right-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); border-bottom-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); border-left-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); color: black; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); line-height: 1.1em; text-align: left; ">\r\n\t<div class="html4strict source-html4strict" style="line-height: normal; font-family: monospace; ">\r\n\t\t<pre class="de1" style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New' !important; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-left: 0px; border-top-width: 0px; border-right-width: 0px; border-bottom-width: 0px; border-left-width: 0px; border-top-style: none; border-right-style: none; border-bottom-style: none; border-left-style: none; border-top-color: white; border-right-color: white; border-bottom-color: white; border-left-color: white; color: black; background-color: initial; line-height: normal; font: normal normal normal 1em/1.2em monospace; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; vertical-align: top; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; ">\r\n <span class="sc2" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">&lt;%@ page errorPage<span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(102, 204, 102); ">=</span><span class="st0" style="color: rgb(255, 0, 0); ">&quot;myerror.jsp&quot;</span> %&gt;</span>\r\n <span class="sc2" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">&lt;%@ page import<span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(102, 204, 102); ">=</span><span class="st0" style="color: rgb(255, 0, 0); ">&quot;com.foo.bar&quot;</span> %&gt;</span>\r\n \r\n <span class="sc2" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">&lt;<span class="kw2" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">html</span>&gt;</span>\r\n <span class="sc2" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">&lt;<span class="kw2" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">head</span>&gt;</span>\r\n <span class="sc2" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">&lt;%! int serverInstanceVariable <span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(102, 204, 102); ">=</span> <span class="nu0" style="color: rgb(204, 102, 204); ">1</span>;%&gt;</span>\r\n \r\n <span class="sc2" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">&lt;% int localStackBasedVariable <span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(102, 204, 102); ">=</span> <span class="nu0" style="color: rgb(204, 102, 204); ">1</span>; %&gt;</span>\r\n <span class="sc2" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">&lt;<span class="kw2" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">table</span>&gt;</span>\r\n <span class="sc2" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">&lt;<span class="kw2" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">tr</span>&gt;&lt;<span class="kw2" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">td</span>&gt;&lt;%<span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(102, 204, 102); ">=</span> toStringOrBlank<span class="br0" style="color: rgb(102, 204, 102); ">(</span> <span class="st0" style="color: rgb(255, 0, 0); ">/</span><span class="kw2" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">td</span>&gt;&lt;<span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(102, 204, 102); ">/</span><span class="kw2" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">tr</span>&gt;</span>\r\n</pre>\r\n\t</div>\r\n</div>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t<b>Resulting servlet</b></p>\r\n<div class="mw-geshi" dir="ltr" style="padding-top: 1em; padding-right: 1em; padding-bottom: 1em; padding-left: 1em; border-top-width: 1px; border-right-width: 1px; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-left-width: 1px; border-top-style: dashed; border-right-style: dashed; border-bottom-style: dashed; border-left-style: dashed; border-top-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); border-right-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); border-bottom-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); border-left-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); color: black; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); line-height: 1.1em; text-align: left; ">\r\n\t<div class="java source-java" style="line-height: normal; font-family: monospace; ">\r\n\t\t<pre class="de1" style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New' !important; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-left: 0px; border-top-width: 0px; border-right-width: 0px; border-bottom-width: 0px; border-left-width: 0px; border-top-style: none; line-height: normal; font: normal normal normal 1em/1.2em monospace; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; vertical-align: top; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; ">\r\n <span class="kw1" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">package</span> <span class="co2" style="color: rgb(0, 102, 153); ">jsp_servlet</span><span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">;</span>\r\n <span class="kw1" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">import</span> <span class="co2" style="color: rgb(0, 102, 153); ">java.util.*</span><span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">;</span>\r\n <span class="kw1" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">import</span> <span class="co2" style="color: rgb(0, 102, 153); ">java.io.*</span><span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">;</span>\r\n <span class="kw1" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">import</span> <span class="co2" style="color: rgb(0, 102, 153); ">javax.servlet.*</span><span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">;</span>\r\n <span class="kw1" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">import</span> <span class="co2" style="color: rgb(0, 102, 153); ">javax.servlet.http.*</span><span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">;</span>\r\n <span class="kw1" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">import</span> <span class="co2" style="color: rgb(0, 102, 153); ">javax.servlet.jsp.*</span><span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">;</span>\r\n <span class="kw1" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">import</span> <span class="co2" style="color: rgb(0, 102, 153); ">javax.servlet.jsp.tagext.*</span><span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">;</span>\r\n \r\n <span class="kw1" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">import</span> <span class="co2" style="color: rgb(0, 102, 153); ">com.foo.bar</span><span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">;</span> <span class="co1" style="color: rgb(102, 102, 102); font-style: italic; ">// Imported as a result of &lt;%@ page import=&quot;com.foo.bar&quot; %&gt;</span>\r\n <span class="kw1" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">import</span> &hellip;\r\n \r\n <span class="kw1" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">class</span> _myservlet <span class="kw1" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">implements</span> javax.<span class="me1" style="color: rgb(0, 102, 51); ">servlet</span>.<span class="me1" style="color: rgb(0, 102, 51); ">Servlet</span>, javax.<span class="me1" style="color: rgb(0, 102, 51); ">servlet</span>.<span class="me1" style="color: rgb(0, 102, 51); ">jsp</span>.<span class="me1" style="color: rgb(0, 102, 51); ">HttpJspPage</span> <span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">{</span>\r\n    <span class="co1" style="color: rgb(102, 102, 102); ">;</span>\r\n    &hellip;\r\n \r\n    <span class="kw1" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">public</span> <span class="kw4" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 102); font-weight: bold; ">void</span> _jspService<span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">(</span> javax.<span class="me1" style="color: rgb(0, 102, 51); ">servlet</span>.<span class="me1" style="color: rgb(0, 102, 51); ">http</span>.<span class="me1" style="color: rgb(0, 102, 51); ">HttpServletRequest</span> request,\r\n    javax.<span class="me1" style="color: rgb(0, 102, 51); ">servlet</span>.<span class="me1" style="color: rgb(0, 102, 51); ">http</span>.<span class="me1" style="color: rgb(0, 102, 51); ">HttpServletResponse</span> response <span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">)</span>\r\n    <span class="kw1" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">throws</span> javax.<span class="me1" style="color: rgb(0, 102, 51); ">servlet</span>.<span class="me1" style="color: rgb(0, 102, 51); ">ServletException</span>,\r\n    java.<span class="me1" style="color: rgb(0, 102, 51); ">io</span>.<span class="kw3" style="color: rgb(0, 51, 153); ">IOException</span>\r\n    <span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">{</span>\r\n        javax.<span class="me1" style="color: rgb(0, 102, 51); ">servlet</span>.<span class="me1" style="color: rgb(0, 102, 51); ">ServletConfig</span> config <span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">=</span> &hellip;<span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">;</span> <span class="co1" style="color: rgb(102, 102, 102); font-style: italic; ">// Get the servlet config</span>\r\n        <span class="kw3" style="color: rgb(0, 51, 153); ">Object</span> page <span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">=</span> <span class="kw1" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">this</span><span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">;</span>\r\n        PageContext pageContext <span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">=</span> &hellip;<span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">;</span>            <span class="co1" style="color: rgb(102, 102, 102); font-style: italic; ">// Get the page context for this request</span>\r\n        javax.<span class="me1" style="color: rgb(0, 102, 51); ">servlet</span>.<span class="me1" style="color: rgb(0, 102, 51); ">jsp</span>.<span class="me1" style="color: rgb(0, 102, 51); ">JspWriter</span> out <span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">=</span> pageContext.<span class="me1" style="color: rgb(0, 102, 51); ">getOut</span><span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">(</span><span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">)</span><span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">;</span>\r\n        HttpSession session <span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">=</span> request.<span class="me1" style="color: rgb(0, 102, 51); ">getSession</span><span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">(</span> <span class="kw2" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 102); font-weight: bold; ">true</span> <span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">)</span><span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">;</span>\r\n        <span class="kw1" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">try</span> <span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">{</span>\r\n            out.<span class="me1" style="color: rgb(0, 102, 51); ">print</span><span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">(</span> <span class="st0" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 255); ">&quot;&lt;html&gt;<span class="es0" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 153); font-weight: bold; ">\\r</span><span class="es0" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 153); font-weight: bold; ">\\n</span>&quot;</span> <span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">)</span><span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">;</span>\r\n            out.<span class="me1" style="color: rgb(0, 102, 51); ">print</span><span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">(</span> <span class="st0" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 255); ">&quot;&lt;head&gt;<span class="es0" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 153); font-weight: bold; ">\\r</span><span class="es0" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 153); font-weight: bold; ">\\n</span>&quot;</span> <span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">)</span><span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">;</span>\r\n            &hellip;\r\n            <span class="co1" style="color: rgb(102, 102, 102); font-style: italic; ">// From &lt;% int localStackBasedVariable = 1; %&gt;</span>\r\n            <span class="kw4" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 102); font-weight: bold; ">int</span> localStackBasedVariable <span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">=</span> <span class="nu0" style="color: rgb(204, 102, 204); ">1</span><span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">;</span>\r\n            &hellip;\r\n            out.<span class="me1" style="color: rgb(0, 102, 51); ">print</span><span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">(</span> <span class="st0" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 255); ">&quot;&lt;table&gt;<span class="es0" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 153); font-weight: bold; ">\\r</span><span class="es0" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 153); font-weight: bold; ">\\n</span>&quot;</span> <span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">)</span><span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">;</span>\r\n            out.<span class="me1" style="color: rgb(0, 102, 51); ">print</span><span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">(</span> <span class="st0" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 255); ">&quot; &lt;tr&gt;&lt;td&gt;&quot;</span> <span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">)</span><span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">;</span>\r\n            <span class="co1" style="color: rgb(102, 102, 102); font-style: italic; ">// From &lt;%= toStringOrBlank( &quot;expanded inline data &quot; + 1 ) %&gt;</span>\r\n            out.<span class="me1" style="color: rgb(0, 102, 51); ">print</span><span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">(</span> toStringOrBlank<span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">(</span> <span class="st0" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 255); ">&quot;expanded inline data &quot;</span> <span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">+</span> <span class="nu0" style="color: rgb(204, 102, 204); ">1</span> <span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">)</span> <span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">)</span><span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">;</span>\r\n            out.<span class="me1" style="color: rgb(0, 102, 51); ">print</span><span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">(</span> <span class="st0" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 255); ">&quot; &lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;<span class="es0" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 153); font-weight: bold; ">\\r</span><span class="es0" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 153); font-weight: bold; ">\\n</span>&quot;</span> <span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">)</span><span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">;</span>\r\n            &hellip;\r\n        <span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">}</span> <span class="kw1" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">catch</span> <span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">(</span> <span class="kw3" style="color: rgb(0, 51, 153); ">Exception</span> _exception <span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">)</span> <span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">{</span>\r\n            <span class="co1" style="color: rgb(102, 102, 102); font-style: italic; ">// Clean up and redirect to error page in &lt;%@ page errorPage=&quot;myerror.jsp&quot; %&gt;</span>\r\n        <span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">}</span>\r\n    <span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">}</span>\r\n <span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">}</span>\r\n</pre>\r\n\t</div>\r\n</div>\r\n<h2 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.6em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-bottom-style: solid; border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); width: auto; font-size: 19px; ">\r\n\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikibooks.org/w/index.php?title=Java_Programming/JSP&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: JSP Directives">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="JSP_Directives">JSP Directives</span></h2>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tJSP directives are added at the top of a JSP page. These directives control how the JSP compiler generates the servlet. The following directives are available:</p>\r\n<dl style="margin-top: 0.2em; margin-bottom: 0.5em; ">\r\n\t<dt style="font-weight: bold; margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\tinclude&nbsp;</dt>\r\n\t<dd style="line-height: 1.5em; margin-left: 2em; margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\tThe include directive informs the JSP compiler to include a complete file into the current file. It is as if the contents of the included file were pasted directly into the original file. This functionality is similar to the one provided by the C preprocessor. Included files generally have the extension &quot;jspf&quot; (for JSP&nbsp;<b>Fragment</b>):</dd>\r\n</dl>\r\n<pre style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; padding-top: 1em; padding-right: 1em; padding-bottom: 1em; padding-left: 1em; border-top-width: 1px; border-right-width: 1px; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-left-width: 1px; border-top-style: dashed; border-right-style: dashed; border-bottom-style: dashed; border-left-style: dashed; border-top-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); border-right-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); border-bottom-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); border-left-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); color: black; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); line-height: 1.3em; ">\r\n&lt;%@ include file=&quot;somefile.jspf&quot; %&gt; \r\n</pre>\r\n<dl style="margin-top: 0.2em; margin-bottom: 0.5em; ">\r\n\t<dt style="font-weight: bold; margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\tpage&nbsp;</dt>\r\n\t<dd style="line-height: 1.5em; margin-left: 2em; margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\tThe page directive has several attributes:\r\n\t\t<dl style="margin-top: 0.2em; margin-bottom: 0.5em; ">\r\n\t\t\t<dt style="font-weight: bold; margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\timport&nbsp;</dt>\r\n\t\t\t<dd style="line-height: 1.5em; margin-left: 2em; margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\tResults in a Java&nbsp;<code style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); ">import</code>&nbsp;statement being inserted into the resulting file.</dd>\r\n\t\t\t<dt style="font-weight: bold; margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\tcontentType&nbsp;</dt>\r\n\t\t\t<dd style="line-height: 1.5em; margin-left: 2em; margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\tSpecifies the content that is generated. This should be used if HTML is not used or if the character set is not the default character set.</dd>\r\n\t\t\t<dt style="font-weight: bold; margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\terrorPage&nbsp;</dt>\r\n\t\t\t<dd style="line-height: 1.5em; margin-left: 2em; margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\tIndicates the address of the page that should be shown if an exception occurs while processing the HTTP request.</dd>\r\n\t\t\t<dt style="font-weight: bold; margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\tisErrorPage&nbsp;</dt>\r\n\t\t\t<dd style="line-height: 1.5em; margin-left: 2em; margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\tIf set to true, it indicates that this is the error page. Default value is&nbsp;<i>false</i>.</dd>\r\n\t\t\t<dt style="font-weight: bold; margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\tisThreadSafe&nbsp;</dt>\r\n\t\t\t<dd style="line-height: 1.5em; margin-left: 2em; margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\tA boolean indicating whether the resulting servlet is thread safe.</dd>\r\n\t\t\t<dt style="font-weight: bold; margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\tautoFlush&nbsp;</dt>\r\n\t\t\t<dd style="line-height: 1.5em; margin-left: 2em; margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\tTo autoflush the contents. A value of true, the default, indicates that the buffer should be flushed when it is full. A value of false, rarely used, indicates that an exception should be thrown when the buffer overflows. A value of false is illegal when also using buffer=&quot;none&quot;.</dd>\r\n\t\t\t<dt style="font-weight: bold; margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\tsession</dt>\r\n\t\t\t<dd style="line-height: 1.5em; margin-left: 2em; margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\tTo maintain session. A value of true (the default) indicates that the predefined variable session (of type HttpSession) should be bound to the existing session if one exists, otherwise a new session should be created and bound to it. A value of false indicates that no sessions will be used, and attempts to access the variable session will result in errors at the time the JSP page is translated into a servlet.</dd>\r\n\t\t\t<dt style="font-weight: bold; margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\tbuffer</dt>\r\n\t\t\t<dd style="line-height: 1.5em; margin-left: 2em; margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\tTo set Buffer Size. The default is 8k and it is advisable that you increase it.</dd>\r\n\t\t\t<dt style="font-weight: bold; margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\tisELIgnored</dt>\r\n\t\t\t<dd style="line-height: 1.5em; margin-left: 2em; margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\tDefines whether EL (<i>Expression Language</i>) expressions are ignored when the JSP is translated.</dd>\r\n\t\t\t<dt style="font-weight: bold; margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\tlanguage</dt>\r\n\t\t\t<dd style="line-height: 1.5em; margin-left: 2em; margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\tDefines the scripting language used in scriptlets, expressions and declarations. Right now, the only possible value is &quot;java&quot;.</dd>\r\n\t\t\t<dt style="font-weight: bold; margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\textends</dt>\r\n\t\t\t<dd style="line-height: 1.5em; margin-left: 2em; margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\tDefines the superclass of the class this JSP will become. You won&#39;t use this unless you&nbsp;<u>really</u>&nbsp;know what you&#39;re doing - it overrides the class hierarchy provided by the Container.</dd>\r\n\t\t\t<dt style="font-weight: bold; margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\tinfo</dt>\r\n\t\t\t<dd style="line-height: 1.5em; margin-left: 2em; margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\tDefines a String that gets put into the translated page, just so that you can get it using the generated servlet&#39;s inherited getServletInfo() method.</dd>\r\n\t\t\t<dt style="font-weight: bold; margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\tpageEncoding</dt>\r\n\t\t\t<dd style="line-height: 1.5em; margin-left: 2em; margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\tDefines the character encoding for the JSP. The default is &quot;ISO-8859-1&quot;(unless the contentType attribute already defines a character encoding, or the page uses XML document syntax).</dd>\r\n\t\t</dl>\r\n\t</dd>\r\n</dl>\r\n<pre style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; padding-top: 1em; padding-right: 1em; padding-bottom: 1em; padding-left: 1em; border-top-width: 1px; border-right-width: 1px; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-left-width: 1px; border-top-style: dashed; border-right-style: dashed; border-bottom-style: dashed; border-left-style: dashed; border-top-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); border-right-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); border-bottom-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); border-left-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); color: black; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); line-height: 1.3em; ">\r\n&lt;%@ page import=&quot;java.util.*&quot; %&gt; &lt;%-- example import --%&gt;\r\n&lt;%@ page contentType=&quot;text/html&quot; %&gt; &lt;%-- example contentType --%&gt;\r\n&lt;%@ page isErrorPage=&quot;false&quot; %&gt; &lt;%-- example for non error page --%&gt;\r\n&lt;%@ page isThreadSafe=&quot;true&quot; %&gt; &lt;%-- example for a thread safe JSP --%&gt;\r\n&lt;%@ page session=&quot;true&quot; %&gt; &lt;%-- example for using session binding --%&gt;\r\n&lt;%@ page autoFlush=&quot;true&quot; %&gt; &lt;%-- example for setting autoFlush --%&gt;\r\n&lt;%@ page buffer=&quot;20kb&quot; %&gt; &lt;%-- example for setting Buffer Size --%&gt;\r\n</pre>\r\n<dl style="margin-top: 0.2em; margin-bottom: 0.5em; ">\r\n\t<dd style="line-height: 1.5em; margin-left: 2em; margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t<b>Note:</b>&nbsp;Only the &quot;import&quot; page directive can be used multiple times in the same JSP.</dd>\r\n\t<dt style="font-weight: bold; margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\ttaglib&nbsp;</dt>\r\n\t<dd style="line-height: 1.5em; margin-left: 2em; margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\tThe taglib directive indicates that a JSP tag library is to be used. The directive requires that a prefix be specified (much like a namespace in C++) and the URI for the tag library description.</dd>\r\n</dl>\r\n<pre style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; padding-top: 1em; padding-right: 1em; padding-bottom: 1em; padding-left: 1em; border-top-width: 1px; border-right-width: 1px; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-left-width: 1px; border-top-style: dashed; border-right-style: dashed; border-bottom-style: dashed; border-left-style: dashed; border-top-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); border-right-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); border-bottom-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); border-left-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); color: black; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); line-height: 1.3em; ">\r\n&lt;%@ taglib prefix=&quot;myprefix&quot; uri=&quot;taglib/mytag.tld&quot; %&gt;\r\n</pre>\r\n<h2 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.6em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-bottom-style: solid; border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); width: auto; font-size: 19px; ">\r\n\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikibooks.org/w/index.php?title=Java_Programming/JSP&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: Implicit Objects">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="Implicit_Objects">Implicit Objects</span></h2>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tThe JSP container exposes a number of implicit objects that can be used by the programmer:</p>\r\n<dl style="margin-top: 0.2em; margin-bottom: 0.5em; ">\r\n\t<dt style="font-weight: bold; margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\tout&nbsp;</dt>\r\n\t<dd style="line-height: 1.5em; margin-left: 2em; margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\tThe&nbsp;<a class="external text" href="http://java.sun.com/javaee/5/docs/api/javax/servlet/jsp/JspWriter.html" rel="nofollow" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(51, 102, 187); background-image: url(data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAoAAAAKCAYAAACNMs+9AAAAGXRFWHRTb2Z0d2FyZQBBZG9iZSBJbWFnZVJlYWR5ccllPAAAAFZJREFUeF59z4EJADEIQ1F36k7u5E7ZKXeUQPACJ3wK7UNokVxVk9kHnQH7bY9hbDyDhNXgjpRLqFlo4M2GgfyJHhjq8V4agfrgPQX3JtJQGbofmCHgA/nAKks+JAjFAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC); background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; padding-right: 13px; background-position: 100% 50%; background-repeat: no-repeat no-repeat; ">JspWriter</a>&nbsp;used to write the data to the response stream.</dd>\r\n\t<dt style="font-weight: bold; margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\tpage&nbsp;</dt>\r\n\t<dd style="line-height: 1.5em; margin-left: 2em; margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\tThe servlet itself.</dd>\r\n\t<dt style="font-weight: bold; margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\tpageContext&nbsp;</dt>\r\n\t<dd style="line-height: 1.5em; margin-left: 2em; margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\tA&nbsp;<a class="external text" href="http://java.sun.com/javaee/5/docs/api/javax/servlet/jsp/PageContext.html" rel="nofollow" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(51, 102, 187); background-image: url(data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAoAAAAKCAYAAACNMs+9AAAAGXRFWHRTb2Z0d2FyZQBBZG9iZSBJbWFnZVJlYWR5ccllPAAAAFZJREFUeF59z4EJADEIQ1F36k7u5E7ZKXeUQPACJ3wK7UNokVxVk9kHnQH7bY9hbDyDhNXgjpRLqFlo4M2GgfyJHhjq8V4agfrgPQX3JtJQGbofmCHgA/nAKks+JAjFAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC); background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; padding-right: 13px; background-position: 100% 50%; background-repeat: no-repeat no-repeat; ">PageContext</a>&nbsp;instance that contains data associated with the whole page. A given HTML page may be passed among multiple JSPs.</dd>\r\n\t<dt style="font-weight: bold; margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\trequest&nbsp;</dt>\r\n\t<dd style="line-height: 1.5em; margin-left: 2em; margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\tThe&nbsp;<a class="external text" href="http://java.sun.com/javaee/5/docs/api/javax/servlet/http/HttpServletRequest.html" rel="nofollow" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(51, 102, 187); background-image: url(data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAoAAAAKCAYAAACNMs+9AAAAGXRFWHRTb2Z0d2FyZQBBZG9iZSBJbWFnZVJlYWR5ccllPAAAAFZJREFUeF59z4EJADEIQ1F36k7u5E7ZKXeUQPACJ3wK7UNokVxVk9kHnQH7bY9hbDyDhNXgjpRLqFlo4M2GgfyJHhjq8V4agfrgPQX3JtJQGbofmCHgA/nAKks+JAjFAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC); background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; padding-right: 13px; background-position: 100% 50%; background-repeat: no-repeat no-repeat; ">HttpServletRequest</a>&nbsp;object that provides HTTP request information.</dd>\r\n\t<dt style="font-weight: bold; margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\tresponse&nbsp;</dt>\r\n\t<dd style="line-height: 1.5em; margin-left: 2em; margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\tThe&nbsp;<a class="external text" href="http://java.sun.com/javaee/5/docs/api/javax/servlet/http/HttpServletResponse.html" rel="nofollow" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(51, 102, 187); background-image: url(data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAoAAAAKCAYAAACNMs+9AAAAGXRFWHRTb2Z0d2FyZQBBZG9iZSBJbWFnZVJlYWR5ccllPAAAAFZJREFUeF59z4EJADEIQ1F36k7u5E7ZKXeUQPACJ3wK7UNokVxVk9kHnQH7bY9hbDyDhNXgjpRLqFlo4M2GgfyJHhjq8V4agfrgPQX3JtJQGbofmCHgA/nAKks+JAjFAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC); background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; padding-right: 13px; background-position: 100% 50%; background-repeat: no-repeat no-repeat; ">HttpServletResponse</a>&nbsp;object that can be used to send data back to the client.</dd>\r\n\t<dt style="font-weight: bold; margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\tsession&nbsp;</dt>\r\n\t<dd style="line-height: 1.5em; margin-left: 2em; margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\tThe&nbsp;<a class="external text" href="http://java.sun.com/javaee/5/docs/api/javax/servlet/http/HttpSession.html" rel="nofollow" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(51, 102, 187); background-image: url(data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAoAAAAKCAYAAACNMs+9AAAAGXRFWHRTb2Z0d2FyZQBBZG9iZSBJbWFnZVJlYWR5ccllPAAAAFZJREFUeF59z4EJADEIQ1F36k7u5E7ZKXeUQPACJ3wK7UNokVxVk9kHnQH7bY9hbDyDhNXgjpRLqFlo4M2GgfyJHhjq8V4agfrgPQX3JtJQGbofmCHgA/nAKks+JAjFAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC); background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; padding-right: 13px; background-position: 100% 50%; background-repeat: no-repeat no-repeat; ">HttpSession</a>&nbsp;object that can be used to track information about a user from one request to another.</dd>\r\n\t<dt style="font-weight: bold; margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\tconfig&nbsp;</dt>\r\n\t<dd style="line-height: 1.5em; margin-left: 2em; margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\tProvides servlet configuration data.</dd>\r\n\t<dt style="font-weight: bold; margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\tapplication&nbsp;</dt>\r\n\t<dd style="line-height: 1.5em; margin-left: 2em; margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\tData shared by all JSPs and servlets in the application.</dd>\r\n\t<dt style="font-weight: bold; margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\texception&nbsp;</dt>\r\n\t<dd style="line-height: 1.5em; margin-left: 2em; margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\tExceptions not caught by application code.</dd>\r\n</dl>\r\n<h2 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.6em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-bottom-style: solid; border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); width: auto; font-size: 19px; ">\r\n\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikibooks.org/w/index.php?title=Java_Programming/JSP&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: Scripting Elements">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="Scripting_Elements">Scripting Elements</span></h2>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tThere are&nbsp;<i>three</i>&nbsp;basic kinds of scripting elements that allow java code to be inserted directly into the servlet.</p>\r\n<ul style="line-height: 1.5em; list-style-type: square; margin-top: 0.3em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 1.5em; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-left: 0px; list-style-image: url(data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAUAAAANCAMAAABW4lS6AAAAGXRFWHRTb2Z0d2FyZQBBZG9iZSBJbWFnZVJlYWR5ccllPAAAAAZQTFRFAFKM////QIUK9QAAAAJ0Uk5T/wDltzBKAAAAGklEQVR42mJgBAEGokgGBjBGBxBxsBqAAAMACHwALd5r8ygAAAAASUVORK5CYII=); ">\r\n\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\tA&nbsp;<i><b>declaration</b></i>&nbsp;tag places a variable definition inside the body of the java servlet class. Static data members may be defined as well. Also inner classes should be defined here.</li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<pre style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; padding-top: 1em; padding-right: 1em; padding-bottom: 1em; padding-left: 1em; border-top-width: 1px; border-right-width: 1px; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-left-width: 1px; border-top-style: dashed; border-right-style: dashed; border-bottom-style: dashed; border-left-style: dashed; border-top-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); border-right-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); border-bottom-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); border-left-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); color: black; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); line-height: 1.3em; ">\r\n&lt;%! int serverInstanceVariable = 1; %&gt;\r\n</pre>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tDeclaration tags also allow methods to be defined.</p>\r\n<pre style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; padding-top: 1em; padding-right: 1em; padding-bottom: 1em; padding-left: 1em; border-top-width: 1px; border-right-width: 1px; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-left-width: 1px; border-top-style: dashed; border-right-style: dashed; border-bottom-style: dashed; border-left-style: dashed; border-top-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); border-right-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); border-bottom-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); border-left-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); color: black; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); line-height: 1.3em; ">\r\n&lt;%!\r\n   /** \r\n    * Converts the Object into a string or if\r\n    * the Object is null, it returns the empty string.\r\n    */\r\n   public String toStringOrBlank( Object obj ){\r\n       if(obj != null){\r\n           return obj.toString();\r\n       }\r\n       return &quot;&quot;;\r\n   }\r\n%&gt;\r\n</pre>\r\n<ul style="line-height: 1.5em; list-style-type: square; margin-top: 0.3em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 1.5em; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-left: 0px; list-style-image: url(data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAUAAAANCAMAAABW4lS6AAAAGXRFWHRTb2Z0d2FyZQBBZG9iZSBJbWFnZVJlYWR5ccllPAAAAAZQTFRFAFKM////QIUK9QAAAAJ0Uk5T/wDltzBKAAAAGklEQVR42mJgBAEGokgGBjBGBxBxsBqAAAMACHwALd5r8ygAAAAASUVORK5CYII=); ">\r\n\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\tA&nbsp;<i><b>scriptlet</b></i>&nbsp;tag places all of the statements contained within it, inside the&nbsp;<code style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); ">_jspService()</code>&nbsp;method of the java servlet class.</li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<pre style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; padding-top: 1em; padding-right: 1em; padding-bottom: 1em; padding-left: 1em; border-top-width: 1px; border-right-width: 1px; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-left-width: 1px; border-top-style: dashed; border-right-style: dashed; border-bottom-style: dashed; border-left-style: dashed; border-top-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); border-right-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); border-bottom-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); border-left-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); color: black; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); line-height: 1.3em; ">\r\n&lt;% int localStackBasedVariable = 1;\r\nout.println(localStackBasedVariable); %&gt;\r\n</pre>\r\n<ul style="line-height: 1.5em; list-style-type: square; margin-top: 0.3em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 1.5em; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-left: 0px; list-style-image: url(data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAUAAAANCAMAAABW4lS6AAAAGXRFWHRTb2Z0d2FyZQBBZG9iZSBJbWFnZVJlYWR5ccllPAAAAAZQTFRFAFKM////QIUK9QAAAAJ0Uk5T/wDltzBKAAAAGklEQVR42mJgBAEGokgGBjBGBxBxsBqAAAMACHwALd5r8ygAAAAASUVORK5CYII=); ">\r\n\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\tAn&nbsp;<i><b>expression</b></i>&nbsp;tag places an expression to be evaluated inside the java servlet class. Expressions should not be terminated with a semi-colon .</li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<pre style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; padding-top: 1em; padding-right: 1em; padding-bottom: 1em; padding-left: 1em; border-top-width: 1px; border-right-width: 1px; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-left-width: 1px; border-top-style: dashed; border-right-style: dashed; border-bottom-style: dashed; border-left-style: dashed; border-top-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); border-right-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); border-bottom-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); border-left-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); color: black; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); line-height: 1.3em; ">\r\n&lt;%= &quot;expanded inline data &quot; + 1 %&gt;\r\n</pre>\r\n<h2 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.6em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-bottom-style: solid; border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); width: auto; font-size: 19px; ">\r\n\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikibooks.org/w/index.php?title=Java_Programming/JSP&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: JSP actions">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="JSP_actions">JSP actions</span></h2>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tJSP actions are XML tags that invoke built-in web server functionality. They are executed at runtime. Some are standard and some are custom (which are developed by Java developers). The following list contains the standard ones:</p>\r\n<dl style="margin-top: 0.2em; margin-bottom: 0.5em; ">\r\n\t<dt style="font-weight: bold; margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\tjsp:include&nbsp;</dt>\r\n\t<dd style="line-height: 1.5em; margin-left: 2em; margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\tSimilar to a subroutine, the Java servlet temporarily hands the request and response off to the specified JavaServer Page. Control will then return to the current JSP, once the other JSP has finished. Using this, JSP code will be shared between multiple other JSPs, rather than duplicated.</dd>\r\n\t<dt style="font-weight: bold; margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\tjsp:param&nbsp;</dt>\r\n\t<dd style="line-height: 1.5em; margin-left: 2em; margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\tCan be used inside a jsp:include, jsp:forward or jsp:params block. Specifies a parameter that will be added to the request&#39;s current parameters.</dd>\r\n\t<dt style="font-weight: bold; margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\tjsp:forward&nbsp;</dt>\r\n\t<dd style="line-height: 1.5em; margin-left: 2em; margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\tUsed to hand off the request and response to another JSP or servlet. Control will never return to the current JSP.</dd>\r\n\t<dt style="font-weight: bold; margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\tjsp:plugin&nbsp;</dt>\r\n\t<dd style="line-height: 1.5em; margin-left: 2em; margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\tOlder versions of Netscape Navigator and Internet Explorer used different tags to embed an applet. This action generates the browser specific tag needed to include an applet.</dd>\r\n\t<dt style="font-weight: bold; margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\tjsp:fallback&nbsp;</dt>\r\n\t<dd style="line-height: 1.5em; margin-left: 2em; margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\tThe content to show if the browser does not support applets.</dd>\r\n\t<dt style="font-weight: bold; margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\tjsp:getProperty&nbsp;</dt>\r\n\t<dd style="line-height: 1.5em; margin-left: 2em; margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\tGets a property from the specified JavaBean.</dd>\r\n</dl>\r\n<h3 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; font-weight: bold; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.3em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: initial; border-bottom-style: none; border-bottom-color: initial; width: auto; font-size: 17px; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; ">\r\n\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikibooks.org/w/index.php?title=Java_Programming/JSP&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: Examples of tags">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="Examples_of_tags">Examples of tags</span></h3>\r\n<h4 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; The request handling does not return to this page.</p>\r\n<h4 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial;
