font-weight: bold; ">&lt;/jsp:params<span class="re2" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">&gt;</span></span></span>\r\n <span class="sc3" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); "><span class="re1" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">&lt;jsp:fallback<span class="re2" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">&gt;</span></span></span>\r\n Your browser does not support applets.\r\n <span class="sc3" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); "><span class="re1" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">&lt;/jsp:fallback<span class="re2" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">&gt;</span></span></span>\r\n <span class="sc3" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); "><span class="re1" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">&lt;/jsp:plugin<span class="re2" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">&gt;</span></span></span>\r\n</pre>\r\n\t</div>\r\n</div>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tThe plugin example illustrates a &lt;html&gt; uniform way of embedding applets in a web page. Before the advent of the &lt;<i>OBJECT</i>&gt; tag, there was no common way of embedding applets. Currently, the jsp:plugin tag does not allow for dynamically called applets. For example, jsp:params cannot be used with a charting applet that requires the data points to be passed in as parameters unless the number of data points is constant. You cannot, for example, loop through a ResultSet to create the jsp:param tags. Each jsp:param tag must be hand-coded.&nbsp;<u>However, each of those jsp:param tags can have a dynamic name and a dynamic value.</u><b>??? REALLY&nbsp;??? If the parameter name may be dynamic, provide a code example, otherwise I believe it must be a hard-coded literal string (which makes it brittle as compared to being able to use a Java constant supplied by some interface definition).</b></p>\r\n<h2 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.6em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-bottom-style: solid; border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); width: auto; font-size: 19px; ">\r\n\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikibooks.org/w/index.php?title=Java_Programming/JSP&amp;action=edit&amp;section=10" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: JSP Tag Libraries">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="JSP_Tag_Libraries">JSP Tag Libraries</span></h2>\r\n	2	2011-10-20 17:46:57.726572	2011-10-20 17:46:57.726572	99	\N	latest
10	Javadoc	1	<p>\r\n\t&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t<b>Javadoc</b>&nbsp;is a&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Documentation_generator" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Documentation generator">documentation generator</a>&nbsp;from&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sun_Microsystems" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Sun Microsystems">Sun Microsystems</a>&nbsp;for generating&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Application_programming_interface" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Application programming interface">API</a>&nbsp;documentation in&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HTML" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="HTML">HTML</a>&nbsp;format from&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_(programming_language)" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Java (programming language)">Java</a>&nbsp;source code.</p>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tThe &quot;doc comments&quot; format used by Javadoc is the de facto industry standard for documenting Java classes. Some&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Integrated_Development_Environment" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Integrated Development Environment">IDEs</a>,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-0" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Javadoc#cite_note-0" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>1<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;such as&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Netbeans" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Netbeans">Netbeans</a>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eclipse_(software)" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Eclipse (software)">Eclipse</a>&nbsp;automatically generate Javadoc HTML. Many file editors assist the user in producing Javadoc source and use the Javadoc info as internal references for the programmer.</p>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tJavadoc also provides an API for creating&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Doclets" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Doclets">doclets</a>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<a class="new" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Taglets&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(186, 0, 0); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Taglets (page does not exist)">taglets</a>, which allows you to analyze the structure of a Java application. This is how&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/JDiff" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="JDiff">JDiff</a>&nbsp;can generate reports of what changed between two versions of an API.</p>\r\n<table class="toc" id="toc" style="font-size: 12px; border-top-style: solid; border-right-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); border-right-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); border-left-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); padding-top: 5px; padding-right: 5px; padding-bottom: 5px; padding-left: 5px; ">\r\n\t<tbody>\r\n\t\t<tr>\r\n\t\t\t<td>\r\n\t\t\t\t<div id="toctitle" style="direction: ltr; text-align: center; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<h2 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; font-weight: bold; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.6em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; border-bottom-style: none; width: auto; font-size: 12px; display: inline; border-top-style: none; border-right-style: none; border-left-style: none; border-width: initial; border-color: initial; padding-right: 0px; padding-left: 0px; border-width: initial; border-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\tContents</h2>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t&nbsp;<span class="toctoggle" style="font-size: 11px; ">&nbsp;[<a class="internal" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Javadoc#" id="togglelink" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; ">hide</a>]&nbsp;</span></div>\r\n\t\t\t\t<ul style="line-height: 1.5em; list-style-type: none; margin-top: 0.3em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-left: 0px; list-style-image: none; text-align: left; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-1" style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Javadoc#Structure_of_a_Javadoc_comment" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span class="tocnumber">1</span>&nbsp;<span class="toctext">Structure of a Javadoc comment</span></a></li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-2" style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Javadoc#Overview_of_Javadoc" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span class="tocnumber">2</span>&nbsp;<span class="toctext">Overview of Javadoc</span></a></li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-3" style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Javadoc#Example" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span class="tocnumber">3</span>&nbsp;<span class="toctext">Example</span></a></li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-4" style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Javadoc#See_also" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span class="tocnumber">4</span>&nbsp;<span class="toctext">See also</span></a></li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-5" style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Javadoc#Notes" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span class="tocnumber">5</span>&nbsp;<span class="toctext">Notes</span></a></li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-6" style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Javadoc#External_links" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span class="tocnumber">6</span>&nbsp;<span class="toctext">External links</span></a></li>\r\n\t\t\t\t</ul>\r\n\t\t\t</td>\r\n\t\t</tr>\r\n\t</tbody>\r\n</table>\r\n<h2 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.6em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-bottom-style: solid; border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); width: auto; font-size: 19px; ">\r\n\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Javadoc&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: Structure of a Javadoc comment">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="Structure_of_a_Javadoc_comment">Structure of a Javadoc comment</span></h2>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tA Javadoc comment is set off from code by standard multi-line comment tags&nbsp;<code style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); ">/*</code>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<code style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); ">*/</code>. The opening tag, however, has an extra asterisk, as in&nbsp;<code style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); ">/**</code>.</p>\r\n<ol style="line-height: 1.5em; margin-top: 0.3em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 3.2em; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-left: 0px; list-style-image: none; ">\r\n\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\tThe first paragraph is a description of the method documented.</li>\r\n\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\tFollowing the description are a varying number of descriptive tags, signifying:\r\n\t\t<ol style="line-height: 1.5em; margin-top: 0.3em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 3.2em; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-left: 0px; list-style-image: none; ">\r\n\t\t\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\tThe parameters of the method (<code style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); ">@param</code>)</li>\r\n\t\t\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\tWhat the method returns (<code style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); ">@return</code>)</li>\r\n\t\t\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\tAny exceptions the method may throw (<code style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); ">@throws</code>)</li>\r\n\t\t\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\tOther less-common tags such as&nbsp;<code style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); ">@see</code>&nbsp;(a &quot;see also&quot; tag)</li>\r\n\t\t</ol>\r\n\t</li>\r\n</ol>\r\n<h2 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.6em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-bottom-style: solid; border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); width: auto; font-size: 19px; ">\r\n\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Javadoc&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: Overview of Javadoc">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="Overview_of_Javadoc">Overview of Javadoc</span></h2>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tThe basic structure of writing document comments is embed them inside&nbsp;<code style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); ">/** ... */</code>. The Javadoc is written next to the items without any separating newline. The class declaration usually contains:</p>\r\n<div class="mw-geshi" dir="ltr" style="padding-top: 1em; padding-right: 1em; padding-bottom: 1em; padding-left: 1em; border-top-width: 1px; border-right-width: 1px; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-left-width: 1px; border-top-style: dashed; border-right-style: dashed; border-bottom-style: dashed; border-left-style: dashed; border-top-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); border-right-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); border-bottom-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); border-left-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); color: black; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); line-height: 1.1em; text-align: left; ">\r\n\t<div class="java source-java" style="line-height: normal; font-family: monospace; ">\r\n\t\t<pre class="de1" style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New' !important; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-left: 0px; border-top-width: 0px; border-right-width: 0px; border-bottom-width: 0px; border-left-width: 0px; border-top-style: none; border-right-style: none; border-bottom-style: none; border-left-style: none; border-top-color: white; border-right-color: white; border-bottom-color: white; border-left-color: white; color: black; background-color: initial; line-height: normal; font: normal normal normal 1em/1.2em monospace; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; vertical-align: top; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; ">\r\n<span class="co3" style="color: rgb(0, 128, 0); font-style: italic; font-weight: bold; ">/**\r\n * @author      Firstname Lastname &lt;address @ example.com&gt;\r\n * @version     1.6                 (the version of the package this class was first added to)                   \r\n * @since       2010-03-31          (a date or the version number of this program)\r\n */</span>\r\n<span class="kw1" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">public</span> <span class="kw1" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">class</span> Test <span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">{</span>\r\n  <span class="co1" style="color: rgb(102, 102, 102); font-style: italic; ">// class body</span>\r\n<span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">}</span>\r\n</pre>\r\n\t</div>\r\n</div>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tFor methods there is (1) a short, concise, one line description to explain what the item does. This is followed by [2] a longer description that may span in multiple paragraphs. In those the details can be explained in full. This section, marked in brackets [], is optional. Last, there is (3) a tag section to list the accepted input arguments and return values of the method.</p>\r\n<div class="mw-geshi" dir="ltr" style="padding-top: 1em; padding-right: 1em; padding-bottom: 1em; padding-left: 1em; border-top-width: 1px; border-right-width: 1px; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-left-width: 1px; border-top-style: dashed; border-right-style: dashed; border-bottom-style: dashed; border-left-style: dashed; border-top-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); border-right-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); border-bottom-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); border-left-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); color: black; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); line-height: 1.1em; text-align: left; ">\r\n\t<div class="java source-java" style="line-height: normal; font-family: monospace; ">\r\n\t\t<pre class="de1" style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New' !important; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-left: 0px; border-top-width: 0px; border-right-width: 0px; border-bottom-width: 0px; border-left-width: 0px; border-top-style: none; border-right-style: none; border-bottom-style: none; border-left-style: none; border-top-color: white; border-right-color: white; border-bottom-color: white; border-left-color: white; color: black; background-color: initial; line-height: normal; font: normal normal normal 1em/1.2em monospace; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; vertical-align: top; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; ">\r\n<span class="co3" style="color: rgb(0, 128, 0); font-style: italic; font-weight: bold; ">/**\r\n * Short one line description.                           (1)\r\n *\r\n * Longer description. If there were any, it would be    [2]\r\n * here.\r\n *\r\n * @param  variable Description text text text.           (3)\r\n * @return Description text text text.\r\n */</span>\r\n</pre>\r\n\t</div>\r\n</div>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tVariables are documented similarly to methods with the exception that part (3) is omitted. Here the variable contains only the short description:</p>\r\n<div class="mw-geshi" dir="ltr" style="padding-top: 1em; padding-right: 1em; padding-bottom: 1em; padding-left: 1em; border-top-width: 1px; border-right-width: 1px; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-left-width: 1px; border-top-style: dashed; border-right-style: dashed; border-bottom-style: dashed; border-left-style: dashed; border-top-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); border-right-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); border-bottom-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); border-left-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); color: black; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); line-height: 1.1em; text-align: left; ">\r\n\t<div class="java source-java" style="line-height: normal; font-family: monospace; ">\r\n\t\t<pre class="de1" style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New' !important; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-left: 0px; border-top-width: 0px; border-right-width: 0px; border-bottom-width: 0px; border-left-width: 0px; border-top-style: none; border-right-style: none; border-bottom-style: none; border-left-style: none; border-top-color: white; border-right-color: white; border-bottom-color: white; border-left-color: white; color: black; background-color: initial; line-height: normal; font: normal normal normal 1em/1.2em monospace; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; vertical-align: top; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; ">\r\n<span class="co3" style="color: rgb(0, 128, 0); font-style: italic; font-weight: bold; ">/**\r\n * Description of the variable here.\r\n */</span>\r\n<span class="kw1" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">private</span> <span class="kw4" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 102); font-weight: bold; ">int</span> debug <span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">=</span> <span class="nu0" style="color: rgb(204, 102, 204); ">0</span><span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">;</span>\r\n</pre>\r\n\t</div>\r\n</div>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tSome of the available Javadoc tags<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-1" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Javadoc#cite_note-1" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>2<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;are listed in the table below:</p>\r\n<table class="wikitable" style="font-size: 13px; margin-top: 1em; margin-right: 1em; margin-bottom: 1em; margin-left: 0px; background-image: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); border-top-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); border-right-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); border-left-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); border-top-style: solid; border-right-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-collapse: collapse; color: black; ">\r\n\t<tbody>\r\n\t\t<tr>\r\n\t\t\t<th style="border-top-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); border-right-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); border-left-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); border-top-style: solid; border-right-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; padding-top: 0.2em; padding-right: 0.2em; padding-bottom: 0.2em; padding-left: 0.2em; background-image: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: rgb(242, 242, 242); text-align: center; ">\r\n\t\t\t\tTag &amp; Parameter</th>\r\n\t\t\t<th style="border-top-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); border-right-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); border-left-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); border-top-style: solid; border-right-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; padding-top: 0.2em; padding-right: 0.2em; padding-bottom: 0.2em; padding-left: 0.2em; background-image: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: rgb(242, 242, 242); text-align: center; ">\r\n\t\t\t\tUsage</th>\r\n\t\t\t<th style="border-top-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); border-right-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); border-left-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); border-top-style: solid; border-right-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; padding-top: 0.2em; padding-right: 0.2em; padding-bottom: 0.2em; padding-left: 0.2em; background-image: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: rgb(242, 242, 242); text-align: center; ">\r\n\t\t\t\tApplies to</th>\r\n\t\t\t<th style="border-top-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); border-right-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); border-left-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); border-top-style: solid; border-right-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; padding-top: 0.2em; padding-right: 0.2em; padding-bottom: 0.2em; padding-left: 0.2em; background-image: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: rgb(242, 242, 242); text-align: center; ">\r\n\t\t\t\tSince</th>\r\n\t\t</tr>\r\n\t\t<tr>\r\n\t\t\t<td style="border-top-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); border-left-style: solid; padding-top: 0.2em; padding-right: 0.2em; padding-bottom: 0.2em; padding-left: 0.2em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\tDescribes an author.</td>\r\n\t\t\t<td style="border-top-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.6em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-bottom-style: solid; border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); width: auto; font-size: 19px; ">\r\n\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Javadoc&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: Example">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="Example">Example</span></h2>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tAn example of using Javadoc to document a method follows. Notice that spacing and number of characters in this example are as conventions state.</p>\r\n<div class="mw-geshi" dir="ltr" style="padding-top: 1em; padding-right: 1em; padding-bottom: 1em; padding-left: 1em; border-top-width: 1px; border-right-width: 1px; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-left-width: 1px; border-top-style: dashed; border-right-style: dashed; border-bottom-style: dashed; border-left-style: dashed; border-top-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); border-right-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); border-bottom-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); border-left-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); color: black; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); line-height: 1.1em; text-align: left; ">\r\n\t<div class="java source-java" style="line-height: normal; font-family: monospace; ">\r\n\t\t<pre class="de1" style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New' !important; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-left: 0px; border-top-width: 0px; border-right-width: 0px; border-bottom-width: 0px; border-left-width: 0px; border-top-style: none; border-right-style: none; border-bottom-style: none; border-left-style: none; border-top-color: white; border-right-color: white; border-bottom-color: white; border-left-color: white; color: black; background-color: initial; line-height: normal; font: normal normal normal 1em/1.2em monospace; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; vertical-align: top; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; ">\r\n<span class="co3" style="color: rgb(0, 128, 0); font-style: italic; font-weight: bold; ">/**\r\n * Validates a chess move.\r\n *\r\n * Use {@link #doMove(int, int, int, int)} to move a piece.\r\n *\r\n * @param theFromFile file from which a piece is being moved\r\n * @param theFromRank rank from which a piece is being moved\r\n * @param theToFile   file to which a piece is being moved\r\n * @param theToRank   rank to which a piece is being moved\r\n * @return            true if the move is valid, otherwise false\r\n */</span>\r\n<span class="kw4" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 102); font-weight: bold; ">boolean</span> isValidMove<span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">(</span><span class="kw4" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 102); font-weight: bold; ">int</span> theFromFile, <span class="kw4" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 102); font-weight: bold; ">int</span> theFromRank, <span class="kw4" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 102); font-weight: bold; ">int</span> theToFile, <span class="kw4" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 102); font-weight: bold; ">int</span> theToRank<span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">)</span>\r\n<span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">{</span>\r\n    ...\r\n<span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">}</span>\r\n \r\n<span class="co3" style="color: rgb(0, 128, 0); font-style: italic; font-weight: bold; ">/**\r\n * Moves a chess piece.\r\n *\r\n * @see java.math.RoundingMode\r\n */</span>\r\n<span class="kw4" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 102); font-weight: bold; ">boolean</span> doMove<span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">(</span><span class="kw4" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 102); font-weight: bold; ">int</span> theFromFile, <span class="kw4" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 102); font-weight: bold; ">int</span> theFromRank, <span class="kw4" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 102); font-weight: bold; ">int</span> theToFile, <span class="kw4" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 102); font-weight: bold; ">int</span> theToRank<span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">)</span>\r\n<span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">{</span>\r\n    ...\r\n<span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">}</span></pre>\r\n\t</div>\r\n</div>\r\n<p>\r\n\t&nbsp;</p>\r\n	2	2011-10-20 17:48:48.420803	2011-10-20 17:48:48.420803	99	\N	latest
11	Generics in Java	1	<p>\r\n\t&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t<b>Generics</b>&nbsp;are a facility of&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Generic_programming" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Generic programming">generic programming</a>&nbsp;that was added to the&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_(programming_language)" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Java (programming language)">Java programming language</a>&nbsp;in 2004 as part of&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_Platform,_Standard_Edition" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Java Platform, Standard Edition">J2SE</a>&nbsp;5.0. They allow &quot;a type or method to operate on objects of various types while providing compile-time type safety.&quot;<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-0" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Generics_in_Java#cite_note-0" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>1<span>]</span></a></sup>A common use of this feature is when using a&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_Collections" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Java Collections">Java Collection</a>&nbsp;that can hold objects of any type, to specify the specific type of object you will be storing in it.</p>\r\n<table class="toc" id="toc" style="font-size: 12px; border-top-style: solid; border-right-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); border-right-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); border-left-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); padding-top: 5px; padding-right: 5px; padding-bottom: 5px; padding-left: 5px; ">\r\n\t<tbody>\r\n\t\t<tr>\r\n\t\t\t<td>\r\n\t\t\t\t<div id="toctitle" style="direction: ltr; text-align: center; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<h2 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; font-weight: bold; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.6em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; border-bottom-style: none; width: auto; font-size: 12px; display: inline; border-top-style: none; border-right-style: none; border-left-style: none; border-width: initial; border-color: initial; padding-right: 0px; padding-left: 0px; border-width: initial; border-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\tContents</h2>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t&nbsp;<span class="toctoggle" style="font-size: 11px; ">&nbsp;[<a class="internal" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Generics_in_Java#" id="togglelink" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; ">hide</a>]&nbsp;</span></div>\r\n\t\t\t\t<ul style="line-height: 1.5em; list-style-type: none; margin-top: 0.3em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-left: 0px; list-style-image: none; text-align: left; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-1" style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Generics_in_Java#Hierarchy_and_classification" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span class="tocnumber">1</span>&nbsp;<span class="toctext">Hierarchy and classification</span></a></li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-2" style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Generics_in_Java#Motivation_for_generics" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span class="tocnumber">2</span>&nbsp;<span class="toctext">Motivation for generics</span></a></li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-3" style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Generics_in_Java#Wildcards" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span class="tocnumber">3</span>&nbsp;<span class="toctext">Wildcards</span></a></li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-4" style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Generics_in_Java#Generic_class_definitions" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span class="tocnumber">4</span>&nbsp;<span class="toctext">Generic class definitions</span></a></li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-5" style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Generics_in_Java#Generic_method_definitions" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span class="tocnumber">5</span>&nbsp;<span class="toctext">Generic method definitions</span></a></li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-6" style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Generics_in_Java#Generics_in_throws_clause" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span class="tocnumber">6</span>&nbsp;<span class="toctext">Generics in throws clause</span></a></li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-7" style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Generics_in_Java#Type_erasure" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span class="tocnumber">7</span>&nbsp;<span class="toctext">Type erasure</span></a></li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-8" style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Generics_in_Java#See_also" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span class="tocnumber">8</span>&nbsp;<span class="toctext">See also</span></a></li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-9" style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Generics_in_Java#References" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span class="tocnumber">9</span>&nbsp;<span class="toctext">References</span></a></li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-10" style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Generics_in_Java#External_links" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span class="tocnumber">10</span>&nbsp;<span class="toctext">External links</span></a></li>\r\n\t\t\t\t</ul>\r\n\t\t\t</td>\r\n\t\t</tr>\r\n\t</tbody>\r\n</table>\r\n<h2 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.6em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-bottom-style: solid; border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); width: auto; font-size: 19px; ">\r\n\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Generics_in_Java&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: Hierarchy and classification">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="Hierarchy_and_classification">Hierarchy and classification</span></h2>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tAs per&nbsp;<i>Java Language Specification</i><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-1" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Generics_in_Java#cite_note-1" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>2<span>]</span></a></sup>:</p>\r\n<ul style="line-height: 1.5em; list-style-type: square; margin-top: 0.3em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 1.5em; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-left: 0px; list-style-image: url(data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAUAAAANCAMAAABW4lS6AAAAGXRFWHRTb2Z0d2FyZQBBZG9iZSBJbWFnZVJlYWR5ccllPAAAAAZQTFRFAFKM////QIUK9QAAAAJ0Uk5T/wDltzBKAAAAGklEQVR42mJgBAEGokgGBjBGBxBxsBqAAAMACHwALd5r8ygAAAAASUVORK5CYII=); ">\r\n\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\tA&nbsp;<b>type variable</b>&nbsp;is an unqualified identifier. Type variables are introduced by generic class declarations, generic interface declarations, generic method declarations, and by generic constructor declarations.</li>\r\n\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\tA&nbsp;<b>class</b>&nbsp;is generic if it declares one or more type variables. These type variables are known as the type parameters of the class. It defines one or more type variables that act as parameters. A generic class declaration defines a set of parameterized types, one for each possible invocation of the type parameter section. All of these parameterized types share the same class at runtime.</li>\r\n\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\tAn&nbsp;<b>interface</b>&nbsp;is generic if it declares one or more type variables. These type variables are known as the type parameters of the interface. It defines one or more type variables that act as parameters. A generic interface declaration defines a set of types, one for each possible invocation of the type parameter section. All parameterized types share the same interface at runtime.</li>\r\n\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\tA&nbsp;<b>method</b>&nbsp;is generic if it declares one or more type variables. These type variables are known as the formal type parameters of the method. The form of the formal type parameter list is identical to a type parameter list of a class or interface.</li>\r\n\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\tA&nbsp;<b>constructor</b>&nbsp;can be declared as generic, independently of whether the class of the constructor is declared in is itself generic. A constructor is generic if it declares one or more type variables. These type variables are known as the formal type parameters of the constructor. The form of the formal type parameter list is identical to a type parameter list of a generic class or interface.</li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<h2 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.6em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-bottom-style: solid; border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); width: auto; font-size: 19px; ">\r\n\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Generics_in_Java&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: Motivation for generics">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="Motivation_for_generics">Motivation for generics</span></h2>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tThe following block of Java code illustrates a problem that exists when not using generics. First, it declares an&nbsp;<code style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); ">ArrayList</code>&nbsp;of type&nbsp;<code style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); ">Object</code>. Then, it adds a&nbsp;<code style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); ">String</code>&nbsp;to the&nbsp;<code style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); ">ArrayList</code>. Finally, it attempts to retrieve the added&nbsp;<code style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); ">String</code>&nbsp;and cast it to an&nbsp;<code style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); ">Integer</code>.</p>\r\n<div class="mw-geshi" dir="ltr" style="padding-top: 1em; padding-right: 1em; padding-bottom: 1em; padding-left: 1em; border-top-width: 1px; border-right-width: 1px; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-left-width: 1px; border-top-style: dashed; border-right-style: dashed; border-bottom-style: dashed; border-left-style: dashed; border-top-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); border-right-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); border-bottom-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); border-left-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); color: black; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); line-height: 1.1em; text-align: left; ">\r\n\t<div class="java source-java" style="line-height: normal; font-family: monospace; ">\r\n\t\t<pre class="de1" style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New' !important; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-left: 0px; border-top-width: 0px; border-right-width: 0px; border-bottom-width: 0px; border-left-width: 0px; border-top-style: none; border-right-style: none; border-bottom-style: none; border-left-style: none; border-top-color: white; border-right-color: white; border-bottom-color: white; border-left-color: white; color: black; background-color: initial; line-height: normal; font: normal normal normal 1em/1.2em monospace; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; vertical-align: top; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; ">\r\n  <span class="kw3" style="color: rgb(0, 51, 153); ">List</span> v <span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">=</span> <span class="kw1" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">new</span> <span class="kw3" style="color: rgb(0, 51, 153); ">ArrayList</span><span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">(</span><span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">)</span><span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">;</span>\r\n  v.<span class="me1" style="color: rgb(0, 102, 51); ">add</span><span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">(</span><span class="st0" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 255); ">&quot;test&quot;</span><span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">)</span><span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">;</span>\r\n  <span class="kw3" style="color: rgb(0, 51, 153); ">Integer</span> i <span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">=</span> <span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">(</span><span class="kw3" style="color: rgb(0, 51, 153); ">Integer</span><span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">)</span>v.<span class="me1" style="color: rgb(0, 102, 51); ">get</span><span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">(</span><span class="nu0" style="color: rgb(204, 102, 204); ">0</span><span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">)</span><span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">;</span>        <span class="co1" style="color: rgb(102, 102, 102); font-style: italic; ">// Run time error</span>\r\n</pre>\r\n\t</div>\r\n</div>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tAlthough the code compiles without error, it throws a runtime exception (<code style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); ">java.lang.ClassCastException</code>) when executing the third line of code. This type of problem can be avoided by using generics and is the primary motivation for using generics.</p>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tUsing generics, the above code fragment can be rewritten as follows:</p>\r\n<div class="mw-geshi" dir="ltr" style="padding-top: 1em; padding-right: 1em; padding-bottom: 1em; padding-left: 1em; border-top-width: 1px; border-right-width: 1px; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-left-width: 1px; border-top-style: dashed; border-right-style: dashed; border-bottom-style: dashed; border-left-style: dashed; border-top-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); border-right-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); border-bottom-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); border-left-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); color: black; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); line-height: 1.1em; text-align: left; ">\r\n\t<div class="java source-java" style="line-height: normal; font-family: monospace; ">\r\n\t\t<pre class="de1" style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New' !important; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-left: 0px; border-top-width: 0px; border-right-width: 0px; border-bottom-width: 0px; border-left-width: 0px; border-top-style: none; border-right-style: none; border-bottom-style: none; border-left-style: none; border-top-color: white; border-right-color: white; border-bottom-color: white; border-left-color: white; color: black; background-color: initial; line-height: normal; font: normal normal normal 1em/1.2em monospace; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; vertical-align: top; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; ">\r\n  List<span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">&lt;</span>String<span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">&gt;</span> v <span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">=</span> <span class="kw1" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">new</span> ArrayList<span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">&lt;</span>String<span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">&gt;</span><span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">(</span><span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">)</span><span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">;</span>\r\n  v.<span class="me1" style="color: rgb(0, 102, 51); ">add</span><span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">(</span><span class="st0" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 255); ">&quot;test&quot;</span><span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">)</span><span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">;</span>\r\n  <span class="kw3" style="color: rgb(0, 51, 153); ">Integer</span> i <span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">=</span> v.<span class="me1" style="color: rgb(0, 102, 51); ">get</span><span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">(</span><span class="nu0" style="color: rgb(204, 102, 204); ">0</span><span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">)</span><span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">;</span> <span class="co1" style="color: rgb(102, 102, 102); font-style: italic; ">// (type error)  Compile time error</span>\r\n</pre>\r\n\t</div>\r\n</div>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tThe type parameter&nbsp;<code style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); ">String</code>&nbsp;within the angle brackets declares the&nbsp;<code style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); ">ArrayList</code>&nbsp;to be constituted of&nbsp;<code style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); ">String</code>&nbsp;(a descendant of the&nbsp;<code style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); ">ArrayList</code>&#39;s generic&nbsp;<code style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); ">Object</code>&nbsp;constituents). With generics, it is no longer necessary to cast the third line to any particular type, because the result of&nbsp;<code style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); ">v.get(0)</code>&nbsp;is defined as&nbsp;<code style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); ">String</code>&nbsp;by the code generated by the compiler.</p>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tCompiling the third line of this fragment with J2SE 5.0 (or later) will yield a compile-time error because the compiler will detect that&nbsp;<code style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); ">v.get(0)</code>&nbsp;returns&nbsp;<code style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); ">String</code>&nbsp;instead of&nbsp;<code style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); ">Integer</code>. For a more elaborate example, see reference.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-2" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Generics_in_Java#cite_note-2" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>3<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tHere is a small excerpt from the definitions of the interfaces&nbsp;<code style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); ">List</code>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<code style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); ">Iterator</code>&nbsp;in package&nbsp;<b><code style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); "><a class="external text" href="http://download.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/util/package-summary.html" rel="nofollow" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(51, 102, 187); background-image: url(data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAoAAAAKCAYAAACNMs+9AAAAGXRFWHRTb2Z0d2FyZQBBZG9iZSBJbWFnZVJlYWR5ccllPAAAAFZJREFUeF59z4EJADEIQ1F36k7u5E7ZKXeUQPACJ3wK7UNokVxVk9kHnQH7bY9hbDyDhNXgjpRLqFlo4M2GgfyJHhjq8V4agfrgPQX3JtJQGbofmCHgA/nAKks+JAjFAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC); background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; padding-right: 13px; background-position: 100% 50%; background-repeat: no-repeat no-repeat; ">java.util</a></code></b>:</p>\r\n<div class="mw-geshi" dir="ltr" style="padding-top: 1em; padding-right: 1em; padding-bottom: 1em; padding-left: 1em; border-top-width: 1px; border-right-width: 1px; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-left-width: 1px; border-top-style: dashed; border-right-style: dashed; border-bottom-style: dashed; border-left-style: dashed; border-top-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); border-right-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); border-bottom-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); border-left-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); color: black; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); line-height: 1.1em; text-align: left; ">\r\n\t<div class="java source-java" style="line-height: normal; font-family: monospace; ">\r\n\t\t&nbsp;</div>\r\n</div>\r\n	2	2011-10-20 17:50:02.494446	2011-10-20 17:50:02.494446	7	\N	latest
12	Criticism of Java	1	<p>\r\n\t&nbsp;</p>\r\n<h2 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.6em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-bottom-style: solid; border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); width: auto; font-size: 19px; ">\r\n\t<span class="mw-headline" id="Language_syntax_and_semantics">Language syntax and semantics</span></h2>\r\n<h3 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; font-weight: bold; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.3em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: initial; border-bottom-style: none; border-bottom-color: initial; width: auto; font-size: 17px; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; ">\r\n\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Criticism_of_Java&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: Generics">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="Generics">Generics</span></h3>\r\n<div class="rellink" style="font-style: italic; padding-left: 2em; margin-bottom: 0.5em; ">\r\n\tFurther information:&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Generics_in_Java" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Generics in Java">Generics in Java</a></div>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tWhen&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Generic_programming" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Generic programming">generics</a>&nbsp;were added to Java 5.0, there was already a large framework of classes (many of which were already&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deprecation" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Deprecation">deprecated</a>), so generics were chosen to be implemented using&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Generics_in_Java#Type_erasure" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Generics in Java">erasure</a>&nbsp;to allow for&nbsp;<i>migration compatibility</i>&nbsp;and re-use of these existing classes. This limited the features that could be provided by this addition as compared to other languages.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-0" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_Java#cite_note-0" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>1<span>]</span></a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-1" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_Java#cite_note-1" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>2<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tBecause generics were implemented using&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Type_erasure" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Type erasure">type erasure</a>&nbsp;the actual type of a template parameter is unavailable at runtime. Thus, the following operations are not possible in java:<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-2" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_Java#cite_note-2" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>3<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n<div class="mw-geshi" dir="ltr" style="padding-top: 1em; padding-right: 1em; padding-bottom: 1em; padding-left: 1em; border-top-width: 1px; border-right-width: 1px; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-left-width: 1px; border-top-style: dashed; border-right-style: dashed; border-bottom-style: dashed; border-left-style: dashed; border-top-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); border-right-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); border-bottom-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); border-left-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); color: black; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); line-height: 1.1em; text-align: left; ">\r\n\t<div class="java source-java" style="line-height: normal; font-family: monospace; ">\r\n\t\t<pre class="de1" style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New' !important; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-left: 0px; border-top-width: 0px; border-right-width: 0px; border-bottom-width: 0px; border-left-width: 0px; border-top-style: none; border-right-style: none; border-bottom-style: none; border-left-style: none; border-top-color: white; border-right-color: white; border-bottom-color: white; border-left-color: white; color: black; background-color: initial; line-height: normal; font: normal normal normal 1em/1.2em monospace; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; vertical-align: top; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; ">\r\n<span class="kw1" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">public</span> <span class="kw1" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">class</span> MyClass<span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">&lt;</span>E<span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">&gt;</span> <span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">{</span>\r\n    <span class="kw1" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">public</span> <span class="kw1" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">static</span> <span class="kw4" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 102); font-weight: bold; ">void</span> myMethod<span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">(</span><span class="kw3" style="color: rgb(0, 51, 153); ">Object</span> item<span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">)</span> <span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">{</span>\r\n        <span class="kw1" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">if</span> <span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">(</span>item <span class="kw1" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">instanceof</span> E<span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">)</span> <span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">{</span>  <span class="co1" style="color: rgb(102, 102, 102); font-style: italic; ">//Compiler error</span>\r\n            ...\r\n        <span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">}</span>\r\n        E item2 <span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">=</span> <span class="kw1" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">new</span> E<span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">(</span><span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">)</span><span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">;</span>   <span class="co1" style="color: rgb(102, 102, 102); font-style: italic; ">//Compiler error</span>\r\n        E<span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">[</span><span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">]</span> iArray <span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">=</span> <span class="kw1" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">new</span> E<span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">[</span><span class="nu0" style="color: rgb(204, 102, 204); ">10</span><span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">]</span><span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">;</span> <span class="co1" style="color: rgb(102, 102, 102); font-style: italic; ">//Compiler error</span>\r\n    <span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">}</span>\r\n<span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">}</span>\r\n</pre>\r\n\t</div>\r\n</div>\r\n<h3 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; font-weight: bold; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.3em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: initial; border-bottom-style: none; border-bottom-color: initial; width: auto; font-size: 17px; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; ">\r\n\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Criticism_of_Java&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: Unsigned integer types">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="Unsigned_integer_types">Unsigned integer types</span></h3>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tJava lacks native&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Integer_(computer_science)" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Integer (computer science)">unsigned integer</a>&nbsp;types. Unsigned data is often generated from programs written in&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/C_(programming_language)" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="C (programming language)">C</a>&nbsp;and the lack of these types prevents direct data interchange between C and Java. Unsigned large numbers are also used in a number of numeric processing fields, including cryptography, which can make Java more inconvenient to use for these tasks.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-3" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_Java#cite_note-3" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>4<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;Although it is possible to partially circumvent this problem with conversion code and using larger data types, it makes using Java cumbersome for handling unsigned data. While a 32-bit signed integer may be used to hold a 16-bit unsigned value losslessly, a 32-bit unsigned value would require a 64bit signed integer, and a 64bit unsigned value cannot be stored using any integer type in Java because no type larger than 64 bits exists in the Java language. In all cases, the memory consumed is doubled, and any logic that depends on the rules of&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Two%27s_complement" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Two's complement">two&#39;s complement</a>&nbsp;overflow must typically be rewritten. If abstracted using functions, function calls become necessary for many operations which are native to some other languages. Alternatively, it is possible to use Java&#39;s signed integers to emulate unsigned integers of the same size, but this requires detailed knowledge of complex bitwise operations.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-4" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_Java#cite_note-4" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>5<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n<h2 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.6em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-bottom-style: solid; border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); width: auto; font-size: 19px; ">\r\n\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Criticism_of_Java&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: Floating point arithmetic">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="Floating_point_arithmetic">Floating point arithmetic</span></h2>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tWhile Java&#39;s floating point arithmetic is largely based on&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_754" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="IEEE 754">IEEE 754</a>&nbsp;(<i>Standard for Binary Floating-Point Arithmetic</i>), certain features are not supported even when using the&nbsp;<code style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Strictfp" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Strictfp">strictfp</a></code>&nbsp;modifier, such as Exception Flags and Directed Roundings &mdash; capabilities mandated by IEEE Standard 754. Additionally, the extended precision floating-point types permitted in 754 and present in many processors are not permitted in Java.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-5" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_Java#cite_note-5" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>6<span>]</span></a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-6" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_Java#cite_note-6" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial;
