background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>7<span>]</span></a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-7" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_Java#cite_note-7" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>8<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n<h2 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.6em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-bottom-style: solid; border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); width: auto; font-size: 19px; ">\r\n\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Criticism_of_Java&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: Performance">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="Performance">Performance</span></h2>\r\n<div class="rellink" style="font-style: italic; padding-left: 2em; margin-bottom: 0.5em; ">\r\n\tFurther information:&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_performance" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Java performance">Java performance</a></div>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tIn the early days of Java (before the&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HotSpot" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="HotSpot">HotSpot VM</a>&nbsp;was implemented in Java 1.3 in 2000) there were many criticisms of performance. Java has been demonstrated to run at a speed comparable with optimised native code, and modern JVM implementations are&nbsp;<a class="external text" href="http://shootout.alioth.debian.org/" rel="nofollow" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(51, 102, 187); background-image: url(data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAoAAAAKCAYAAACNMs+9AAAAGXRFWHRTb2Z0d2FyZQBBZG9iZSBJbWFnZVJlYWR5ccllPAAAAFZJREFUeF59z4EJADEIQ1F36k7u5E7ZKXeUQPACJ3wK7UNokVxVk9kHnQH7bY9hbDyDhNXgjpRLqFlo4M2GgfyJHhjq8V4agfrgPQX3JtJQGbofmCHgA/nAKks+JAjFAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC); background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; padding-right: 13px; background-position: 100% 50%; background-repeat: no-repeat no-repeat; ">regularly benchmarked</a>&nbsp;as one of the fastest language platforms available -- typically within a factor of 3 relative to C/C++.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-8" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_Java#cite_note-8" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>9<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_performance" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Java performance">Java&#39;s performance</a>&nbsp;has improved substantially since the early versions.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-LewisNeumann_9-0" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_Java#cite_note-LewisNeumann-9" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>10<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;Performance of&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/JIT_compiler" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="JIT compiler">JIT compilers</a>&nbsp;relative to native compilers has in some optimized tests been shown to be quite similar.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-LewisNeumann_9-1" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_Java#cite_note-LewisNeumann-9" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>10<span>]</span></a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-10" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_Java#cite_note-10" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>11<span>]</span></a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-11" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_Java#cite_note-11" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>12<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_bytecode" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Java bytecode">Java bytecode</a>&nbsp;can either be interpreted at run time by a virtual machine, or it can be compiled at load time or runtime into native code which runs directly on the computer&#39;s hardware. Interpretation is slower than native execution, and compilation at load time or runtime has an initial performance penalty for the compilation. Modern performance JVM implementations all use the compilation approach, so after the initial startup time the performance is equivalent to native code.</p>\r\n	2	2011-10-20 17:52:31.462193	2011-10-20 17:53:43.71081	9	\N	old
13	Criticism of Java	1	<p>\r\n\t&nbsp;</p>\r\n<h2 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.6em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-bottom-style: solid; border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); width: auto; font-size: 19px; ">\r\n\t<span class="mw-headline" id="Language_syntax_and_semantics">Language syntax and semantics</span></h2>\r\n<h3 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; font-weight: bold; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.3em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: initial; border-bottom-style: none; border-bottom-color: initial; width: auto; font-size: 17px; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; ">\r\n\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Criticism_of_Java&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: Generics">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="Generics">Generics</span></h3>\r\n<div class="rellink" style="font-style: italic; padding-left: 2em; margin-bottom: 0.5em; ">\r\n\tFurther information:&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Generics_in_Java" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Generics in Java">Generics in Java</a></div>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tWhen&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Generic_programming" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Generic programming">generics</a>&nbsp;were added to Java 5.0, there was already a large framework of classes (many of which were already&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deprecation" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Deprecation">deprecated</a>), so generics were chosen to be implemented using&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Generics_in_Java#Type_erasure" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Generics in Java">erasure</a>&nbsp;to allow for&nbsp;<i>migration compatibility</i>&nbsp;and re-use of these existing classes. This limited the features that could be provided by this addition as compared to other languages.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-0" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_Java#cite_note-0" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>1<span>]</span></a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-1" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_Java#cite_note-1" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>2<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tBecause generics were implemented using&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Type_erasure" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Type erasure">type erasure</a>&nbsp;the actual type of a template parameter is unavailable at runtime. Thus, the following operations are not possible in java:<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-2" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_Java#cite_note-2" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>3<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n<div class="mw-geshi" dir="ltr" style="padding-top: 1em; padding-right: 1em; padding-bottom: 1em; padding-left: 1em; border-top-width: 1px; border-right-width: 1px; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-left-width: 1px; border-top-style: dashed; border-right-style: dashed; border-bottom-style: dashed; border-left-style: dashed; border-top-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); border-right-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); border-bottom-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); border-left-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); color: black; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); line-height: 1.1em; text-align: left; ">\r\n\t<div class="java source-java" style="line-height: normal; font-family: monospace; ">\r\n\t\t<pre class="de1" style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New' !important; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-left: 0px; border-top-width: 0px; border-right-width: 0px; border-bottom-width: 0px; border-left-width: 0px; border-top-style: none; border-right-style: none; border-bottom-style: none; border-left-style: none; border-top-color: white; border-right-color: white; border-bottom-color: white; border-left-color: white; color: black; background-color: initial; line-height: normal; font: normal normal normal 1em/1.2em monospace; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; vertical-align: top; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; ">\r\n<span class="kw1" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">public</span> <span class="kw1" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">class</span> MyClass<span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">&lt;</span>E<span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">&gt;</span> <span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">{</span>\r\n    <span class="kw1" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">public</span> <span class="kw1" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">static</span> <span class="kw4" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 102); font-weight: bold; ">void</span> myMethod<span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">(</span><span class="kw3" style="color: rgb(0, 51, 153); ">Object</span> item<span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">)</span> <span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">{</span>\r\n        <span class="kw1" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">if</span> <span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">(</span>item <span class="kw1" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">instanceof</span> E<span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">)</span> <span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">{</span>  <span class="co1" style="color: rgb(102, 102, 102); font-style: italic; ">//Compiler error</span>\r\n            ...\r\n        <span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">}</span>\r\n        E item2 <span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">=</span> <span class="kw1" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">new</span> E<span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">(</span><span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">)</span><span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">;</span>   <span class="co1" style="color: rgb(102, 102, 102); font-style: italic; ">//Compiler error</span>\r\n        E<span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">[</span><span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">]</span> iArray <span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">=</span> <span class="kw1" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">new</span> E<span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">[</span><span class="nu0" style="color: rgb(204, 102, 204); ">10</span><span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">]</span><span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">;</span> <span class="co1" style="color: rgb(102, 102, 102); font-style: italic; ">//Compiler error</span>\r\n    <span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">}</span>\r\n<span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">}</span>\r\n</pre>\r\n\t</div>\r\n</div>\r\n<h3 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; font-weight: bold; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.3em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: initial; border-bottom-style: none; border-bottom-color: initial; width: auto; font-size: 17px; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; ">\r\n\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Criticism_of_Java&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: Unsigned integer types">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="Unsigned_integer_types">Unsigned integer types</span></h3>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tJava lacks native&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Integer_(computer_science)" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Integer (computer science)">unsigned integer</a>&nbsp;types. Unsigned data is often generated from programs written in&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/C_(programming_language)" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="C (programming language)">C</a>&nbsp;and the lack of these types prevents direct data interchange between C and Java. Unsigned large numbers are also used in a number of numeric processing fields, including cryptography, which can make Java more inconvenient to use for these tasks.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-3" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_Java#cite_note-3" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>4<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;Although it is possible to partially circumvent this problem with conversion code and using larger data types, it makes using Java cumbersome for handling unsigned data. While a 32-bit signed integer may be used to hold a 16-bit unsigned value losslessly, a 32-bit unsigned value would require a 64bit signed integer, and a 64bit unsigned value cannot be stored using any integer type in Java because no type larger than 64 bits exists in the Java language. In all cases, the memory consumed is doubled, and any logic that depends on the rules of&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Two%27s_complement" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Two's complement">two&#39;s complement</a>&nbsp;overflow must typically be rewritten. If abstracted using functions, function calls become necessary for many operations which are native to some other languages. Alternatively, it is possible to use Java&#39;s signed integers to emulate unsigned integers of the same size, but this requires detailed knowledge of complex bitwise operations.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-4" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_Java#cite_note-4" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>5<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n<h2 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.6em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-bottom-style: solid; border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); width: auto; font-size: 19px; ">\r\n\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Criticism_of_Java&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: Floating point arithmetic">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="Floating_point_arithmetic">Floating point arithmetic</span></h2>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tWhile Java&#39;s floating point arithmetic is largely based on&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_754" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="IEEE 754">IEEE 754</a>&nbsp;(<i>Standard for Binary Floating-Point Arithmetic</i>), certain features are not supported even when using the&nbsp;<code style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Strictfp" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Strictfp">strictfp</a></code>&nbsp;modifier, such as Exception Flags and Directed Roundings &mdash; capabilities mandated by IEEE Standard 754. Additionally, the extended precision floating-point types permitted in 754 and present in many processors are not permitted in Java.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-5" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_Java#cite_note-5" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>6<span>]</span></a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-6" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_Java#cite_note-6" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>7<span>]</span></a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-7" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_Java#cite_note-7" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>8<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n<h2 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.6em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-bottom-style: solid; border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); width: auto; font-size: 19px; ">\r\n\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Criticism_of_Java&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: Performance">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="Performance">Performance</span></h2>\r\n<div class="rellink" style="font-style: italic; padding-left: 2em; margin-bottom: 0.5em; ">\r\n\tFurther information:&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_performance" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Java performance">Java performance</a></div>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tIn the early days of Java (before the&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HotSpot" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="HotSpot">HotSpot VM</a>&nbsp;was implemented in Java 1.3 in 2000) there were many criticisms of performance. Java has been demonstrated to run at a speed comparable with optimised native code, and modern JVM implementations are&nbsp;<a class="external text" href="http://shootout.alioth.debian.org/" rel="nofollow" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(51, 102, 187); background-image: url(data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAoAAAAKCAYAAACNMs+9AAAAGXRFWHRTb2Z0d2FyZQBBZG9iZSBJbWFnZVJlYWR5ccllPAAAAFZJREFUeF59z4EJADEIQ1F36k7u5E7ZKXeUQPACJ3wK7UNokVxVk9kHnQH7bY9hbDyDhNXgjpRLqFlo4M2GgfyJHhjq8V4agfrgPQX3JtJQGbofmCHgA/nAKks+JAjFAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC); background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; padding-right: 13px; background-position: 100% 50%; background-repeat: no-repeat no-repeat; ">regularly benchmarked</a>&nbsp;as one of the fastest language platforms available -- typically within a factor of 3 relative to C/C++.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-8" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_Java#cite_note-8" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>9<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_performance" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Java performance">Java&#39;s performance</a>&nbsp;has improved substantially since the early versions.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-LewisNeumann_9-0" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_Java#cite_note-LewisNeumann-9" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>10<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;Performance of&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/JIT_compiler" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="JIT compiler">JIT compilers</a>&nbsp;relative to native compilers has in some optimized tests been shown to be quite similar.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-LewisNeumann_9-1" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_Java#cite_note-LewisNeumann-9" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>10<span>]</span></a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-10" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_Java#cite_note-10" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>11<span>]</span></a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-11" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_Java#cite_note-11" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>12<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_bytecode" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Java bytecode">Java bytecode</a>&nbsp;can either be interpreted at run time by a virtual machine, or it can be compiled at load time or runtime into native code which runs directly on the computer&#39;s hardware. Interpretation is slower than native execution, and compilation at load time or runtime has an initial performance penalty for the compilation. Modern performance JVM implementations all use the compilation approach, so after the initial startup time the performance is equivalent to native code.</p>\r\n	2	2011-10-20 17:53:43.634767	2011-10-20 17:53:47.432902	9	12	old
14	Criticism of Java	1	<p>\r\n\t&nbsp;</p>\r\n<h2 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.6em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-bottom-style: solid; border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); width: auto; font-size: 19px; ">\r\n\t<span class="mw-headline" id="Language_syntax_and_semantics">Language syntax and semantics</span></h2>\r\n<h3 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; font-weight: bold; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.3em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: initial; border-bottom-style: none; border-bottom-color: initial; width: auto; font-size: 17px; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; ">\r\n\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Criticism_of_Java&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: Generics">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="Generics">Generics</span></h3>\r\n<div class="rellink" style="font-style: italic; padding-left: 2em; margin-bottom: 0.5em; ">\r\n\tFurther information:&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Generics_in_Java" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Generics in Java">Generics in Java</a></div>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tWhen&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Generic_programming" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Generic programming">generics</a>&nbsp;were added to Java 5.0, there was already a large framework of classes (many of which were already&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deprecation" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Deprecation">deprecated</a>), so generics were chosen to be implemented using&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Generics_in_Java#Type_erasure" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Generics in Java">erasure</a>&nbsp;to allow for&nbsp;<i>migration compatibility</i>&nbsp;and re-use of these existing classes. This limited the features that could be provided by this addition as compared to other languages.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-0" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_Java#cite_note-0" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>1<span>]</span></a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-1" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_Java#cite_note-1" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>2<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tBecause generics were implemented using&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Type_erasure" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Type erasure">type erasure</a>&nbsp;the actual type of a template parameter is unavailable at runtime. Thus, the following operations are not possible in java:<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-2" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_Java#cite_note-2" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>3<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n<div class="mw-geshi" dir="ltr" style="padding-top: 1em; padding-right: 1em; padding-bottom: 1em; padding-left: 1em; border-top-width: 1px; border-right-width: 1px; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-left-width: 1px; border-top-style: dashed; border-right-style: dashed; border-bottom-style: dashed; border-left-style: dashed; border-top-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); border-right-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); border-bottom-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); border-left-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); color: black; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); line-height: 1.1em; text-align: left; ">\r\n\t<div class="java source-java" style="line-height: normal; font-family: monospace; ">\r\n\t\t<pre class="de1" style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New' !important; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-left: 0px; border-top-width: 0px; border-right-width: 0px; border-bottom-width: 0px; border-left-width: 0px; border-top-style: none; border-right-style: none; border-bottom-style: none; border-left-style: none; border-top-color: white; border-right-color: white; border-bottom-color: white; border-left-color: white; color: black; background-color: initial; line-height: normal; font: normal normal normal 1em/1.2em monospace; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; vertical-align: top; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; ">\r\n<span class="kw1" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">public</span> <span class="kw1" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">class</span> MyClass<span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">&lt;</span>E<span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">&gt;</span> <span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">{</span>\r\n    <span class="kw1" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">public</span> <span class="kw1" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">static</span> <span class="kw4" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 102); font-weight: bold; ">void</span> myMethod<span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">(</span><span class="kw3" style="color: rgb(0, 51, 153); ">Object</span> item<span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">)</span> <span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">{</span>\r\n        <span class="kw1" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">if</span> <span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">(</span>item <span class="kw1" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">instanceof</span> E<span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">)</span> <span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">{</span>  <span class="co1" style="color: rgb(102, 102, 102); font-style: italic; ">//Compiler error</span>\r\n            ...\r\n        <span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">}</span>\r\n        E item2 <span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">=</span> <span class="kw1" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">new</span> E<span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">(</span><span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">)</span><span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">;</span>   <span class="co1" style="color: rgb(102, 102, 102); font-style: italic; ">//Compiler error</span>\r\n        E<span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">[</span><span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">]</span> iArray <span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">=</span> <span class="kw1" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">new</span> E<span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">[</span><span class="nu0" style="color: rgb(204, 102, 204); ">10</span><span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">]</span><span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">;</span> <span class="co1" style="color: rgb(102, 102, 102); font-style: italic; ">//Compiler error</span>\r\n    <span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">}</span>\r\n<span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">}</span>\r\n</pre>\r\n\t</div>\r\n</div>\r\n<h3 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; font-weight: bold; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.3em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: initial; border-bottom-style: none; border-bottom-color: initial; width: auto; font-size: 17px; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; ">\r\n\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Criticism_of_Java&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: Unsigned integer types">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="Unsigned_integer_types">Unsigned integer types</span></h3>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tJava lacks native&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Integer_(computer_science)" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Integer (computer science)">unsigned integer</a>&nbsp;types. Unsigned data is often generated from programs written in&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/C_(programming_language)" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="C (programming language)">C</a>&nbsp;and the lack of these types prevents direct data interchange between C and Java. Unsigned large numbers are also used in a number of numeric processing fields, including cryptography, which can make Java more inconvenient to use for these tasks.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-3" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_Java#cite_note-3" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>4<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;Although it is possible to partially circumvent this problem with conversion code and using larger data types, it makes using Java cumbersome for handling unsigned data. While a 32-bit signed integer may be used to hold a 16-bit unsigned value losslessly, a 32-bit unsigned value would require a 64bit signed integer, and a 64bit unsigned value cannot be stored using any integer type in Java because no type larger than 64 bits exists in the Java language. In all cases, the memory consumed is doubled, and any logic that depends on the rules of&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Two%27s_complement" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Two's complement">two&#39;s complement</a>&nbsp;overflow must typically be rewritten. If abstracted using functions, function calls become necessary for many operations which are native to some other languages. Alternatively, it is possible to use Java&#39;s signed integers to emulate unsigned integers of the same size, but this requires detailed knowledge of complex bitwise operations.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-4" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_Java#cite_note-4" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>5<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n<h2 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.6em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-bottom-style: solid; border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); width: auto; font-size: 19px; ">\r\n\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Criticism_of_Java&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: Floating point arithmetic">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="Floating_point_arithmetic">Floating point arithmetic</span></h2>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tWhile Java&#39;s floating point arithmetic is largely based on&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_754" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="IEEE 754">IEEE 754</a>&nbsp;(<i>Standard for Binary Floating-Point Arithmetic</i>), certain features are not supported even when using the&nbsp;<code style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Strictfp" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Strictfp">strictfp</a></code>&nbsp;modifier, such as Exception Flags and Directed Roundings &mdash; capabilities mandated by IEEE Standard 754. Additionally, the extended precision floating-point types permitted in 754 and present in many processors are not permitted in Java.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-5" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_Java#cite_note-5" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>6<span>]</span></a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-6" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_Java#cite_note-6" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>7<span>]</span></a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-7" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_Java#cite_note-7" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>8<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n<h2 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.6em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-bottom-style: solid; border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); width: auto; font-size: 19px; ">\r\n\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Criticism_of_Java&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: Performance">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="Performance">Performance</span></h2>\r\n<div class="rellink" style="font-style: italic; padding-left: 2em; margin-bottom: 0.5em; ">\r\n\tFurther information:&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_performance" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Java performance">Java performance</a></div>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tIn the early days of Java (before the&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HotSpot" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="HotSpot">HotSpot VM</a>&nbsp;was implemented in Java 1.3 in 2000) there were many criticisms of performance. Java has been demonstrated to run at a speed comparable with optimised native code, and modern JVM implementations are&nbsp;<a class="external text" href="http://shootout.alioth.debian.org/" rel="nofollow" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(51, 102, 187); background-image: url(data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAoAAAAKCAYAAACNMs+9AAAAGXRFWHRTb2Z0d2FyZQBBZG9iZSBJbWFnZVJlYWR5ccllPAAAAFZJREFUeF59z4EJADEIQ1F36k7u5E7ZKXeUQPACJ3wK7UNokVxVk9kHnQH7bY9hbDyDhNXgjpRLqFlo4M2GgfyJHhjq8V4agfrgPQX3JtJQGbofmCHgA/nAKks+JAjFAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC); background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; padding-right: 13px; background-position: 100% 50%; background-repeat: no-repeat no-repeat; ">regularly benchmarked</a>&nbsp;as one of the fastest language platforms available -- typically within a factor of 3 relative to C/C++.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-8" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_Java#cite_note-8" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>9<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_performance" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Java performance">Java&#39;s performance</a>&nbsp;has improved substantially since the early versions.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-LewisNeumann_9-0" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_Java#cite_note-LewisNeumann-9" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>10<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;Performance of&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/JIT_compiler" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="JIT compiler">JIT compilers</a>&nbsp;relative to native compilers has in some optimized tests been shown to be quite similar.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-LewisNeumann_9-1" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_Java#cite_note-LewisNeumann-9" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>10<span>]</span></a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-10" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_Java#cite_note-10" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>11<span>]</span></a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-11" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_Java#cite_note-11" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>12<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_bytecode" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Java bytecode">Java bytecode</a>&nbsp;can either be interpreted at run time by a virtual machine, or it can be compiled at load time or runtime into native code which runs directly on the computer&#39;s hardware. Interpretation is slower than native execution, and compilation at load time or runtime has an initial performance penalty for the compilation. Modern performance JVM implementations all use the compilation approach, so after the initial startup time the performance is equivalent to native code.</p>\r\n	2	2011-10-20 17:53:47.352857	2011-10-20 17:54:37.69716	9	13	old
15	Criticism of Java	1	<p>\r\n\t&nbsp;</p>\r\n<h2 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.6em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-bottom-style: solid; border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); width: auto; font-size: 19px; ">\r\n\t<span class="mw-headline" id="Language_syntax_and_semantics">Language syntax and semantics</span></h2>\r\n<h3 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; font-weight: bold; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.3em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: initial; border-bottom-style: none; border-bottom-color: initial; width: auto; font-size: 17px; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; ">\r\n\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Criticism_of_Java&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: Generics">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="Generics">Generics</span></h3>\r\n<div class="rellink" style="font-style: italic; padding-left: 2em; margin-bottom: 0.5em; ">\r\n\tFurther information:&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Generics_in_Java" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Generics in Java">Generics in Java</a></div>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tWhen&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Generic_programming" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Generic programming">generics</a>&nbsp;were added to Java 5.0, there was already a large framework of classes (many of which were already&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deprecation" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Deprecation">deprecated</a>), so generics were chosen to be implemented using&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Generics_in_Java#Type_erasure" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Generics in Java">erasure</a>&nbsp;to allow for&nbsp;<i>migration compatibility</i>&nbsp;and re-use of these existing classes. This limited the features that could be provided by this addition as compared to other languages.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-0" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_Java#cite_note-0" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>1<span>]</span></a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-1" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_Java#cite_note-1" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>2<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tBecause generics were implemented using&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Type_erasure" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Type erasure">type erasure</a>&nbsp;the actual type of a template parameter is unavailable at runtime. Thus, the following operations are not possible in java:<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-2" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_Java#cite_note-2" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>3<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n<div class="mw-geshi" dir="ltr" style="padding-top: 1em; padding-right: 1em; padding-bottom: 1em; padding-left: 1em; border-top-width: 1px; border-right-width: 1px; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-left-width: 1px; border-top-style: dashed; border-right-style: dashed; border-bottom-style: dashed; border-left-style: dashed; border-top-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); border-right-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); border-bottom-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); border-left-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); color: black; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); line-height: 1.1em; text-align: left; ">\r\n\t<div class="java source-java" style="line-height: normal; font-family: monospace; ">\r\n\t\t<pre class="de1" style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New' !important; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-left: 0px; border-top-width: 0px; border-right-width: 0px; border-bottom-width: 0px; border-left-width: 0px; border-top-style: none; border-right-style: none; border-bottom-style: none; border-left-style: none; border-top-color: white; border-right-color: white; border-bottom-color: white; border-left-color: white; color: black; background-color: initial; line-height: normal; font: normal normal normal 1em/1.2em monospace; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; vertical-align: top; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; ">\r\n<span class="kw1" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">public</span> <span class="kw1" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">class</span> MyClass<span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">&lt;</span>E<span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">&gt;</span> <span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">{</span>\r\n    <span class="kw1" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">public</span> <span class="kw1" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">static</span> <span class="kw4" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 102); font-weight: bold; ">void</span> myMethod<span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">(</span><span class="kw3" style="color: rgb(0, 51, 153); ">Object</span> item<span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">)</span> <span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">{</span>\r\n        <span class="kw1" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">if</span> <span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">(</span>item <span class="kw1" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">instanceof</span> E<span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">)</span> <span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">{</span>  <span class="co1" style="color: rgb(102, 102, 102); font-style: italic; ">//Compiler error</span>\r\n            ...\r\n        <span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">}</span>\r\n        E item2 <span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">=</span> <span class="kw1" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">new</span> E<span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">(</span><span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">)</span><span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">;</span>   <span class="co1" style="color: rgb(102, 102, 102); font-style: italic; ">//Compiler error</span>\r\n        E<span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">[</span><span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">]</span> iArray <span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">=</span> <span class="kw1" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">new</span> E<span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">[</span><span class="nu0" style="color: rgb(204, 102, 204); ">10</span><span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">]</span><span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">;</span> <span class="co1" style="color: rgb(102, 102, 102); font-style: italic; ">//Compiler error</span>\r\n    <span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">}</span>\r\n<span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">}</span>\r\n</pre>\r\n\t</div>\r\n</div>\r\n<h3 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; font-weight: bold; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.3em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: initial; border-bottom-style: none; border-bottom-color: initial; width: auto; font-size: 17px; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; ">\r\n\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Criticism_of_Java&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: Unsigned integer types">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="Unsigned_integer_types">Unsigned integer types</span></h3>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tJava lacks native&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Integer_(computer_science)" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Integer (computer science)">unsigned integer</a>&nbsp;types. Unsigned data is often generated from programs written in&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/C_(programming_language)" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="C (programming language)">C</a>&nbsp;and the lack of these types prevents direct data interchange between C and Java. Unsigned large numbers are also used in a number of numeric processing fields, including cryptography, which can make Java more inconvenient to use for these tasks.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-3" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_Java#cite_note-3" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>4<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;Although it is possible to partially circumvent this problem with conversion code and using larger data types, it makes using Java cumbersome for handling unsigned data. While a 32-bit signed integer may be used to hold a 16-bit unsigned value losslessly, a 32-bit unsigned value would require a 64bit signed integer, and a 64bit unsigned value cannot be stored using any integer type in Java because no type larger than 64 bits exists in the Java language. In all cases, the memory consumed is doubled, and any logic that depends on the rules of&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Two%27s_complement" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Two's complement">two&#39;s complement</a>&nbsp;overflow must typically be rewritten. If abstracted using functions, function calls become necessary for many operations which are native to some other languages. Alternatively, it is possible to use Java&#39;s signed integers to emulate unsigned integers of the same size, but this requires detailed knowledge of complex bitwise operations.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-4" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_Java#cite_note-4" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>5<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n<h2 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.6em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-bottom-style: solid; border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); width: auto; font-size: 19px; ">\r\n\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Criticism_of_Java&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: Floating point arithmetic">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="Floating_point_arithmetic">Floating point arithmetic</span></h2>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tWhile Java&#39;s floating point arithmetic is largely based on&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_754" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="IEEE 754">IEEE 754</a>&nbsp;(<i>Standard for Binary Floating-Point Arithmetic</i>), certain features are not supported even when using the&nbsp;<code style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Strictfp" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Strictfp">strictfp</a></code>&nbsp;modifier, such as Exception Flags and Directed Roundings &mdash; capabilities mandated by IEEE Standard 754. Additionally, the extended precision floating-point types permitted in 754 and present in many processors are not permitted in Java.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-5" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_Java#cite_note-5" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>6<span>]</span></a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-6" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_Java#cite_note-6" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>7<span>]</span></a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-7" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_Java#cite_note-7" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>8<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n<h2 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.6em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-bottom-style: solid; border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); width: auto; font-size: 19px; ">\r\n\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Criticism_of_Java&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial;
