" title="Edit section: Performance">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="Performance">Performance</span></h2>\r\n<div class="rellink" style="font-style: italic; padding-left: 2em; margin-bottom: 0.5em; ">\r\n\tFurther information:&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_performance" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Java performance">Java performance</a></div>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tIn the early days of Java (before the&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HotSpot" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="HotSpot">HotSpot VM</a>&nbsp;was implemented in Java 1.3 in 2000) there were many criticisms of performance. Java has been demonstrated to run at a speed comparable with optimised native code, and modern JVM implementations are&nbsp;<a class="external text" href="http://shootout.alioth.debian.org/" rel="nofollow" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(51, 102, 187); background-image: url(data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAoAAAAKCAYAAACNMs+9AAAAGXRFWHRTb2Z0d2FyZQBBZG9iZSBJbWFnZVJlYWR5ccllPAAAAFZJREFUeF59z4EJADEIQ1F36k7u5E7ZKXeUQPACJ3wK7UNokVxVk9kHnQH7bY9hbDyDhNXgjpRLqFlo4M2GgfyJHhjq8V4agfrgPQX3JtJQGbofmCHgA/nAKks+JAjFAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC); background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; padding-right: 13px; background-position: 100% 50%; background-repeat: no-repeat no-repeat; ">regularly benchmarked</a>&nbsp;as one of the fastest language platforms available -- typically within a factor of 3 relative to C/C++.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-8" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_Java#cite_note-8" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>9<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_performance" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Java performance">Java&#39;s performance</a>&nbsp;has improved substantially since the early versions.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-LewisNeumann_9-0" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_Java#cite_note-LewisNeumann-9" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>10<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;Performance of&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/JIT_compiler" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="JIT compiler">JIT compilers</a>&nbsp;relative to native compilers has in some optimized tests been shown to be quite similar.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-LewisNeumann_9-1" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_Java#cite_note-LewisNeumann-9" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>10<span>]</span></a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-10" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_Java#cite_note-10" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>11<span>]</span></a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-11" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_Java#cite_note-11" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>12<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_bytecode" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Java bytecode">Java bytecode</a>&nbsp;can either be interpreted at run time by a virtual machine, or it can be compiled at load time or runtime into native code which runs directly on the computer&#39;s hardware. Interpretation is slower than native execution, and compilation at load time or runtime has an initial performance penalty for the compilation. Modern performance JVM implementations all use the compilation approach, so after the initial startup time the performance is equivalent to native code.</p>\r\n	2	2011-10-20 17:54:37.609111	2011-10-20 17:54:45.373476	56	14	old
16	Criticism of Java	1	<p>\r\n\t&nbsp;</p>\r\n<h2 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.6em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-bottom-style: solid; border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); width: auto; font-size: 19px; ">\r\n\t<span class="mw-headline" id="Language_syntax_and_semantics">Language syntax and semantics</span></h2>\r\n<h3 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; font-weight: bold; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.3em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: initial; border-bottom-style: none; border-bottom-color: initial; width: auto; font-size: 17px; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; ">\r\n\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Criticism_of_Java&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: Generics">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="Generics">Generics</span></h3>\r\n<div class="rellink" style="font-style: italic; padding-left: 2em; margin-bottom: 0.5em; ">\r\n\tFurther information:&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Generics_in_Java" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Generics in Java">Generics in Java</a></div>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tWhen&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Generic_programming" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Generic programming">generics</a>&nbsp;were added to Java 5.0, there was already a large framework of classes (many of which were already&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deprecation" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Deprecation">deprecated</a>), so generics were chosen to be implemented using&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Generics_in_Java#Type_erasure" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Generics in Java">erasure</a>&nbsp;to allow for&nbsp;<i>migration compatibility</i>&nbsp;and re-use of these existing classes. This limited the features that could be provided by this addition as compared to other languages.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-0" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_Java#cite_note-0" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>1<span>]</span></a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-1" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_Java#cite_note-1" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>2<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tBecause generics were implemented using&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Type_erasure" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Type erasure">type erasure</a>&nbsp;the actual type of a template parameter is unavailable at runtime. Thus, the following operations are not possible in java:<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-2" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_Java#cite_note-2" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>3<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n<div class="mw-geshi" dir="ltr" style="padding-top: 1em; padding-right: 1em; padding-bottom: 1em; padding-left: 1em; border-top-width: 1px; border-right-width: 1px; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-left-width: 1px; border-top-style: dashed; border-right-style: dashed; border-bottom-style: dashed; border-left-style: dashed; border-top-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); border-right-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); border-bottom-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); border-left-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); color: black; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); line-height: 1.1em; text-align: left; ">\r\n\t<div class="java source-java" style="line-height: normal; font-family: monospace; ">\r\n\t\t<pre class="de1" style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New' !important; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-left: 0px; border-top-width: 0px; border-right-width: 0px; border-bottom-width: 0px; border-left-width: 0px; border-top-style: none; border-right-style: none; border-bottom-style: none; border-left-style: none; border-top-color: white; border-right-color: white; border-bottom-color: white; border-left-color: white; color: black; background-color: initial; line-height: normal; font: normal normal normal 1em/1.2em monospace; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; vertical-align: top; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; ">\r\n<span class="kw1" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">public</span> <span class="kw1" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">class</span> MyClass<span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">&lt;</span>E<span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">&gt;</span> <span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">{</span>\r\n    <span class="kw1" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">public</span> <span class="kw1" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">static</span> <span class="kw4" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 102); font-weight: bold; ">void</span> myMethod<span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">(</span><span class="kw3" style="color: rgb(0, 51, 153); ">Object</span> item<span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">)</span> <span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">{</span>\r\n        <span class="kw1" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">if</span> <span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">(</span>item <span class="kw1" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">instanceof</span> E<span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">)</span> <span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">{</span>  <span class="co1" style="color: rgb(102, 102, 102); font-style: italic; ">//Compiler error</span>\r\n            ...\r\n        <span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">}</span>\r\n        E item2 <span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">=</span> <span class="kw1" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">new</span> E<span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">(</span><span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">)</span><span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">;</span>   <span class="co1" style="color: rgb(102, 102, 102); font-style: italic; ">//Compiler error</span>\r\n        E<span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">[</span><span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">]</span> iArray <span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">=</span> <span class="kw1" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: bold; ">new</span> E<span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">[</span><span class="nu0" style="color: rgb(204, 102, 204); ">10</span><span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">]</span><span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">;</span> <span class="co1" style="color: rgb(102, 102, 102); font-style: italic; ">//Compiler error</span>\r\n    <span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">}</span>\r\n<span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">}</span>\r\n</pre>\r\n\t</div>\r\n</div>\r\n<h3 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; font-weight: bold; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.3em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: initial; border-bottom-style: none; border-bottom-color: initial; width: auto; font-size: 17px; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; ">\r\n\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Criticism_of_Java&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: Unsigned integer types">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="Unsigned_integer_types">Unsigned integer types</span></h3>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tJava lacks native&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Integer_(computer_science)" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Integer (computer science)">unsigned integer</a>&nbsp;types. Unsigned data is often generated from programs written in&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/C_(programming_language)" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="C (programming language)">C</a>&nbsp;and the lack of these types prevents direct data interchange between C and Java. Unsigned large numbers are also used in a number of numeric processing fields, including cryptography, which can make Java more inconvenient to use for these tasks.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-3" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_Java#cite_note-3" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>4<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;Although it is possible to partially circumvent this problem with conversion code and using larger data types, it makes using Java cumbersome for handling unsigned data. While a 32-bit signed integer may be used to hold a 16-bit unsigned value losslessly, a 32-bit unsigned value would require a 64bit signed integer, and a 64bit unsigned value cannot be stored using any integer type in Java because no type larger than 64 bits exists in the Java language. In all cases, the memory consumed is doubled, and any logic that depends on the rules of&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Two%27s_complement" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Two's complement">two&#39;s complement</a>&nbsp;overflow must typically be rewritten. If abstracted using functions, function calls become necessary for many operations which are native to some other languages. Alternatively, it is possible to use Java&#39;s signed integers to emulate unsigned integers of the same size, but this requires detailed knowledge of complex bitwise operations.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-4" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_Java#cite_note-4" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>5<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n<h2 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.6em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-bottom-style: solid; border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); width: auto; font-size: 19px; ">\r\n\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Criticism_of_Java&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: Floating point arithmetic">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="Floating_point_arithmetic">Floating point arithmetic</span></h2>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tWhile Java&#39;s floating point arithmetic is largely based on&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_754" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="IEEE 754">IEEE 754</a>&nbsp;(<i>Standard for Binary Floating-Point Arithmetic</i>), certain features are not supported even when using the&nbsp;<code style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Strictfp" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Strictfp">strictfp</a></code>&nbsp;modifier, such as Exception Flags and Directed Roundings &mdash; capabilities mandated by IEEE Standard 754. Additionally, the extended precision floating-point types permitted in 754 and present in many processors are not permitted in Java.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-5" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_Java#cite_note-5" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>6<span>]</span></a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-6" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_Java#cite_note-6" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>7<span>]</span></a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-7" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_Java#cite_note-7" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>8<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n<h2 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.6em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-bottom-style: solid; border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); width: auto; font-size: 19px; ">\r\n\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Criticism_of_Java&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: Performance">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="Performance">Performance</span></h2>\r\n<div class="rellink" style="font-style: italic; padding-left: 2em; margin-bottom: 0.5em; ">\r\n\tFurther information:&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_performance" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Java performance">Java performance</a></div>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tIn the early days of Java (before the&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HotSpot" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="HotSpot">HotSpot VM</a>&nbsp;was implemented in Java 1.3 in 2000) there were many criticisms of performance. Java has been demonstrated to run at a speed comparable with optimised native code, and modern JVM implementations are&nbsp;<a class="external text" href="http://shootout.alioth.debian.org/" rel="nofollow" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(51, 102, 187); background-image: url(data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAoAAAAKCAYAAACNMs+9AAAAGXRFWHRTb2Z0d2FyZQBBZG9iZSBJbWFnZVJlYWR5ccllPAAAAFZJREFUeF59z4EJADEIQ1F36k7u5E7ZKXeUQPACJ3wK7UNokVxVk9kHnQH7bY9hbDyDhNXgjpRLqFlo4M2GgfyJHhjq8V4agfrgPQX3JtJQGbofmCHgA/nAKks+JAjFAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC); background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; padding-right: 13px; background-position: 100% 50%; background-repeat: no-repeat no-repeat; ">regularly benchmarked</a>&nbsp;as one of the fastest language platforms available -- typically within a factor of 3 relative to C/C++.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-8" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_Java#cite_note-8" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>9<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_performance" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Java performance">Java&#39;s performance</a>&nbsp;has improved substantially since the early versions.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-LewisNeumann_9-0" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_Java#cite_note-LewisNeumann-9" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>10<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;Performance of&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/JIT_compiler" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="JIT compiler">JIT compilers</a>&nbsp;relative to native compilers has in some optimized tests been shown to be quite similar.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-LewisNeumann_9-1" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_Java#cite_note-LewisNeumann-9" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>10<span>]</span></a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-10" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_Java#cite_note-10" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>11<span>]</span></a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-11" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_Java#cite_note-11" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>12<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_bytecode" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Java bytecode">Java bytecode</a>&nbsp;can either be interpreted at run time by a virtual machine, or it can be compiled at load time or runtime into native code which runs directly on the computer&#39;s hardware. Interpretation is slower than native execution, and compilation at load time or runtime has an initial performance penalty for the compilation. Modern performance JVM implementations all use the compilation approach, so after the initial startup time the performance is equivalent to native code.</p>\r\n	2	2011-10-20 17:54:45.293431	2011-10-20 17:54:45.433509	32	15	latest
17	Security	1	<p>\r\n\t&nbsp;</p>\r\n<h2 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.6em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-bottom-style: solid; border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); width: auto; font-size: 19px; ">\r\n\t<span class="mw-headline" id="Security">Security</span></h2>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tAdobe Acrobat and Adobe Flash are among the most targeted software for security exploits. In 2010, targeting of Java security exploits increased significantly, resulting in Java becoming far more targeted than Acrobat or Flash.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-exploit_12-0" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_Java#cite_note-exploit-12" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>13<span>]</span></a></sup><sup class="noprint Inline-Template" style="line-height: 1em; white-space: nowrap; ">[<i><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Disputed_statement" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Wikipedia:Disputed statement"><span title="The material in the vicinity of this tag may not be factual or accurate from November 2010">dubious</span></a>&nbsp;<span class="metadata">&ndash;&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Talk:Criticism_of_Java#Dubious" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Talk:Criticism of Java">discuss</a></span></i>]</sup><sup style="line-height: 1em; ">Microsoft publication</sup>&nbsp;This targeting appears to be tied to high numbers of computers with Java installed and the high percentage of computers that have not been updated with Java security updates.<sup class="noprint Inline-Template" style="line-height: 1em; white-space: nowrap; ">[<i><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:No_original_research" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Wikipedia:No original research"><span title="The material in the vicinity of this tag may be based upon unreliable original research from November 2010">original research?</span></a></i>]</sup></p>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tCritics have suggested that updated versions of Java are not used because there is a lack of awareness by many users that Java is installed, there is a lack of awareness of many users of how to update Java, and (on corporate computers) many companies restrict software installation and are slow to deploy updates.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-exploit_12-1" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_Java#cite_note-exploit-12" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>13<span>]</span></a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-13" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_Java#cite_note-13" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>14<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tAmong the suggestions made by critics is that users should consider uninstalling Java given the security risk and given the limited number of web sites that require Java to be installed on the browser&#39;s computer.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-14" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_Java#cite_note-14" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; 8	JavaServer Pages compiler	1	<p>\r\n\t&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tA&nbsp;<b>JavaServer Pages compiler</b>, or&nbsp;<b>JSP compiler</b>, is a program that parses&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/JavaServer_Pages" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="JavaServer Pages">JavaServer Pages</a>&nbsp;(JSPs), and transforms them into executable&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_Servlets" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Java Servlets">Java Servlets</a>. A program of this type is usually embedded into an&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Application_server" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Application server">application server</a>&nbsp;and run automatically the first time a JSP is accessed, but pages may also be precompiled for better performance, or compiled as a part of the build process to test for errors.</p>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tMost&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/JSP_container" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="JSP container">JSP containers</a>&nbsp;support configuring how often the container checks JSP&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Computer_file" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Computer file">file</a>&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Timestamp" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Timestamp">timestamps</a>&nbsp;to see if the page has changed. Typically, this timestamp would be set to a short interval (perhaps seconds) during&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Software_development" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Software development">software development</a>, and a longer interval (perhaps minutes, or even never) for a deployed&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Web_application" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Web application">Web application</a>.</p>\r\n<div>\r\n\t&nbsp;</div>\r\n	2	2011-10-20 17:45:32.630733	2011-10-20 18:05:58.692004	45	\N	old
19	Java Database Connectivity	2	<p>\r\n\t&nbsp;</p>\r\n<h2 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.6em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-bottom-style: solid; border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); width: auto; font-size: 19px; ">\r\n\t<span class="mw-headline" id="History_and_implementation">History and implementation</span></h2>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sun_Microsystems" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Sun Microsystems">Sun Microsystems</a>&nbsp;released JDBC as part of&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_Development_Kit" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Java Development Kit">JDK</a>&nbsp;1.1 on February 19, 1997.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-0" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_Database_Connectivity#cite_note-0" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>1<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;It has since formed part of the&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_Platform,_Standard_Edition" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Java Platform, Standard Edition">Java Standard Edition</a>.</p>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tThe JDBC classes are contained in the&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_package" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Java package">Java package</a>&nbsp;<code style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); "><a class="external text" href="http://download.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/sql/package-summary.html" rel="nofollow" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(51, 102, 187); background-image: url(data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAoAAAAKCAYAAACNMs+9AAAAGXRFWHRTb2Z0d2FyZQBBZG9iZSBJbWFnZVJlYWR5ccllPAAAAFZJREFUeF59z4EJADEIQ1F36k7u5E7ZKXeUQPACJ3wK7UNokVxVk9kHnQH7bY9hbDyDhNXgjpRLqFlo4M2GgfyJHhjq8V4agfrgPQX3JtJQGbofmCHgA/nAKks+JAjFAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC); background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; padding-right: 13px; background-position: 100% 50%; background-repeat: no-repeat no-repeat; ">java.sql</a></code>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<code style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); "><a class="external text" href="http://download.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/javax/sql/package-summary.html" rel="nofollow" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(51, 102, 187); background-image: url(data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAoAAAAKCAYAAACNMs+9AAAAGXRFWHRTb2Z0d2FyZQBBZG9iZSBJbWFnZVJlYWR5ccllPAAAAFZJREFUeF59z4EJADEIQ1F36k7u5E7ZKXeUQPACJ3wK7UNokVxVk9kHnQH7bY9hbDyDhNXgjpRLqFlo4M2GgfyJHhjq8V4agfrgPQX3JtJQGbofmCHgA/nAKks+JAjFAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC); background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; padding-right: 13px; background-position: 100% 50%; background-repeat: no-repeat no-repeat; ">javax.sql</a></code>.</p>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tStarting with version 3.1 , JDBC has been developed under the&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_Community_Process" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Java Community Process">Java Community Process</a>. JSR 54 specifies JDBC 3.0 (included in J2SE 1.4), JSR 114 specifies the JDBC Rowset additions, and JSR 221 is the specification of JDBC 4.0 (included in Java SE 6).<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-1" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_Database_Connectivity#cite_note-1" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>2<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n<h2 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.6em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-bottom-style: solid; border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); width: auto; font-size: 19px; ">\r\n\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Java_Database_Connectivity&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: Functionality">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="Functionality">Functionality</span></h2>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tJDBC allows multiple implementations to exist and be used by the same application. The API provides a mechanism for dynamically loading the correct Java packages and registering them with the JDBC Driver Manager. The Driver Manager is used as a connection factory for creating JDBC connections.</p>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tJDBC connections support creating and executing statements. These may be update statements such as&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SQL" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="SQL">SQL</a>&#39;s CREATE, INSERT, UPDATE and DELETE, or they may be query statements such as SELECT. Additionally,&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stored_procedures" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Stored procedures">stored procedures</a>&nbsp;may be invoked through a JDBC connection. JDBC represents statements using one of the following classes:</p>\r\n<ul style="line-height: 1.5em; list-style-type: square; margin-top: 0.3em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 1.5em; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-left: 0px; list-style-image: url(data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAUAAAANCAMAAABW4lS6AAAAGXRFWHRTb2Z0d2FyZQBBZG9iZSBJbWFnZVJlYWR5ccllPAAAAAZQTFRFAFKM////QIUK9QAAAAJ0Uk5T/wDltzBKAAAAGklEQVR42mJgBAEGokgGBjBGBxBxsBqAAAMACHwALd5r8ygAAAAASUVORK5CYII=); ">\r\n\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t<code style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); "><a class="external text" href="http://download.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/sql/Statement.html" rel="nofollow" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(51, 102, 187); background-image: url(data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAoAAAAKCAYAAACNMs+9AAAAGXRFWHRTb2Z0d2FyZQBBZG9iZSBJbWFnZVJlYWR5ccllPAAAAFZJREFUeF59z4EJADEIQ1F36k7u5E7ZKXeUQPACJ3wK7UNokVxVk9kHnQH7bY9hbDyDhNXgjpRLqFlo4M2GgfyJHhjq8V4agfrgPQX3JtJQGbofmCHgA/nAKks+JAjFAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC); background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; padding-right: 13px; background-position: 100% 50%; background-repeat: no-repeat no-repeat; ">Statement</a></code>&nbsp;&ndash; the statement is sent to the database server each and every time.</li>\r\n\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t<code style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); "><a class="external text" href="http://download.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/sql/PreparedStatement.html" rel="nofollow" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(51, 102, 187); background-image: url(data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAoAAAAKCAYAAACNMs+9AAAAGXRFWHRTb2Z0d2FyZQBBZG9iZSBJbWFnZVJlYWR5ccllPAAAAFZJREFUeF59z4EJADEIQ1F36k7u5E7ZKXeUQPACJ3wK7UNokVxVk9kHnQH7bY9hbDyDhNXgjpRLqFlo4M2GgfyJHhjq8V4agfrgPQX3JtJQGbofmCHgA/nAKks+JAjFAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC); background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; padding-right: 13px; background-position: 100% 50%; background-repeat: no-repeat no-repeat; ">PreparedStatement</a></code>&nbsp;&ndash; the statement is cached and then the execution path is pre determined on the database server allowing it to be executed multiple times in an efficient manner.</li>\r\n\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t<code style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); "><a class="external text" href="http://download.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/sql/CallableStatement.html" rel="nofollow" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(51, 102, 187); background-image: url(data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAoAAAAKCAYAAACNMs+9AAAAGXRFWHRTb2Z0d2FyZQBBZG9iZSBJbWFnZVJlYWR5ccllPAAAAFZJREFUeF59z4EJADEIQ1F36k7u5E7ZKXeUQPACJ3wK7UNokVxVk9kHnQH7bY9hbDyDhNXgjpRLqFlo4M2GgfyJHhjq8V4agfrgPQX3JtJQGbofmCHgA/nAKks+JAjFAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC); background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; padding-right: 13px; background-position: 100% 50%; background-repeat: no-repeat no-repeat; ">CallableStatement</a></code>&nbsp;&ndash; used for executing&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stored_procedures" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Stored procedures">stored procedures</a>&nbsp;on the database.</li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tUpdate statements such as INSERT, UPDATE and DELETE return an update count that indicates how many rows were affected in the database. These statements do not return any other information.</p>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tQuery statements return a JDBC row result set. The row result set is used to walk over the result set. Individual columns in a row are retrieved either by name or by column number. There may be any number of rows in the result set. The row result set has metadata that describes the names of the columns and their types.</p>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tThere is an extension to the basic JDBC API in the&nbsp;<code style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); "><a class="external text" href="http://download.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/javax/sql/package-summary.html" rel="nofollow" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(51, 102, 187); background-image: url(data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAoAAAAKCAYAAACNMs+9AAAAGXRFWHRTb2Z0d2FyZQBBZG9iZSBJbWFnZVJlYWR5ccllPAAAAFZJREFUeF59z4EJADEIQ1F36k7u5E7ZKXeUQPACJ3wK7UNokVxVk9kHnQH7bY9hbDyDhNXgjpRLqFlo4M2GgfyJHhjq8V4agfrgPQX3JtJQGbofmCHgA/nAKks+JAjFAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC); background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; padding-right: 13px; background-position: 100% 50%; background-repeat: no-repeat no-repeat; ">javax.sql</a></code>.</p>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tJDBC connections are often managed via a connection pool rather than obtained directly from the driver. Examples of connection pools include&nbsp;<a class="external text" href="http://jolbox.com/" rel="nofollow" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(51, 102, 187); background-image: url(data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAoAAAAKCAYAAACNMs+9AAAAGXRFWHRTb2Z0d2FyZQBBZG9iZSBJbWFnZVJlYWR5ccllPAAAAFZJREFUeF59z4EJADEIQ1F36k7u5E7ZKXeUQPACJ3wK7UNokVxVk9kHnQH7bY9hbDyDhNXgjpRLqFlo4M2GgfyJHhjq8V4agfrgPQX3JtJQGbofmCHgA/nAKks+JAjFAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC); background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; padding-right: 13px; background-position: 100% 50%; background-repeat: no-repeat no-repeat; ">BoneCP</a>,&nbsp;<a class="external text" href="http://sourceforge.net/projects/c3p0" rel="nofollow" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(51, 102, 187); background-image: url(data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAoAAAAKCAYAAACNMs+9AAAAGXRFWHRTb2Z0d2FyZQBBZG9iZSBJbWFnZVJlYWR5ccllPAAAAFZJREFUeF59z4EJADEIQ1F36k7u5E7ZKXeUQPACJ3wK7UNokVxVk9kHnQH7bY9hbDyDhNXgjpRLqFlo4M2GgfyJHhjq8V4agfrgPQX3JtJQGbofmCHgA/nAKks+JAjFAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC); background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; padding-right: 13px; background-position: 100% 50%; background-repeat: no-repeat no-repeat; ">C3P0</a>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<a class="external text" href="http://commons.apache.org/dbcp" rel="nofollow" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(51, 102, 187); background-image: url(data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAoAAAAKCAYAAACNMs+9AAAAGXRFWHRTb2Z0d2FyZQBBZG9iZSBJbWFnZVJlYWR5ccllPAAAAFZJREFUeF59z4EJADEIQ1F36k7u5E7ZKXeUQPACJ3wK7UNokVxVk9kHnQH7bY9hbDyDhNXgjpRLqFlo4M2GgfyJHhjq8V4agfrgPQX3JtJQGbofmCHgA/nAKks+JAjFAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC); background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; padding-right: 13px; background-position: 100% 50%; background-repeat: no-repeat no-repeat; ">DBCP</a></p>\r\n<h2 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.6em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-bottom-style: solid; border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); width: auto; font-size: 19px; ">\r\n\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Java_Database_Connectivity&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: Examples">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="Examples">Examples</span></h2>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tThe method&nbsp;<code style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); "><a class="external text" href="http://download.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/lang/Class.html#forName(java.lang.String)" rel="nofollow" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(51, 102, 187); background-image: url(data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAoAAAAKCAYAAACNMs+9AAAAGXRFWHRTb2Z0d2FyZQBBZG9iZSBJbWFnZVJlYWR5ccllPAAAAFZJREFUeF59z4EJADEIQ1F36k7u5E7ZKXeUQPACJ3wK7UNokVxVk9kHnQH7bY9hbDyDhNXgjpRLqFlo4M2GgfyJHhjq8V4agfrgPQX3JtJQGbofmCHgA/nAKks+JAjFAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC); background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; padding-right: 13px; background-position: 100% 50%; background-repeat: no-repeat no-repeat; ">Class.forName(String)</a></code>&nbsp;is used to load the JDBC driver class. The line below causes the JDBC driver from&nbsp;<i>some jdbc vendor</i>&nbsp;to be loaded into the application. (Some JVMs also require the class to be instantiated with<code style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); "><a class="external text" href="http://download.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/lang/Class.html#newInstance()" rel="nofollow" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(51, 102, 187); background-image: url(data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAoAAAAKCAYAAACNMs+9AAAAGXRFWHRTb2Z0d2FyZQBBZG9iZSBJbWFnZVJlYWR5ccllPAAAAFZJREFUeF59z4EJADEIQ1F36k7u5E7ZKXeUQPACJ3wK7UNokVxVk9kHnQH7bY9hbDyDhNXgjpRLqFlo4M2GgfyJHhjq8V4agfrgPQX3JtJQGbofmCHgA/nAKks+JAjFAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC); background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; padding-right: 13px; background-position: 100% 50%; background-repeat: no-repeat no-repeat; ">.newInstance()</a></code>.)</p>\r\n<div class="mw-geshi" dir="ltr" style="padding-top: 1em; padding-right: 1em; padding-bottom: 1em; padding-left: 1em; border-top-width: 1px; border-right-width: 1px; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-left-width: 1px; border-top-style: dashed; border-right-style: dashed; border-bottom-style: dashed; border-left-style: dashed; border-top-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); border-right-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); border-bottom-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); border-left-color: rgb(47, 111, 171); color: black; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); line-height: 1.1em; text-align: left; ">\r\n\t<div class="java5 source-java5" style="line-height: normal; font-family: monospace; ">\r\n\t\t<pre class="de1" style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New' !important; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-left: 0px; border-top-width: 0px; border-right-width: 0px; border-bottom-width: 0px; border-left-width: 0px; border-top-style: none; border-right-style: none; border-bottom-style: none; border-left-style: none; border-top-color: white; border-right-color: white; border-bottom-color: white; border-left-color: white; color: black; background-color: initial; line-height: normal; font: normal normal normal 1em/1.2em monospace; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; vertical-align: top; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; ">\r\n<span class="kw21" style="color: rgb(0, 51, 153); font-weight: bold; ">Class</span>.<span class="me1" style="color: rgb(0, 102, 51); ">forName</span><span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">(</span> <span class="st0" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 255); ">&quot;com.somejdbcvendor.TheirJdbcDriver&quot;</span> <span class="br0" style="color: rgb(0, 153, 0); ">)</span><span class="sy0" style="color: rgb(51, 153, 51); ">;</span>\r\n</pre>\r\n\t</div>\r\n</div>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tIn JDBC 4.0, it&#39;s no longer necessary to explicitly load JDBC drivers using Class.forName(). See&nbsp;<a class="external text" href="http://www.onjava.com/pub/a/onjava/2006/08/02/jjdbc-4-enhancements-in-java-se-6.html" rel="nofollow" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(51, 102, 187); background-image: url(data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAoAAAAKCAYAAACNMs+9AAAAGXRFWHRTb2Z0d2FyZQBBZG9iZSBJbWFnZVJlYWR5ccllPAAAAFZJREFUeF59z4EJADEIQ1F36k7u5E7ZKXeUQPACJ3wK7UNokVxVk9kHnQH7bY9hbDyDhNXgjpRLqFlo4M2GgfyJHhjq8V4agfrgPQX3JtJQGbofmCHgA/nAKks+JAjFAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC); background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; padding-right: 13px; background-position: 100% 50%; background-repeat: no-repeat no-repeat; ">JDBC 4.0 Enhancements in Java SE 6</a>.</p>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tWhen a&nbsp;<code style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); "><a class="external text" href="http://download.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/sql/Driver.html" rel="nofollow" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(51, 102, 187); background-image: url(data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAoAAAAKCAYAAACNMs+9AAAAGXRFWHRTb2Z0d2FyZQBBZG9iZSBJbWFnZVJlYWR5ccllPAAAAFZJREFUeF59z4EJADEIQ1F36k7u5E7ZKXeUQPACJ3wK7UNokVxVk9kHnQH7bY9hbDyDhNXgjpRLqFlo4M2GgfyJHhjq8V4agfrgPQX3JtJQGbofmCHgA/nAKks+JAjFAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC); background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; padding-right: 13px; background-position: 100% 50%; background-repeat: no-repeat no-repeat; ">Driver</a></code>&nbsp;class is loaded, it creates an instance of itself and registers it with the&nbsp;<code style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); "><a class="external text" href="http://download.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/sql/DriverManager.html" rel="nofollow" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(51, 102, 187); background-image: url(data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAoAAAAKCAYAAACNMs+9AAAAGXRFWHRTb2Z0d2FyZQBBZG9iZSBJbWFnZVJlYWR5ccllPAAAAFZJREFUeF59z4EJADEIQ1F36k7u5E7ZKXeUQPACJ3wK7UNokVxVk9kHnQH7bY9hbDyDhNXgjpRLqFlo4M2GgfyJHhjq8V4agfrgPQX3JtJQGbofmCHgA/nAKks+JAjFAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC); background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; padding-right: 13px; background-position: 100% 50%; background-repeat: no-repeat no-repeat; ">DriverManager</a></code>. This can be done by including the needed code in the driver class&#39;s&nbsp;<code style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); ">static</code>&nbsp;block. e.g.<code style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); ">DriverManager.registerDriver(Driver driver)</code></p>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tNow when a connection is needed, one of the&nbsp;<code style="font-family: monospace, 'Courier New'; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); ">DriverManager.getConnection()</code>&nbsp;methods is used to create a JDBC connection.</p>\r\n	2	2011-10-20 18:07:13.906289	2011-10-20 18:07:13.906289	52	\N	latest
21	Simba Technologies	2	<p>\r\n\t&nbsp;</p>\r\n<h1 class="firstHeading" id="firstHeading" style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.1em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-bottom-style: solid; border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); width: auto; font-size: 1.6em; line-height: 1.2em; ">\r\n\tSimba Technologies</h1>\r\n<div id="bodyContent" style="font-size: 0.8em; position: relative; width: 1393px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t<div id="siteSub" style="display: inline; font-size: 12px; ">\r\n\t\tFrom Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia</div>\r\n\t<div id="contentSub" style="font-size: 11px; line-height: 1.2em; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 1.4em; margin-left: 1em; color: rgb(125, 125, 125); width: auto; ">\r\n\t\t&nbsp;</div>\r\n\t<div class="mw-content-ltr" dir="ltr" lang="en" style="direction: ltr; ">\r\n\t\t<table cellspacing="5" class="infobox vcard" style="font-size: 11px; border-top-style: solid; border-right-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 1em; padding-top: 0.2em; padding-right: 0.2em; padding-bottom: 0.2em; padding-left: 0.2em; float: right; clear: right; text-align: left; line-height: 1.5em; width: 22em; ">\r\n\t\t\t<caption class="fn org" style="font-size: 14px; font-weight: bold; ">\r\n\t\t\t\tSimba Technologies</caption>\r\n\t\t\t<tbody>\r\n\t\t\t\t<tr>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<td class="logo" colspan="2" style="vertical-align: top; text-align: center; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<a class="image" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Simba_Logo.png" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; text-align: left; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Types_of_business_entity" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Types of business entity">Type</a></th>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<td class="category" style="vertical-align: top; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\tPrivate</td>\r\n\t\t\t\t</tr>\r\n\t\t\t\t<tr>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<th scope="row" style="vertical-align: top; text-align: left; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\tFounded</th>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<td style="vertical-align: top; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t1991</td>\r\n\t\t\t\t</tr>\r\n\t\t\t\t<tr>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<th scope="row" style="vertical-align: top; text-align: left; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\tHeadquarters</th>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<td class="label" style="vertical-align: top; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vancouver" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; text-align: left; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\tProducts</th>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<td style="vertical-align: top; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\tSimbaEngine ODBC SDK, SimbaProvider OLAP SDK, RelationalCube, SimbaO2X</td>\r\n\t\t\t\t</tr>\r\n\t\t\t\t<tr>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<th scope="row" style="vertical-align: top; text-align: left; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\tWebsite</th>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<td style="vertical-align: top; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<a class="external text" href="http://www.simba.com/" rel="nofollow" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(51, 102, 187); background-image: url(data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAoAAAAKCAYAAACNMs+9AAAAGXRFWHRTb2Z0d2FyZQBBZG9iZSBJbWFnZVJlYWR5ccllPAAAAFZJREFUeF59z4EJADEIQ1F36k7u5E7ZKXeUQPACJ3wK7UNokVxVk9kHnQH7bY9hbDyDhNXgjpRLqFlo4M2GgfyJHhjq8V4agfrgPQX3JtJQGbofmCHgA/nAKks+JAjFAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC); background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; padding-right: 13px; background-position: 100% 50%; background-repeat: no-repeat no-repeat; ">www.simba.com</a></td>\r\n\t\t\t\t</tr>\r\n\t\t\t</tbody>\r\n\t\t</table>\r\n\t\t<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t\t\t<b>Simba Technologies</b>&nbsp;is a supplier of standards-based data access solutions located in&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vancouver" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Vancouver">Vancouver</a>,&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/British_Columbia" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="British Columbia">British Columbia</a>,&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Canada" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Canada">Canada</a>. Simba Technologies specializes in connectivity for&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ODBC" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="ODBC">ODBC</a>,&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/JDBC" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="JDBC">JDBC</a>,<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/OLE_DB" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="OLE DB">OLE DB</a>&nbsp;for&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/OLAP" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="OLAP">OLAP</a>&nbsp;(ODBO) and&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/XML_for_Analysis" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="XML for Analysis">XML for Analysis</a>&nbsp;(XMLA). The company&rsquo;s products include a&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/JDBC" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="JDBC">JDBC</a>/<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ODBC" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="ODBC">ODBC</a>&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SDK" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="SDK">SDK</a>, an&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/OLAP" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="OLAP">OLAP</a>/ODBO/XMLA&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SDK" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="SDK">SDK</a>, a&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SQL" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="SQL">SQL</a>&nbsp;to&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MDX" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="MDX">MDX</a>&nbsp;adaptor, an ODBO to XMLA bridge, and MDX Provider for Oracle OLAP, and other data connectivity products.</p>\r\n\t\t<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t\t\tSimba Technologies customers include&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Microsoft" style="text-decoration: none; " title="Microsoft">Microsoft</a>,&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oracle_Corporation" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="SAP AG">SAP AG</a>&nbsp;and Descisys.</p>\r\n\t\t<h2 style="color: black; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t<a class="external text" href="http://www.simba.com/MDX-Provider-for-Oracle-OLAP.htm" rel="nofollow" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(51, 102, 187); background-image: url(data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAoAAAAKCAYAAACNMs+9AAAAGXRFWHRTb2Z0d2FyZQBBZG9iZSBJbWFnZVJlYWR5ccllPAAAAFZJREFUeF59z4EJADEIQ1F36k7u5E7ZKXeUQPACJ3wK7UNokVxVk9kHnQH7bY9hbDyDhNXgjpRLqFlo4M2GgfyJHhjq8V4agfrgPQX3JtJQGbofmCHgA/nAKks+JAjFAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC); ">MDX Provider for Oracle OLAP:</a>&nbsp;Directly connects familiar&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MDX" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="MDX">MDX</a>&nbsp;applications like Microsoft Excel to Oracle Database OLAP Option for ad hoc query and analysis</li>\r\n\t\t</ul>\r\n\t\t<h2 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.6em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-bottom-style: solid; border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); width: auto; font-size: 19px; ">\r\n\t\t\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Simba_Technologies&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: Simba history">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="Simba_history">Simba history</span></h2>\r\n\t\t<ul style="line-height: 1.5em; list-style-type: square; margin-top: 0.3em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 1.5em; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-left: 0px; list-style-image: url(data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAUAAAANCAMAAABW4lS6AAAAGXRFWHRTb2Z0d2FyZQBBZG9iZSBJbWFnZVJlYWR5ccllPAAAAAZQTFRFAFKM////QIUK9QAAAAJ0Uk5T/wDltzBKAAAAGklEQVR42mJgBAEGokgGBjBGBxBxsBqAAAMACHwALd5r8ygAAAAASUVORK5CYII=);
