"><span class="tocnumber">3.5</span>&nbsp;<span class="toctext">Limitations and advantages</span></a></strong></h3>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t</li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t</ul>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t</li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-9" style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<h3>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<strong><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Biological_psychology#Topic_areas_in_behavioral_neuroscience" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span class="tocnumber">4</span>&nbsp;<span class="toctext">Topic areas in behavioral neuroscience</span></a></strong></h3>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t</li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-10" style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<h3>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<strong><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Biological_psychology#Nobel_Laureates" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span class="tocnumber">5</span>&nbsp;<span class="toctext">Nobel Laureates</span></a></strong></h3>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t</li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-11" style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<h3>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<strong><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Biological_psychology#See_also" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span class="tocnumber">6</span>&nbsp;<span class="toctext">See also</span></a></strong></h3>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t</li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-12" style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<h3>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<strong><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Biological_psychology#References" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span class="tocnumber">7</span>&nbsp;<span class="toctext">References</span></a></strong></h3>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t</li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-13" style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<h3>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<strong><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Biological_psychology#External_links" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span class="tocnumber">8</span>&nbsp;<span class="toctext">External links</span></a></strong></h3>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t</li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t</ul>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t</td>\r\n\t\t\t\t</tr>\r\n\t\t\t</tbody>\r\n\t\t</table>\r\n\t\t<h3 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.6em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-bottom-style: solid; border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); width: auto; font-size: 19px; ">\r\n\t\t\t<strong><span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Behavioral_neuroscience&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: History">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="History">History</span></strong></h3>\r\n\t\t<h3 style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t\t\t<strong>Behavioral neuroscience as a scientific discipline emerged from a variety of scientific and philosophical traditions in the 18th and 19th centuries. In philosophy, men like&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ren%C3%A9_Descartes" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="René Descartes">Ren&eacute; Descartes</a>&nbsp;proposed physical models to explain animal and human behavior. Descartes, for example, suggested that the&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pineal_gland" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Pineal gland">pineal gland</a>, a midline unpaired structure in the brain of many organisms, was the point of contact between mind and body. Descartes also elaborated on a theory in which the&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pneumatics" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Pneumatics">pneumatics</a>&nbsp;of bodily fluids could explain&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reflexes" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Reflexes">reflexes</a>&nbsp;and other motor behavior. This theory was inspired by moving statues in a garden in Paris.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Carlson_2-0" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Biological_psychology#cite_note-Carlson-2" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>3<span>]</span></a></sup></strong></h3>\r\n\t\t<h3 style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t\t\t<strong>Other philosophers also helped give birth to&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Psychology" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Psychology">psychology</a>. One of the earliest textbooks in the new field,&nbsp;<i><a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Principles_of_Psychology" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="The Principles of Psychology">The Principles of Psychology</a></i>&nbsp;by&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_James" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="William James">William James</a>&nbsp;(1890), argues that the scientific study of psychology should be grounded in an understanding of biology:</strong></h3>\r\n\t\t<table class="cquote" style="font-size: 13px; margin-top: auto; margin-right: auto; margin-bottom: auto; margin-left: auto; border-collapse: collapse; border-top-style: none; border-right-style: none; border-bottom-style: none; border-left-style: none; background-color: transparent; width: auto; ">\r\n\t\t\t<tbody>\r\n\t\t\t\t<tr>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<td style="color: rgb(178, 183, 242); font-size: 35px; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-weight: bold; text-align: left; padding-top: 10px; padding-right: 10px; padding-bottom: 10px; padding-left: 10px; " valign="top" width="20">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<h3>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<strong>&ldquo;</strong></h3>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t</td>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<td style="padding-top: 4px; padding-right: 10px; padding-bottom: 4px; padding-left: 10px; " valign="top">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<h3>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<strong>Bodily experiences, therefore, and more particularly brain-experiences, must take a place amongst those conditions of the mental life of which Psychology need take account. The spiritualist and the associationist must both be &#39;cerebralists,&#39; to the extent at least of admitting that certain peculiarities in the way of working of their own favorite principles are explicable only by the fact that the brain laws are a codeterminant of their result.</strong></h3>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<h3 style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<strong>Our first conclusion, then, is that a certain amount of brain-physiology must be presupposed or included in Psychology.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-James_3-0" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Biological_psychology#cite_note-James-3" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>4<span>]</span></a></sup></strong></h3>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t</td>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<td style="color: rgb(178, 183, 242); font-size: 35px; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-weight: bold; text-align: right; padding-top: 10px; padding-right: 10px; padding-bottom: 10px; padding-left: 10px; " valign="bottom" width="20">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<h3>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<strong>&rdquo;</strong></h3>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t</td>\r\n\t\t\t\t</tr>\r\n\t\t\t</tbody>\r\n\t\t</table>\r\n\t\t<h3 style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t\t\t<strong>James, like many early psychologists, had considerable training in physiology. The emergence of both psychology and behavioral neuroscience as legitimate sciences can be traced from the emergence of physiology from&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anatomy" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Anatomy">anatomy</a>, particularly&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Neuroanatomy" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Neuroanatomy">neuroanatomy</a>. Physiologists conducted experiments on living organisms, a practice that was distrusted by the dominant anatomists of the 18th and 19th centuries.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Shepherd_4-0" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Biological_psychology#cite_note-Shepherd-4" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>5<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;The influential work of&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Claude_Bernard" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Claude Bernard">Claude Bernard</a>,&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_Bell" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Charles Bell">Charles Bell</a>, and&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_Harvey" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="William Harvey">William Harvey</a>&nbsp;helped to convince the scientific community that reliable data could be obtained from living subjects.</strong></h3>\r\n\t\t<h3 style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t\t\t<strong>The term &quot;psychobiology&quot; has been used in a variety of contexts,emphasizing the importance of biology, which is the discipline that studies organic, neural and cellular modifications in behavior, plasticity in neuroscience, and biological deceases in all aspects, in addition, biology focuses and analyzes behavior and all the subjects it is concerned about, from a scientific point of view. In this context, psychology helps as a complementary, but important discipline in the neurobiological sciences. The role of psychology in this questions is that of a social tool that backs up the main or strongest biological science. The term &quot;psychobiology&quot; was first used in its modern sense by Knight Dunlap in his book&nbsp;<i>An Outline of Psychobiology (1914)</i>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Dewsbury_5-0" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Biological_psychology#cite_note-Dewsbury-5" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>6<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;Dunlap also was the founder and editor-in-chief of the journal&nbsp;<i>Psychobiology</i>. In the announcement of that journal, Dunlap writes that the journal will publish research &quot;...bearing on the interconnection of mental and physiological functions&quot;, which describes the field of behavioral neuroscience even in its modern sense.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Dewsbury_5-1" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Biological_psychology#cite_note-Dewsbury-5" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>6<span>]</span></a></sup></strong></h3>\r\n\t\t<h3 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.6em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-bottom-style: solid; border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); width: auto; font-size: 19px; ">\r\n\t\t\t<strong><span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Behavioral_neuroscience&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: Relationship to other fields of psychology and biology">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="Relationship_to_other_fields_of_psychology_and_biology">Relationship to other fields of psychology and biology</span></strong></h3>\r\n\t\t<h3 style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t\t\t<strong>In many cases, humans may serve as experimental subjects in behavioral neuroscience experiments; however, a great deal of the experimental literature in behavioral neuroscience comes from the study of non-human species, most frequently rats, mice, and monkeys. As a result, a critical assumption in behavioral neuroscience is that organisms share biological and behavioral similarities, enough to permit extrapolations across species. This allies behavioral neuroscience closely with&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Comparative_psychology" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Comparative psychology">comparative psychology</a>,&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Evolutionary_psychology" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Evolutionary psychology">evolutionary psychology</a>,&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Evolutionary_biology" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Evolutionary biology">evolutionary biology</a>, and&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Neurobiology" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Neurobiology">neurobiology</a>. Behavioral neuroscience also has paradigmatic and methodological similarities to&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Neuropsychology" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Neuropsychology">neuropsychology</a>, which relies heavily on the study of the behavior of humans with nervous system dysfunction (i.e., a non-experimentally based biological manipulation).</strong></h3>\r\n\t\t<h3 style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t\t\t<strong>Synonyms for behavioral neuroscience include biopsychology and psychobiology.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-6" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Biological_psychology#cite_note-6" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>7<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Physiological_psychology" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Physiological psychology">Physiological psychology</a>&nbsp;is another term often used synonymously with behavioral neuroscience, though authors would make physiological psychology a subfield of behavioral neuroscience, with an appropriately narrow definition.</strong></h3>\r\n\t\t<h3 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.6em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-bottom-style: solid; border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); width: auto; font-size: 19px; ">\r\n\t\t\t<strong><span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Behavioral_neuroscience&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: Research methods">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="Research_methods">Research methods</span></strong></h3>\r\n\t\t<h3 style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t\t\t<strong>The distinguishing characteristic of a behavioral neuroscience experiment is that either the&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Independent_variable" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Independent variable">independent variable</a>&nbsp;of the experiment is biological, or some&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dependent_variable" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Dependent variable">dependent variable</a>&nbsp;is biological. In other words, the&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nervous_system" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Nervous system">nervous system</a>&nbsp;of the organism under study is permanently or temporarily altered, or some aspect of the nervous system is measured (usually to be related to a behavioral variable).</strong></h3>\r\n\t\t<h3 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; font-weight: bold; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.3em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: initial; border-bottom-style: none; border-bottom-color: initial; width: auto; font-size: 17px; ">\r\n\t\t\t<strong><span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Behavioral_neuroscience&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: Disabling or decreasing neural function">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="Disabling_or_decreasing_neural_function">Disabling or decreasing neural function</span></strong></h3>\r\n\t\t<ul style="line-height: 1.5em; list-style-type: square; margin-top: 0.3em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 1.5em; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-left: 0px; list-style-image: url(data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAUAAAANCAMAAABW4lS6AAAAGXRFWHRTb2Z0d2FyZQBBZG9iZSBJbWFnZVJlYWR5ccllPAAAAAZQTFRFAFKM////QIUK9QAAAAJ0Uk5T/wDltzBKAAAAGklEQVR42mJgBAEGokgGBjBGBxBxsBqAAAMACHwALd5r8ygAAAAASUVORK5CYII=); ">\r\n\t\t\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t<h3>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<strong><a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lesions" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Lesions">Lesions</a>&nbsp;- A classic method in which a brain-region of interest is destroyed or stimulated to observe any resulting changes such as degraded or enhanced performance on some behavioral measure. Lesions can be placed with relatively high accuracy thanks to a variety of brain &#39;atlases&#39; which provide a map of brain regions in 3-dimensional&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stereotactic_surgery" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Stereotactic surgery">stereotactic coordinates</a>.</strong></h3>\r\n\t\t\t\t<ul style="line-height: 1.5em; list-style-type: square; margin-top: 0.3em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 1.5em; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-left: 0px; list-style-image: url(data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAUAAAANCAMAAABW4lS6AAAAGXRFWHRTb2Z0d2FyZQBBZG9iZSBJbWFnZVJlYWR5ccllPAAAAAZQTFRFAFKM////QIUK9QAAAAJ0Uk5T/wDltzBKAAAAGklEQVR42mJgBAEGokgGBjBGBxBxsBqAAAMACHwALd5r8ygAAAAASUVORK5CYII=); ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<h3>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<strong>Surgical lesions&nbsp;- Neural tissue is destroyed by removing it surgically.</strong></h3>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t</li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<h3>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<strong>Electrolytic lesions&nbsp;- Neural tissue is destroyed through the application of electrical shock trauma.</strong></h3>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t</li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<h3>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<strong>Chemical lesions&nbsp;- Neural tissue is destroyed by the infusion of a&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Neurotoxin" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Neurotoxin">neurotoxin</a>.</strong></h3>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t</li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<h3>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<strong>Temporary lesions&nbsp;- Neural tissue is temporarily disabled&nbsp;</strong></h3>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t</li>\r\n\t\t\t\t</ul>\r\n\t\t\t</li>\r\n\t\t</ul>\r\n\t</div>\r\n</div>\r\n	4	2011-10-20 18:36:57.633071	2011-10-20 18:36:57.765145	32	29	latest
31	Transcranial magnetic stimulation	2	<p>\r\n\t&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p>\r\n\t&nbsp;</p>\r\n<div style="height: 100%; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-left: 0px; font-family: sans-serif; font-size: 1em; background-color: rgb(243, 243, 243); background-image: url(data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAEAAAABCAAAAAA6fptVAAAAGXRFWHRTb2Z0d2FyZQBBZG9iZSBJbWFnZVJlYWR5ccllPAAAABRJREFUeF4FwTEBAAAAwJD1D+weGQD4APc0a6VeAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC); direction: ltr; unicode-bidi: embed; ">\r\n\t<div class="noprint" id="mw-head-base" style="margin-top: -5em; margin-left: 10em; height: 5em; background-image: url(data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAEAAAABCAIAAACQd1PeAAAAGXRFWHRTb2Z0d2FyZQBBZG9iZSBJbWFnZVJlYWR5ccllPAAAABhJREFUeF4FwTEBAAAAgjD7FzESWfjYdgwEoAJ4lTsaxgAAAABJRU5ErkJggg==); background-position: 0% 100%; background-repeat: repeat no-repeat; ">\r\n\t\t&nbsp;</div>\r\n\t<div id="content" style="margin-left: 10em; padding-top: 1em; padding-right: 1em; padding-bottom: 1em; padding-left: 1em; background-image: url(data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAEAAAABCAIAAACQd1PeAAAAGXRFWHRTb2Z0d2FyZQBBZG9iZSBJbWFnZVJlYWR5ccllPAAAABhJREFUeF4FwTEBAAAAgjD7FzESWfjYdgwEoAJ4lTsaxgAAAABJRU5ErkJggg==); background-color: white; color: black; direction: ltr; line-height: 1.5em; background-position: 0% 0%; background-repeat: no-repeat repeat; ">\r\n\t\t<div id="siteNotice" style="position: relative; text-align: center; font-size: 0.8em; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; ">\r\n\t\t\t&nbsp;</div>\r\n\t\t<h1 class="firstHeading" id="firstHeading" style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.1em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-bottom-style: solid; border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); width: auto; font-size: 1.6em; line-height: 1.2em; ">\r\n\t\t\tTranscranial magnetic stimulation</h1>\r\n\t\t<div id="bodyContent" style="font-size: 0.8em; position: relative; width: 1393px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t\t\t<div id="siteSub" style="display: inline; font-size: 12px; ">\r\n\t\t\t\tFrom Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia</div>\r\n\t\t\t<div id="contentSub" style="font-size: 11px; line-height: 1.2em; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 1.4em; margin-left: 1em; color: rgb(125, 125, 125); width: auto; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t&nbsp;</div>\r\n\t\t\t<div class="mw-content-ltr" dir="ltr" lang="en" style="direction: ltr; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t<div class="dablink" style="font-style: italic; padding-left: 2em; margin-bottom: 0.5em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\tFor other uses, see&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/TMS_(disambiguation)" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="TMS (disambiguation)">TMS (disambiguation)</a>.</div>\r\n\t\t\t\t<table cellspacing="5" class="infobox" style="font-size: 11px; border-top-style: solid; border-right-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); border-right-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); border-left-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); color: black; margin-top: 0.5em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 1em; padding-top: 0.2em; padding-right: 0.2em; padding-bottom: 0.2em; padding-left: 0.2em; float: right; clear: right; text-align: left; line-height: 1.5em; width: 22em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<tbody>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<tr>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<th colspan="2" style="vertical-align: top; text-align: center; font-size: 14px; font-weight: bold; background-color: rgb(173, 216, 230); ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\tTranscranial magnetic stimulation</th>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t</tr>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<tr>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<td colspan="2" style="vertical-align: top; text-align: center; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<i>Intervention</i></td>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t</tr>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<tr>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<td colspan="2" style="vertical-align: top; text-align: center; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<a class="image" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Repetitive_transcranial_magnetic_stimulation_(rTMS)_is_a_technique_for_noninvasive_stimulation_of_the_adult_brain.jpg" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><img alt="" height="214" src="http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/16/Repetitive_transcranial_magnetic_stimulation_%28rTMS%29_is_a_technique_for_noninvasive_stimulation_of_the_adult_brain.jpg/230px-Repetitive_transcranial_magnetic_stimulation_%28rTMS%29_is_a_technique_for_noninvasive_stimulation_of_the_adult_brain.jpg" style="border-top-style: none; border-right-style: none; border-bottom-style: none; border-left-style: none; border-width: initial; border-color: initial; vertical-align: middle; " width="230" /></a><br />\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<span>rTMS in a rodent.</span></td>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t</tr>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<tr>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<th scope="row" style="vertical-align: top; text-align: left; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Medical_Subject_Headings" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Medical Subject Headings">MeSH</a></th>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<td style="vertical-align: top; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<span class="reflink plainlinks nourlexpansion"><a class="external text" href="http://www.nlm.nih.gov/cgi/mesh/2011/MB_cgi?field=uid&amp;term=D050781" rel="nofollow" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(51, 102, 187); background-image: url(data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAoAAAAKCAYAAACNMs+9AAAAGXRFWHRTb2Z0d2FyZQBBZG9iZSBJbWFnZVJlYWR5ccllPAAAAFZJREFUeF59z4EJADEIQ1F36k7u5E7ZKXeUQPACJ3wK7UNokVxVk9kHnQH7bY9hbDyDhNXgjpRLqFlo4M2GgfyJHhjq8V4agfrgPQX3JtJQGbofmCHgA/nAKks+JAjFAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC); background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; padding-top: 0px !important; padding-right: 13px; padding-bottom: 0px !important; padding-left: 0px !important; background-position: 0% 0%; background-repeat: no-repeat no-repeat; ">D050781</a></span></td>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t</tr>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t</tbody>\r\n\t\t\t\t</table>\r\n\t\t\t\t<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<b>Transcranial magnetic stimulation</b>&nbsp;(<b>TMS</b>) is a noninvasive method to cause&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Depolarization" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Depolarization">depolarization</a>&nbsp;or&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hyperpolarization" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Hyperpolarization">hyperpolarization</a>&nbsp;in the&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Neuron" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Neuron">neurons</a>&nbsp;of the&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brain" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Brain">brain</a>. TMS uses&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Electromagnetic_induction" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Electromagnetic induction">electromagnetic induction</a>&nbsp;to induce weak<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Electric_current" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Electric current">electric currents</a>&nbsp;using a rapidly changing&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Magnetic_field" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Magnetic field">magnetic field</a>; this can cause activity in specific or general parts of the brain with minimal discomfort, allowing the functioning and interconnections of the brain to be studied. A variant of TMS,&nbsp;<b>repetitive transcranial magnetic stimulation</b>&nbsp;(<b>rTMS</b>), has been tested as a treatment tool for various&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Neurological_disorder" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Neurological disorder">neurological</a>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mental_disorder" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Mental disorder">psychiatric</a>&nbsp;disorders including<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Migraine" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Migraine">migraines</a>,&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stroke" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Stroke">strokes</a>,&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Parkinson%27s_disease" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Parkinson's disease">Parkinson&#39;s disease</a>,&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dystonia" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Dystonia">dystonia</a>,&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tinnitus" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Tinnitus">tinnitus</a>,&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Major_depressive_disorder" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Major depressive disorder">depression</a>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Auditory_hallucination" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Auditory hallucination">auditory hallucinations</a>.</p>\r\n\t\t\t\t<table class="toc" id="toc" style="font-size: 12px; border-top-style: solid; border-right-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); border-right-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); border-left-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); padding-top: 5px; padding-right: 5px; padding-bottom: 5px; padding-left: 5px; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<tbody>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<tr>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<td>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<div id="toctitle" style="direction: ltr; text-align: center; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<h2 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; font-weight: bold; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.6em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; border-bottom-style: none; width: auto; font-size: 12px; display: inline; border-top-style: none; border-right-style: none; border-left-style: none; border-width: initial; border-color: initial; padding-right: 0px; padding-left: 0px; border-width: initial; border-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\tContents</h2>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t&nbsp;<span class="toctoggle" style="font-size: 11px; text-align: left; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-1" style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#Background" style="text-decoration: none; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span class="tocnumber">9</span>&nbsp;<span class="toctext">Further reading</span></a></li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-15" style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#External_links" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span class="tocnumber">10</span>&nbsp;<span class="toctext">External links</span></a></li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t</ul>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t</td>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t</tr>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t</tbody>\r\n\t\t\t\t</table>\r\n\t\t\t\t<h2 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.6em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-bottom-style: solid; border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); width: auto; font-size: 19px; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: Background">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="Background">Background</span></h2>\r\n\t\t\t\t<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\tThe principle of inductive brain stimulation with&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eddy_current" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Eddy current">eddy currents</a>&nbsp;has been noted since the 20th century. The first successful TMS study was performed in 1985 by Anthony Barker and his colleagues in&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sheffield" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Sheffield">Sheffield</a>, England.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Barker_0-0" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-Barker-0" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>1<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;Its earliest application demonstrated conduction of nerve impulses from the&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Motor_cortex" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Motor cortex">motor cortex</a>&nbsp;to the&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spinal_cord" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Spinal cord">spinal cord</a>, stimulating muscle contractions. The use of magnets rather than a direct electric current to the brain reduced the discomfort of the procedure and research and allowed mapping of the&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cerebral_cortex" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Cerebral cortex">cerebral cortex</a>&nbsp;and its connections.</p>\r\n\t\t\t\t<h2 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.6em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-bottom-style: solid; border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); width: auto; font-size: 19px; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: Effects on the brain">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="Effects_on_the_brain">Effects on the brain</span></h2>\r\n\t\t\t\t<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\tThe exact details of how TMS functions are still being explored. The effects of TMS can be divided into two types depending on the mode of stimulation:</p>\r\n\t\t\t\t<ul style="line-height: 1.5em; list-style-type: square; margin-top: 0.3em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 1.5em; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-left: 0px; list-style-image: url(data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAUAAAANCAMAAABW4lS6AAAAGXRFWHRTb2Z0d2FyZQBBZG9iZSBJbWFnZVJlYWR5ccllPAAAAAZQTFRFAFKM////QIUK9QAAAAJ0Uk5T/wDltzBKAAAAGklEQVR42mJgBAEGokgGBjBGBxBxsBqAAAMACHwALd5r8ygAAAAASUVORK5CYII=); ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\tSingle or paired pulse TMS causes neurons in the neocortex under the site of stimulation to&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Depolarization" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Depolarization">depolarize</a>&nbsp;and discharge an&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Action_potential" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Action potential">action potential</a>. If used in the&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Primary_motor_cortex" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Primary motor cortex">primary motor cortex</a>, it produces muscle activity referred to as a&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Evoked_potential#Motor_evoked_potentials" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Evoked potential">motor evoked potential</a>&nbsp;(MEP) which can be recorded on&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Electromyography" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Electromyography">electromyography</a>. If used on the&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Occipital_cortex" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Occipital cortex">occipital cortex</a>, &#39;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Phosphene" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Phosphene">phosphenes</a>&#39; (flashes of light) might be perceived by the subject. In most other areas of the cortex, the participant does not consciously experience any effect, but his or her behaviour may be slightly altered (e.g. slower reaction time on a cognitive task), or changes in brain activity may be detected using sensing equipment.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Handbook_of_Transcranial_Magnetic_Stimulation_1-0" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-Handbook_of_Transcranial_Magnetic_Stimulation-1" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>2<span>]</span></a></sup></li>\r\n\t\t\t\t</ul>\r\n\t\t\t\t<ul style="line-height: 1.5em; list-style-type: square; margin-top: 0.3em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 1.5em; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-left: 0px; list-style-image: url(data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAUAAAANCAMAAABW4lS6AAAAGXRFWHRTb2Z0d2FyZQBBZG9iZSBJbWFnZVJlYWR5ccllPAAAAAZQTFRFAFKM////QIUK9QAAAAJ0Uk5T/wDltzBKAAAAGklEQVR42mJgBAEGokgGBjBGBxBxsBqAAAMACHwALd5r8ygAAAAASUVORK5CYII=); ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\tRepetitive TMS produces longer-lasting effects which persist past the initial period of stimulation. rTMS can increase or decrease the excitability of the&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Corticospinal_tract" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Corticospinal tract">corticospinal tract</a>&nbsp;depending on the intensity of stimulation, coil orientation and frequency. The mechanism of these effects is not clear although it is widely believed to reflect changes in synaptic efficacy akin to&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Long-term_potentiation" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Long-term potentiation">long-term potentiation</a>&nbsp;(LTP) and&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Long-term_depression" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Long-term depression">long-term depression</a>&nbsp;(LTD).<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Fitzgerald_2-0" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-Fitzgerald-2" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>3<span>]</span></a></sup></li>\r\n\t\t\t\t</ul>\r\n\t\t\t\t<h2 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.6em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-bottom-style: solid; border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); width: auto; font-size: 19px; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: Risks">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="Risks">Risks</span></h2>\r\n\t\t\t\t<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\tAlthough TMS is often regarded as safe, the greatest&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Acute_(medicine)" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Acute (medicine)">acute</a>&nbsp;risk of TMS is the rare occurrence of induced&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Epileptic_seizure" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Epileptic seizure">seizures</a>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syncope_(medicine)" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Syncope (medicine)">syncope</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Rossi_3-0" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-Rossi-3" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>4<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;More than 16 cases of TMS-related seizure have been reported in the literature, with at least seven reported before the publication of safety guidelines in 1998,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Wassermann1998_4-0" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-Wassermann1998-4" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>5<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;and more than nine reported afterwards. The seizures have been associated with single-pulse and rTMS. Reports have stated that in at least some cases, predisposing factors (medication, brain lesions or genetic susceptibility) may have contributed to the seizure. A review of nine seizures associated with rTMS that had been reported after 1998 stated that four seizures were within the safety parameters, four were outside of those parameters, and one had occurred in a healthy volunteer with no predisposing factors. A 2009 international consensus statement on TMS that contained this review concluded that based on the number of studies, subjects and patients involved with TMS research, the risk of seizure with rTMS is considered very low.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Rossi_3-1" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-Rossi-3" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>4<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n\t\t\t\t<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\tBesides seizures, other risks include&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syncope_(medicine)" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Syncope (medicine)">fainting</a>, minor pains such as headache or local discomfort, minor cognitive changes and psychiatric symptoms (particularly a low risk of&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mania" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Mania">mania</a>&nbsp;in depressed patients).<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Rossi_3-2" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-Rossi-3" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>4<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;Though other side effects are thought to be possibly associated with TMS (alterations to the&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Endocrine_system" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Endocrine system">endocrine system</a>, altered&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Neurotransmitter" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Neurotransmitter">neurotransmitter</a>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Immune_system" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Immune system">immune system</a>&nbsp;activity) they are considered investigational and lacking substantive proof.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Rossi_3-3" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-Rossi-3" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>4<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n\t\t\t\t<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\tOther adverse effects of TMS are:</p>\r\n\t\t\t\t<ul style="line-height: 1.5em; list-style-type: square; margin-top: 0.3em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 1.5em; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-left: 0px; list-style-image: url(data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAUAAAANCAMAAABW4lS6AAAAGXRFWHRTb2Z0d2FyZQBBZG9iZSBJbWFnZVJlYWR5ccllPAAAAAZQTFRFAFKM////QIUK9QAAAAJ0Uk5T/wDltzBKAAAAGklEQVR42mJgBAEGokgGBjBGBxBxsBqAAAMACHwALd5r8ygAAAAASUVORK5CYII=); ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\tDiscomfort or pain from the stimulation of the scalp and associated&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nerves" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Nerves">nerves</a>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Muscle" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Muscle">muscles</a>&nbsp;on the overlying skin;<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-nami_5-0" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-nami-5" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>6<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;this is more common with rTMS than single pulse TMS,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Wassermann1998_4-1" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-Wassermann1998-4" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>5<span>]</span></a></sup></li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\tRapid deformation of the TMS coil produces a loud clicking sound which increases with the stimulator intensity that can affect hearing with sufficient exposure, particularly relevant for rTMS (hearing protection may be used to prevent this),<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Wassermann1998_4-2" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-Wassermann1998-4" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>5<span>]</span></a></sup></li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\trTMS in the presence of incompatible EEG electrodes can result in electrode heating and, in severe cases, skin burns.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-roth_6-0" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-roth-6" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>7<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;Non-metallic electrodes are used if concurrent EEG data is required.</li>\r\n\t\t\t\t</ul>\r\n\t\t\t\t<h2 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.6em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-bottom-style: solid; border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); width: auto; font-size: 19px; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: Clinical uses">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="Clinical_uses">Clinical uses</span></h2>\r\n\t\t\t\t<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\tThe uses of TMS and rTMS can be divided into diagnostic and therapeutic uses.</p>\r\n\t\t\t\t<h3 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; font-weight: bold; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.3em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: initial; border-bottom-style: none; border-bottom-color: initial; width: auto; font-size: 17px; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: Diagnosis">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="Diagnosis">Diagnosis</span></h3>\r\n\t\t\t\t<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\tTMS can be used clinically to measure activity and function of specific brain circuits in humans. The most robust and widely-accepted use is in measuring the connection between the&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Primary_motor_cortex" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Primary motor cortex">primary motor cortex</a>&nbsp;and a muscle to evaluate damage from&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stroke" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Stroke">strokes</a>,&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spinal_cord" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Spinal cord">spinal cord</a>&nbsp;injuries,&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Multiple_sclerosis" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Multiple sclerosis">multiple sclerosis</a>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Motor_neuron_disease" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Motor neuron disease">motor neuron disease</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-7" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-7" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>8<span>]</span></a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Dimyan_8-0" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-Dimyan-8" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>9<span>]</span></a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Nowak_9-0" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-Nowak-9" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>10<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;TMS has been suggested as a means of assessing short-interval intracortical inhibition (SICI) which measures the internal pathways of the&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Motor_cortex" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Motor cortex">motor cortex</a>but this use has not yet been validated.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Kujirai_10-0" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-Kujirai-10" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>11<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n\t\t\t\t<h3 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; font-weight: bold; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.3em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: initial; border-bottom-style: none; border-bottom-color: initial; width: auto; font-size: 17px; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: Therapy">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="Therapy">Therapy</span></h3>\r\n\t\t\t\t<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\tStudies of the use of TMS and rTMS to treat neurological and psychiatric conditions have shown only modest effects with little confirmation of results.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Slotema_11-0" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-Slotema-11" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>12<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;However, publications reporting the results of reviews and statistical&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Meta-analysis" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial;
