" title="Meta-analysis">meta-analyses</a>&nbsp;of earlier investigations have stated that rTMS appeared to be effective in the treatment of certain types of&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Major_depressive_disorder" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Major depressive disorder">major depression</a>&nbsp;under certain specific conditions.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Slotema_11-1" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-Slotema-11" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>12<span>]</span></a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-12" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-12" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>13<span>]</span></a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-pmid17655558_13-0" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-pmid17655558-13" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>14<span>]</span></a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-14" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-14" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>15<span>]</span></a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-15" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-15" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>16<span>]</span></a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-pmid18447962_16-0" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-pmid18447962-16" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>17<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;rTMS devices are marketed for the treatment of such disorders in Canada, Australia, New Zealand, the European Union, Israel and the United States.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-pmid17655558_13-1" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-pmid17655558-13" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>14<span>]</span></a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Melkerson_17-0" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-Melkerson-17" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>18<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n\t\t\t\t<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\tA recent meta-analysis of 34 studies comparing rTMS to sham treatment showed an&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Effect_size" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Effect size">effect size</a>&nbsp;of 0.55 (p&lt;.001).<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-ReferenceA_18-0" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-ReferenceA-18" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>19<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;This is comparable to commonly reported effect sizes of pharmacotherapeutic strategies for treatment of depression in the range of 0.17-0.46.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-ReferenceA_18-1" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-ReferenceA-18" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>19<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;However, that same meta-analysis found that rTMS was significantly worse than electroconvulsive therapy (effect size -0.47), although side effects were significantly better with rTMS. An analysis of one of the studies included in the meta-analysis showed that one extra remission from depression occurs for every 3 patients given electroconvulsive therapy rather than rTMS (number needed to treat 2.36).<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-19" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-19" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>20<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n\t\t\t\t<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\tThere is evidence that rTMS can temporarily reduce chronic pain and change pain-related brain and nerve activity, and TMS has been used to predict the success of surgically implanted electrical brain stimulation for the treatment of pain.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-20" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-20" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>21<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n\t\t\t\t<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\tOther areas of research include the rehabilitation of&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aphasia" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Aphasia">aphasia</a>&nbsp;and motor disability after stroke,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Rossi_3-4" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-Rossi-3" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>4<span>]</span></a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Dimyan_8-1" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-Dimyan-8" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>9<span>]</span></a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Nowak_9-1" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-Nowak-9" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>10<span>]</span></a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-21" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-21" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>22<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tinnitus" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Tinnitus">tinnitus</a>,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-22" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-22" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>23<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Parkinson%27s_disease" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Parkinson's disease">Parkinson&#39;s disease</a><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-23" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-23" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>24<span>]</span></a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-24" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-24" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>25<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;and the negative symptoms of&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Schizophrenia" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Schizophrenia">schizophrenia</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-25" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-25" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>26<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;TMS has failed to show effectiveness for the treatment of&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brain_death" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Brain death">brain death</a>,&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coma" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Coma">coma</a>, and other&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Persistent_vegetative_state" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Persistent vegetative state">persistent vegetative states</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-26" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-26" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>27<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n\t\t\t\t<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\tIt is difficult to establish a convincing form of &quot;sham&quot; TMS to test for&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Placebo" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Placebo">placebo</a>&nbsp;effects during&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scientific_control" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Scientific control">controlled</a>&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clinical_trial" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Clinical trial">trials</a>&nbsp;in&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conscious" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Conscious">conscious</a>&nbsp;individuals, due to the neck pain, headache and twitching in the scalp or upper face associated with the intervention.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Rossi_3-5" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-Rossi-3" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>4<span>]</span></a></sup>&quot;Sham&quot; TMS manipulations can affect&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cerebrum" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Cerebrum">cerebral</a>&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glycolysis" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Glycolysis">glucose metabolism</a>&nbsp;and MEPs, which may confound results.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-pmid17655558_13-2" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-pmid17655558-13" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>14<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;This problem is exacerbated when using&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Subjectivity" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Subjectivity">subjective</a>&nbsp;measures of improvement. Depending on the research question asked and the&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Design_of_experiments" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Design of experiments">experimental design</a>, matching this discomfort to distinguish true effects from placebo can be an important and challenging issue.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Rossi_3-6" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-Rossi-3" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>4<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n\t\t\t\t<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\tA recent&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Multicenter_trial" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Multicenter trial">multicenter trial</a>&nbsp;of rTMS in depression used a &quot;sham&quot; placebo treatment that appeared to mimic the sound and scalp stimulation associated with active TMS treatment. The investigators concluded: &quot;Although the treatment effect was statistically significant on a clinically meaningful variable (remission), the overall number of remitters and responders was less than one would like with a treatment that requires daily intervention for 3 weeks or more, even with a benign adverse effect profile&quot;.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-27" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-27" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>28<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;However, a review of the trial&#39;s report has questioned the adequacy of the placebo, noting that treaters were able to guess whether patients were receiving treatment with active or sham TMS, better than chance.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-28" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-28" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>29<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n\t\t\t\t<h2 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.6em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-bottom-style: solid; border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); width: auto; font-size: 19px; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation&amp;action=edit&amp;section=7" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: FDA actions and responses">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="FDA_actions_and_responses">FDA actions and responses</span></h2>\r\n\t\t\t\t<h3 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; font-weight: bold; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.3em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: initial; border-bottom-style: none; border-bottom-color: initial; width: auto; font-size: 17px; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation&amp;action=edit&amp;section=8" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: FDA actions">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="FDA_actions">FDA actions</span></h3>\r\n\t\t\t\t<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\tIn January 2007 an advisory panel of the United States&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Food_and_Drug_Administration" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Food and Drug Administration">Food and Drug Administration</a>&nbsp;(FDA) did not recommend clearance for marketing of an rTMS device, stating that the device appeared to be reasonably safe but had failed to demonstrate&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Efficacy" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Efficacy">efficacy</a>&nbsp;in a study of people with major depression who had not benefitted from prior adequate treatment with oral antidepressants during their current major depressive episode.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Scudiero_29-0" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-Scudiero-29" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>30<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;The panel agreed that &quot;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blind_experiment" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Blind experiment">unblinding</a>&nbsp;was greater in the active group, and considering the magnitude of the&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Effect_size" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Effect size">effect size</a>, it may have influenced the study results.&quot;<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Scudiero_29-1" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-Scudiero-29" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>30<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;However, the FDA determined in December 2008 that the rTMS device was sufficiently similar to existing devices that did not require a&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Premarket_approval" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Premarket approval">premarket approval</a>&nbsp;application and allowed the device to be marketed in accordance with&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Federal_Food,_Drug,_and_Cosmetic_Act#Section_510.28k.29_and_the_device_approval_process" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act">Section 510(k)</a>&nbsp;of the&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Federal_Food,_Drug,_and_Cosmetic_Act" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act">Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act</a>&nbsp;for &quot;the treatment of Major Depressive Disorder in adult patients who have failed to achieve satisfactory improvement from one prior&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Antidepressant" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Antidepressant">antidepressant</a>&nbsp;medication at or above the minimal effective dose and duration in the current episode&quot;.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Melkerson_17-1" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-Melkerson-17" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>18<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;The user manual for the device warns that effectiveness has not been established in patients with major depressive disorder who have failed to achieve satisfactory improvement from zero and from two or more antidepressant medications in the current episode and that the device has not been studied in patients who have had no prior antidepressant medication.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-30" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-30" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>31<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n\t\t\t\t<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\tIn July 2011 the FDA published a final rule in the&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Federal_Register" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Federal Register">Federal Register</a>&nbsp;that classified the rTMS system into class II (special controls) (see:&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Medical_device#Classification" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Medical device">Medical device#Classification</a>) &quot;in order to provide a reasonable assurance of safety and effectiveness of these devices&quot;. The rule identified the rTMS system as &quot;an external device that delivers transcranial pulsed magnetic fields of sufficient magnitude to induce neural action potentials in the prefrontal cortex to treat the symptoms of major depressive disorder without inducing seizure in patients who have failed at least one antidepressant medication and are currently not on any antidepressant therapy&quot;.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-31" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-31" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>32<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;An FDA guidance document issued in conjunction with the final rule describes the special controls that support the classification of the rTMS system into Class II.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-32" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-32" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>33<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n\t\t\t\t<h3 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; font-weight: bold; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.3em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: initial; border-bottom-style: none; border-bottom-color: initial; width: auto; font-size: 17px; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation&amp;action=edit&amp;section=9" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: Response to FDA decision">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="Response_to_FDA_decision">Response to FDA decision</span></h3>\r\n\t\t\t\t<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\tSoon after the FDA cleared the device, several members of&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Public_Citizen" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Public Citizen">Public Citizen</a>&nbsp;stated in a&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Letter_to_the_editor" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Letter to the editor">letter to the editor</a>&nbsp;of the medical journal&nbsp;<i>Neuropsychopharmacology</i>&nbsp;that the FDA seemed to have based its decision on a&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Post-hoc_analysis" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Post-hoc analysis"><i>post-hoc</i>&nbsp;analysis</a>&nbsp;that did not establish the effectiveness of rTMS for the treatment of depression. The writers of the letter expressed their concern that patients would be diverted from therapies such as antidepressant medications that have an established history of effectiveness.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-33" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-33" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>34<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n\t\t\t\t<h2 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.6em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-bottom-style: solid; border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); width: auto; font-size: 19px; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation&amp;action=edit&amp;section=10" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: Technical information">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="Technical_information">Technical information</span></h2>\r\n\t\t\t\t<div class="floatright" style="clear: right; float: right; position: relative; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0.5em; border-top-width: 0px; border-right-width: 0px; border-bottom-width: 0px; border-left-width: 0px; border-style: initial; border-color: initial; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<a class="image" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:TMS_focal_field_.png" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><img alt="TMS focal field .png" height="133" src="http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/6f/TMS_focal_field_.png/150px-TMS_focal_field_.png" style="border-top-style: none; border-right-style: none; border-bottom-style: none; border-left-style: none; border-width: initial; border-color: initial; vertical-align: middle; " width="150" /></a></div>\r\n\t\t\t\t<div class="thumb tright" style="clear: right; float: right; margin-bottom: 1.3em; width: auto; background-color: transparent; margin-top: 0.5em; margin-right: 0px; margin-left: 1.4em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<div class="thumbinner" style="min-width: 100px; border-top-width: 1px; border-right-width: 1px; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-left-width: 1px; border-top-style: solid; border-right-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: rgb(204, 204, 204); border-right-color: rgb(204, 204, 204); border-bottom-color: rgb(204, 204, 204); border-left-color: rgb(204, 204, 204); padding-top: 3px !important; padding-right: 3px !important; padding-bottom: 3px !important; padding-left: 3px !important; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); font-size: 12px; text-align: center; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; width: 149px; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<a class="image" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:TMS_Butterfly_Coil_HEAD_.png" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><img alt="" class="thumbimage" height="192" src="http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/a/a2/TMS_Butterfly_Coil_HEAD_.png" style="border-top-style: solid; border-right-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-width: initial; border-color: initial; vertical-align: middle; border-top-width: 1px; border-right-width: 1px; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-left-width: 1px; border-top-color: rgb(204, 204, 204); border-right-color: rgb(204, 204, 204); border-bottom-color: rgb(204, 204, 204); border-left-color: rgb(204, 204, 204); background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); " width="147" /></a>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<div class="thumbcaption" style="text-align: left; border-top-style: none; border-right-style: none; border-bottom-style: none; border-left-style: none; border-width: initial; border-color: initial; line-height: 1.4em; padding-top: 3px !important; padding-right: 3px !important; padding-bottom: 3px !important; padding-left: 3px !important; font-size: 11px; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<div class="magnify" style="float: right; border-top-style: none !important; border-right-style: none !important; border-bottom-style: none !important; border-left-style: none !important; border-width: initial !important; border-color: initial !important; background-image: none !important; background-attachment: initial !important; background-origin: initial !important; background-clip: initial !important; background-color: initial !important; background-position: initial initial !important; background-repeat: initial initial !important; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<a class="internal" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:TMS_Butterfly_Coil_HEAD_.png" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none !important; background-attachment: initial !important; background-origin: initial !important; background-clip: initial !important; background-color: initial !important; display: block; border-top-style: none !important; border-right-style: none !important; border-bottom-style: none !important; border-left-style: none !important; border-width: initial !important; border-color: initial !important; background-position: initial initial !important; background-repeat: initial initial !important; " title="Enlarge"><img alt="" height="11" src="http://bits.wikimedia.org/skins-1.18/common/images/magnify-clip.png" style="border-top-style: none !important; border-right-style: none !important; border-bottom-style: none !important; border-left-style: none !important; border-width: initial; border-color: initial; vertical-align: middle; display: block; border-width: initial !important; border-color: initial !important; background-image: none !important; background-attachment: initial !important; background-origin: initial !important; background-clip: initial !important; background-color: initial !important; background-position: initial initial !important; background-repeat: initial initial !important; " width="15" /></a></div>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\tTMS - Butterfly Coils</div>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t</div>\r\n\t\t\t\t</div>\r\n\t\t\t\t<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\tTMS uses&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Electromagnetic_induction" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Electromagnetic induction">electromagnetic induction</a>&nbsp;to generate an electric current across the&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scalp" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Scalp">scalp</a>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Human_skull" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Human skull">skull</a>&nbsp;without physical contact. A plastic-enclosed coil of wire is held next to the skull and when activated, produces a<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Magnetic_field" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Magnetic field">magnetic field</a>&nbsp;oriented&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orthogonality" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Orthogonality">orthogonally</a>&nbsp;to the plane of the coil. The magnetic field passes unimpeded through the skin and skull, inducing an oppositely directed current in the brain that activates nearby nerve cells in much the same way as currents applied directly to the cortical surface.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-34" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-34" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>35<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n\t\t\t\t<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\tThe path of this current is difficult to model because the brain is irregularly shaped and electricity and magnetism are not&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Electrical_conduction" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Electrical conduction">conducted</a>&nbsp;uniformly throughout its tissues. The magnetic field is about the same strength as an&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Magnetic_resonance_imaging" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Magnetic resonance imaging">MRI</a>, and the pulse generally reaches no more than 5 centimeters into the brain.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-35" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-35" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>36<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n\t\t\t\t<h3 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; font-weight: bold; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.3em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: initial; border-bottom-style: none; border-bottom-color: initial; width: auto; font-size: 17px; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation&amp;action=edit&amp;section=11" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: Coil types">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="Coil_types">Coil types</span></h3>\r\n\t\t\t\t<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\tThe design of transcranial magnetic stimulation coils used in either treatment or diagnostic/experimental studies may differ in a variety of ways. These differences should be considered in the interpretation of any study result, and the type of coil used should be specified in the study methods for any published reports.</p>\r\n\t\t\t\t<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\tThe most important considerations include:</p>\r\n\t\t\t\t<ul style="line-height: 1.5em; list-style-type: square; margin-top: 0.3em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 1.5em; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-left: 0px; list-style-image: url(data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAUAAAANCAMAAABW4lS6AAAAGXRFWHRTb2Z0d2FyZQBBZG9iZSBJbWFnZVJlYWR5ccllPAAAAAZQTFRFAFKM////QIUK9QAAAAJ0Uk5T/wDltzBKAAAAGklEQVR42mJgBAEGokgGBjBGBxBxsBqAAAMACHwALd5r8ygAAAAASUVORK5CYII=); ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\tthe type of material used to construct the core of the coil</li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\tthe geometry of the coil configuration</li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\tthe biophysical characteristics of the pulse produced by the coil.</li>\r\n\t\t\t\t</ul>\r\n\t\t\t\t<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\tWith regard to coil composition, the core material may be either a magnetically inert substrate (i.e., the so-called &lsquo;air-core&rsquo;coil design), or possess a solid, ferromagnetically active material (ie, the so-called &lsquo;solid-core&rsquo; design). Solid core coil design result in a more efficient transfer of electrical energy into a magnetic field, with a substantially reduced amount of energy dissipated as heat, and so can be operated under more aggressive duty cycles often mandated in therapeutic protocols, without treatment interruption due to heat accumulation, or the use of an accessory method of cooling the coil during operation. Varying the geometric shape of the coil itself may also result in variations in the focality, shape, and depth of cortical penetration of the magnetic field. Differences in the coil substance as well as the electronic operation of the power supply to the coil may also result in variations in the biophysical characteristics of the resulting magnetic pulse (e.g., width or duration of the magnetic field pulse). All of these features should be considered when comparing results obtained from different studies, with respect to both safety and efficacy.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-36" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-36" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>37<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n\t\t\t\t<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\tA number of different types of coils exist, each of which produce different magnetic field patterns. Some examples:</p>\r\n\t\t\t\t<ul style="line-height: 1.5em; list-style-type: square; margin-top: 0.3em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 1.5em; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-left: 0px; list-style-image: url(data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAUAAAANCAMAAABW4lS6AAAAGXRFWHRTb2Z0d2FyZQBBZG9iZSBJbWFnZVJlYWR5ccllPAAAAAZQTFRFAFKM////QIUK9QAAAAJ0Uk5T/wDltzBKAAAAGklEQVR42mJgBAEGokgGBjBGBxBxsBqAAAMACHwALd5r8ygAAAAASUVORK5CYII=); ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\tround coil: the original type of TMS coil</li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\tfigure-eight coil (i.e. butterfly coil): results in a more focal pattern of activation</li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\tdouble-cone coil: conforms to shape of head, useful for deeper stimulation</li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\tfour-leaf coil: for focal stimulation of peripheral nerves<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-roth2_37-0" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-roth2-37" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>38<span>]</span></a></sup></li>\r\n\t\t\t\t</ul>\r\n\t\t\t\t<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\tDesign variations in the shape of the TMS coils allow much deeper penetration of the brain than the standard depth of 1.5&nbsp;cm. Circular, H-shaped, double cone coils and other experimental variations can induce excitation or inhibition of neurons deeper in the brain including activation of motor neurons for the&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cerebellum" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Cerebellum">cerebellum</a>, legs and&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pelvic_floor" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Pelvic floor">pelvic floor</a>. Though able to penetrate deeper in the brain, they are less able to produced a focused, localized response and are relatively non-focal.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Rossi_3-7" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-Rossi-3" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>4<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n\t\t\t\t<h2 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.6em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-bottom-style: solid; border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); width: auto; font-size: 19px; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation&amp;action=edit&amp;section=12" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: See also">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="See_also">See also</span></h2>\r\n\t\t\t\t<ul style="line-height: 1.5em; list-style-type: square; margin-top: 0.3em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 1.5em; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-left: 0px; list-style-image: url(data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAUAAAANCAMAAABW4lS6AAAAGXRFWHRTb2Z0d2FyZQBBZG9iZSBJbWFnZVJlYWR5ccllPAAAAAZQTFRFAFKM////QIUK9QAAAAJ0Uk5T/wDltzBKAAAAGklEQVR42mJgBAEGokgGBjBGBxBxsBqAAAMACHwALd5r8ygAAAAASUVORK5CYII=); ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cranial_electrotherapy_stimulation" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Cranial electrotherapy stimulation">Cranial electrotherapy stimulation</a></li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Transcranial direct current stimulation">Transcranial direct current stimulation</a></li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Electroconvulsive_therapy" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Electroconvulsive therapy">Electroconvulsive therapy</a></li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/God_helmet" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="God helmet">God helmet</a></li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Neuronetics" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Neuronetics">Neuronetics</a></li>\r\n\t\t\t\t</ul>\r\n\t\t\t\t<h2 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.6em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-bottom-style: solid; border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); width: auto; font-size: 19px; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation&amp;action=edit&amp;section=13" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: References">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="References">References</span></h2>\r\n\t\t\t\t<div class="reflist" style="font-size: 12px; list-style-type: decimal; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<ol class="references" style="line-height: 1.5em; margin-top: 0.3em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 3.2em; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-left: 0px; list-style-image: none; font-size: 12px; list-style-type: inherit; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<li id="cite_note-Barker-0" style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<b><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_ref-Barker_0-0" style="text-decoration: none; Davey N; Rothwell J; Wassermann EM; Puri BK (2002).&nbsp;<i>Handbook of Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation</i>. Hodder Arnold.&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/International_Standard_Book_Number" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="International Standard Book Number">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Special:BookSources/0340720093" style="text-decoration: none; " title="Special:BookSources/0340720093">0340720093</a>.</span></li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<li id="cite_note-Fitzgerald-2" style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<b><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_ref-Fitzgerald_2-0" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; ">^</a></b>&nbsp;<span class="citation Journal" style="word-wrap: break-word; ">Fitzgerald PB; Fountain S; Daskalakis J (December 2006). &quot;A comprehensive review of the effects of rTMS on motor cortical excitability and inhibition&quot;.&nbsp;<i>Clinical Neurophysiology</i>&nbsp;<b>117</b>&nbsp;(12): 2584&ndash;96.&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Digital_object_identifier" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; text-align: right; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t<a href="http://wikimediafoundation.org/" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><img alt="Wikimedia Foundation" height="31" src="http://bits.wikimedia.org/images/wikimedia-button.png" style="border-top-style: none; border-right-style: none; border-bottom-style: none; border-left-style: none; border-width: initial; border-color: initial; vertical-align: middle; " width="88" /></a></li>\r\n\t\t\t<li id="footer-poweredbyico" style="margin-bottom: 0px; 32	Transcranial magnetic stimulation	2	<p>\r\n\tqaqaaa</p>\r\n<p>\r\n\ta</p>\r\n<p>\r\n\t&nbsp;</p>\r\n<div style="height: 100%; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; ">\r\n\t\t\tTranscranial magnetic stimulation</h1>\r\n\t\t<div id="bodyContent" style="font-size: 0.8em; position: relative; width: 1393px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t\t\t<div id="siteSub" style="display: inline; font-size: 12px; ">\r\n\t\t\t\tFrom Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia</div>\r\n\t\t\t<div id="contentSub" style="font-size: 11px; line-height: 1.2em; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 1.4em; margin-left: 1em; color: rgb(125, 125, 125); width: auto; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t&nbsp;</div>\r\n\t\t\t<div class="mw-content-ltr" dir="ltr" lang="en" style="direction: ltr; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t<div class="dablink" style="font-style: italic; padding-left: 2em; margin-bottom: 0.5em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\tFor other uses, see&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/TMS_(disambiguation)" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="TMS (disambiguation)">TMS (disambiguation)</a>.</div>\r\n\t\t\t\t<table cellspacing="5" class="infobox" style="font-size: 11px; border-top-style: solid; border-right-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); border-right-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); border-left-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); color: black; margin-top: 0.5em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 1em; padding-top: 0.2em; padding-right: 0.2em; padding-bottom: 0.2em; padding-left: 0.2em; float: right; clear: right; text-align: left; line-height: 1.5em; width: 22em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<tbody>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<tr>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<th colspan="2" style="vertical-align: top; text-align: center; font-size: 14px; font-weight: bold; background-color: rgb(173, 216, 230); ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\tTranscranial magnetic stimulation</th>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t</tr>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<tr>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<td colspan="2" style="vertical-align: top; text-align: center; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<i>Intervention</i></td>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t</tr>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<tr>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<td colspan="2" style="vertical-align: top; text-align: center; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<a class="image" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Repetitive_transcranial_magnetic_stimulation_(rTMS)_is_a_technique_for_noninvasive_stimulation_of_the_adult_brain.jpg" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><img alt="" height="214" src="http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/16/Repetitive_transcranial_magnetic_stimulation_%28rTMS%29_is_a_technique_for_noninvasive_stimulation_of_the_adult_brain.jpg/230px-Repetitive_transcranial_magnetic_stimulation_%28rTMS%29_is_a_technique_for_noninvasive_stimulation_of_the_adult_brain.jpg" style="border-top-style: none; border-right-style: none; border-bottom-style: none; border-left-style: none; border-width: initial; border-color: initial; vertical-align: middle; " width="230" /></a><br />\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<span>rTMS in a rodent.</span></td>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t</tr>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<tr>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<th scope="row" style="vertical-align: top; text-align: left; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Medical_Subject_Headings" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Medical Subject Headings">MeSH</a></th>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<td style="vertical-align: top; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<span class="reflink plainlinks nourlexpansion"><a class="external text" href="http://www.nlm.nih.gov/cgi/mesh/2011/MB_cgi?field=uid&amp;term=D050781" rel="nofollow" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(51, 102, 187); background-image: url(data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAoAAAAKCAYAAACNMs+9AAAAGXRFWHRTb2Z0d2FyZQBBZG9iZSBJbWFnZVJlYWR5ccllPAAAAFZJREFUeF59z4EJADEIQ1F36k7u5E7ZKXeUQPACJ3wK7UNokVxVk9kHnQH7bY9hbDyDhNXgjpRLqFlo4M2GgfyJHhjq8V4agfrgPQX3JtJQGbofmCHgA/nAKks+JAjFAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC); background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; padding-top: 0px !important; padding-right: 13px; padding-bottom: 0px !important; padding-left: 0px !important; background-position: 0% 0%; background-repeat: no-repeat no-repeat; ">D050781</a></span></td>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t</tr>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t</tbody>\r\n\t\t\t\t</table>\r\n\t\t\t\t<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<b>Transcranial magnetic stimulation</b>&nbsp;(<b>TMS</b>) is a noninvasive method to cause&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Depolarization" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Depolarization">depolarization</a>&nbsp;or&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hyperpolarization" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Hyperpolarization">hyperpolarization</a>&nbsp;in the&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Neuron" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Neuron">neurons</a>&nbsp;of the&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brain" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Brain">brain</a>. TMS uses&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Electromagnetic_induction" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Electromagnetic induction">electromagnetic induction</a>&nbsp;to induce weak<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Electric_current" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Electric current">electric currents</a>&nbsp;using a rapidly changing&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Magnetic_field" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Magnetic field">magnetic field</a>; this can cause activity in specific or general parts of the brain with minimal discomfort, allowing the functioning and interconnections of the brain to be studied. A variant of TMS,&nbsp;<b>repetitive transcranial magnetic stimulation</b>&nbsp;(<b>rTMS</b>), has been tested as a treatment tool for various&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Neurological_disorder" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Neurological disorder">neurological</a>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mental_disorder" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Mental disorder">psychiatric</a>&nbsp;disorders including<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Migraine" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Migraine">migraines</a>,&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stroke" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Stroke">strokes</a>,&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Parkinson%27s_disease" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Parkinson's disease">Parkinson&#39;s disease</a>,&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dystonia" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Dystonia">dystonia</a>,&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tinnitus" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Tinnitus">tinnitus</a>,&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Major_depressive_disorder" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Major depressive disorder">depression</a>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Auditory_hallucination" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Auditory hallucination">auditory hallucinations</a>.</p>\r\n\t\t\t\t<table class="toc" id="toc" style="font-size: 12px; border-top-style: solid; border-right-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); border-right-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); border-left-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); padding-top: 5px; padding-right: 5px; padding-bottom: 5px; padding-left: 5px; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<tbody>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<tr>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<td>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<div id="toctitle" style="direction: ltr; text-align: center; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<h2 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; font-weight: bold; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.6em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; border-bottom-style: none; width: auto; font-size: 12px; display: inline; border-top-style: none; border-right-style: none; border-left-style: none; border-width: initial; border-color: initial; padding-right: 0px; padding-left: 0px; border-width: initial; border-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\tContents</h2>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t&nbsp;<span class="toctoggle" style="font-size: 11px; ">&nbsp;[<a class="internal" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#" id="togglelink" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; ">hide</a>]&nbsp;</span></div>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<ul style="line-height: 1.5em; list-style-type: none; margin-top: 0.3em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-left: 0px; list-style-image: none; text-align: left; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-1" style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#Background" style="text-decoration: none; "><span class="tocnumber">4</span>&nbsp;<span class="toctext">Clinical uses</span></a>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<ul style="line-height: 1.5em; list-style-type: none; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#FDA_actions_and_responses" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none;
