list-style-type: none; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 2em; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-left: 0px; list-style-image: none; text-align: left; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-8" style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#FDA_actions" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span class="tocnumber">5.1</span>&nbsp;<span class="toctext">FDA actions</span></a></li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-9" style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#Response_to_FDA_decision" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span class="tocnumber">5.2</span>&nbsp;<span class="toctext">Response to FDA decision</span></a></li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t</ul>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t</li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-10" style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#Technical_information" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span class="tocnumber">6</span>&nbsp;<span class="toctext">Technical information</span></a>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<ul style="line-height: 1.5em; list-style-type: none; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 2em; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-left: 0px; list-style-image: none; text-align: left; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-11" style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#Coil_types" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span class="tocnumber">6.1</span>&nbsp;<span class="toctext">Coil types</span></a></li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t</ul>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t</li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-12" style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#See_also" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span class="tocnumber">7</span>&nbsp;<span class="toctext">See also</span></a></li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-13" style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#References" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span class="tocnumber">8</span>&nbsp;<span class="toctext">References</span></a></li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-14" style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#Further_reading" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span class="tocnumber">9</span>&nbsp;<span class="toctext">Further reading</span></a></li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-15" style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#External_links" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span class="tocnumber">10</span>&nbsp;<span class="toctext">External links</span></a></li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t</ul>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t</td>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t</tr>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t</tbody>\r\n\t\t\t\t</table>\r\n\t\t\t\t<h2 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.6em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-bottom-style: solid; border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); width: auto; font-size: 19px; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: Background">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="Background">Background</span></h2>\r\n\t\t\t\t<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\tThe principle of inductive brain stimulation with&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eddy_current" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Eddy current">eddy currents</a>&nbsp;has been noted since the 20th century. The first successful TMS study was performed in 1985 by Anthony Barker and his colleagues in&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sheffield" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Sheffield">Sheffield</a>, England.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Barker_0-0" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-Barker-0" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>1<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;Its earliest application demonstrated conduction of nerve impulses from the&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Motor_cortex" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Motor cortex">motor cortex</a>&nbsp;to the&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spinal_cord" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Spinal cord">spinal cord</a>, stimulating muscle contractions. The use of magnets rather than a direct electric current to the brain reduced the discomfort of the procedure and research and allowed mapping of the&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cerebral_cortex" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Cerebral cortex">cerebral cortex</a>&nbsp;and its connections.</p>\r\n\t\t\t\t<h2 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.6em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-bottom-style: solid; border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); width: auto; font-size: 19px; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: Effects on the brain">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="Effects_on_the_brain">Effects on the brain</span></h2>\r\n\t\t\t\t<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\tThe exact details of how TMS functions are still being explored. The effects of TMS can be divided into two types depending on the mode of stimulation:</p>\r\n\t\t\t\t<ul style="line-height: 1.5em; list-style-type: square; margin-top: 0.3em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 1.5em; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-left: 0px; list-style-image: url(data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAUAAAANCAMAAABW4lS6AAAAGXRFWHRTb2Z0d2FyZQBBZG9iZSBJbWFnZVJlYWR5ccllPAAAAAZQTFRFAFKM////QIUK9QAAAAJ0Uk5T/wDltzBKAAAAGklEQVR42mJgBAEGokgGBjBGBxBxsBqAAAMACHwALd5r8ygAAAAASUVORK5CYII=); ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\tSingle or paired pulse TMS causes neurons in the neocortex under the site of stimulation to&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Depolarization" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Depolarization">depolarize</a>&nbsp;and discharge an&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Action_potential" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Action potential">action potential</a>. If used in the&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Primary_motor_cortex" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Primary motor cortex">primary motor cortex</a>, it produces muscle activity referred to as a&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Evoked_potential#Motor_evoked_potentials" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Evoked potential">motor evoked potential</a>&nbsp;(MEP) which can be recorded on&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Electromyography" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Electromyography">electromyography</a>. If used on the&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Occipital_cortex" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Occipital cortex">occipital cortex</a>, &#39;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Phosphene" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Phosphene">phosphenes</a>&#39; (flashes of light) might be perceived by the subject. In most other areas of the cortex, the participant does not consciously experience any effect, but his or her behaviour may be slightly altered (e.g. slower reaction time on a cognitive task), or changes in brain activity may be detected using sensing equipment.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Handbook_of_Transcranial_Magnetic_Stimulation_1-0" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-Handbook_of_Transcranial_Magnetic_Stimulation-1" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>2<span>]</span></a></sup></li>\r\n\t\t\t\t</ul>\r\n\t\t\t\t<ul style="line-height: 1.5em; list-style-type: square; margin-top: 0.3em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 1.5em; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-left: 0px; list-style-image: url(data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAUAAAANCAMAAABW4lS6AAAAGXRFWHRTb2Z0d2FyZQBBZG9iZSBJbWFnZVJlYWR5ccllPAAAAAZQTFRFAFKM////QIUK9QAAAAJ0Uk5T/wDltzBKAAAAGklEQVR42mJgBAEGokgGBjBGBxBxsBqAAAMACHwALd5r8ygAAAAASUVORK5CYII=); ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\tRepetitive TMS produces longer-lasting effects which persist past the initial period of stimulation. rTMS can increase or decrease the excitability of the&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Corticospinal_tract" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Corticospinal tract">corticospinal tract</a>&nbsp;depending on the intensity of stimulation, coil orientation and frequency. The mechanism of these effects is not clear although it is widely believed to reflect changes in synaptic efficacy akin to&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Long-term_potentiation" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Long-term potentiation">long-term potentiation</a>&nbsp;(LTP) and&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Long-term_depression" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Long-term depression">long-term depression</a>&nbsp;(LTD).<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Fitzgerald_2-0" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-Fitzgerald-2" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>3<span>]</span></a></sup></li>\r\n\t\t\t\t</ul>\r\n\t\t\t\t<h2 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.6em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-bottom-style: solid; border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); width: auto; font-size: 19px; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: Risks">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="Risks">Risks</span></h2>\r\n\t\t\t\t<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\tAlthough TMS is often regarded as safe, the greatest&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Acute_(medicine)" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Acute (medicine)">acute</a>&nbsp;risk of TMS is the rare occurrence of induced&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Epileptic_seizure" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Epileptic seizure">seizures</a>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syncope_(medicine)" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Syncope (medicine)">syncope</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Rossi_3-0" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-Rossi-3" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>4<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;More than 16 cases of TMS-related seizure have been reported in the literature, with at least seven reported before the publication of safety guidelines in 1998,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Wassermann1998_4-0" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-Wassermann1998-4" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>5<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;and more than nine reported afterwards. The seizures have been associated with single-pulse and rTMS. Reports have stated that in at least some cases, predisposing factors (medication, brain lesions or genetic susceptibility) may have contributed to the seizure. A review of nine seizures associated with rTMS that had been reported after 1998 stated that four seizures were within the safety parameters, four were outside of those parameters, and one had occurred in a healthy volunteer with no predisposing factors. A 2009 international consensus statement on TMS that contained this review concluded that based on the number of studies, subjects and patients involved with TMS research, the risk of seizure with rTMS is considered very low.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Rossi_3-1" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-Rossi-3" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>4<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n\t\t\t\t<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\tBesides seizures, other risks include&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syncope_(medicine)" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Syncope (medicine)">fainting</a>, minor pains such as headache or local discomfort, minor cognitive changes and psychiatric symptoms (particularly a low risk of&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mania" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Mania">mania</a>&nbsp;in depressed patients).<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Rossi_3-2" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-Rossi-3" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>4<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;Though other side effects are thought to be possibly associated with TMS (alterations to the&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Endocrine_system" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Endocrine system">endocrine system</a>, altered&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Neurotransmitter" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Neurotransmitter">neurotransmitter</a>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Immune_system" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Immune system">immune system</a>&nbsp;activity) they are considered investigational and lacking substantive proof.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Rossi_3-3" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-Rossi-3" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>4<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n\t\t\t\t<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\tOther adverse effects of TMS are:</p>\r\n\t\t\t\t<ul style="line-height: 1.5em; list-style-type: square; margin-top: 0.3em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 1.5em; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-left: 0px; list-style-image: url(data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAUAAAANCAMAAABW4lS6AAAAGXRFWHRTb2Z0d2FyZQBBZG9iZSBJbWFnZVJlYWR5ccllPAAAAAZQTFRFAFKM////QIUK9QAAAAJ0Uk5T/wDltzBKAAAAGklEQVR42mJgBAEGokgGBjBGBxBxsBqAAAMACHwALd5r8ygAAAAASUVORK5CYII=); ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\tDiscomfort or pain from the stimulation of the scalp and associated&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nerves" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Nerves">nerves</a>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Muscle" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Muscle">muscles</a>&nbsp;on the overlying skin;<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-nami_5-0" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-nami-5" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>6<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;this is more common with rTMS than single pulse TMS,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Wassermann1998_4-1" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-Wassermann1998-4" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>5<span>]</span></a></sup></li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\tRapid deformation of the TMS coil produces a loud clicking sound which increases with the stimulator intensity that can affect hearing with sufficient exposure, particularly relevant for rTMS (hearing protection may be used to prevent this),<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Wassermann1998_4-2" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-Wassermann1998-4" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>5<span>]</span></a></sup></li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\trTMS in the presence of incompatible EEG electrodes can result in electrode heating and, in severe cases, skin burns.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-roth_6-0" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-roth-6" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>7<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;Non-metallic electrodes are used if concurrent EEG data is required.</li>\r\n\t\t\t\t</ul>\r\n\t\t\t\t<h2 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.6em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-bottom-style: solid; border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); width: auto; font-size: 19px; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: Clinical uses">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="Clinical_uses">Clinical uses</span></h2>\r\n\t\t\t\t<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\tThe uses of TMS and rTMS can be divided into diagnostic and therapeutic uses.</p>\r\n\t\t\t\t<h3 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; font-weight: bold; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.3em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: initial; border-bottom-style: none; border-bottom-color: initial; width: auto; font-size: 17px; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: Diagnosis">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="Diagnosis">Diagnosis</span></h3>\r\n\t\t\t\t<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\tTMS can be used clinically to measure activity and function of specific brain circuits in humans. The most robust and widely-accepted use is in measuring the connection between the&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Primary_motor_cortex" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Primary motor cortex">primary motor cortex</a>&nbsp;and a muscle to evaluate damage from&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stroke" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Stroke">strokes</a>,&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spinal_cord" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Spinal cord">spinal cord</a>&nbsp;injuries,&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Multiple_sclerosis" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Multiple sclerosis">multiple sclerosis</a>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Motor_neuron_disease" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Motor neuron disease">motor neuron disease</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-7" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-7" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>8<span>]</span></a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Dimyan_8-0" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-Dimyan-8" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>9<span>]</span></a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Nowak_9-0" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-Nowak-9" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>10<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;TMS has been suggested as a means of assessing short-interval intracortical inhibition (SICI) which measures the internal pathways of the&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Motor_cortex" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Motor cortex">motor cortex</a>but this use has not yet been validated.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Kujirai_10-0" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-Kujirai-10" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>11<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n\t\t\t\t<h3 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; font-weight: bold; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.3em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: initial; border-bottom-style: none; border-bottom-color: initial; width: auto; font-size: 17px; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: Therapy">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="Therapy">Therapy</span></h3>\r\n\t\t\t\t<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\tStudies of the use of TMS and rTMS to treat neurological and psychiatric conditions have shown only modest effects with little confirmation of results.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Slotema_11-0" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-Slotema-11" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>12<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;However, publications reporting the results of reviews and statistical&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Meta-analysis" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Meta-analysis">meta-analyses</a>&nbsp;of earlier investigations have stated that rTMS appeared to be effective in the treatment of certain types of&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Major_depressive_disorder" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Major depressive disorder">major depression</a>&nbsp;under certain specific conditions.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Slotema_11-1" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-Slotema-11" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>12<span>]</span></a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-12" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-12" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>13<span>]</span></a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-pmid17655558_13-0" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-pmid17655558-13" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>14<span>]</span></a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-14" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-14" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>15<span>]</span></a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-15" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-15" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>16<span>]</span></a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-pmid18447962_16-0" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-pmid18447962-16" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>17<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;rTMS devices are marketed for the treatment of such disorders in Canada, Australia, New Zealand, the European Union, Israel and the United States.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-pmid17655558_13-1" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-pmid17655558-13" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>14<span>]</span></a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Melkerson_17-0" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-Melkerson-17" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>18<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n\t\t\t\t<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\tA recent meta-analysis of 34 studies comparing rTMS to sham treatment showed an&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Effect_size" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Effect size">effect size</a>&nbsp;of 0.55 (p&lt;.001).<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-ReferenceA_18-0" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-ReferenceA-18" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>19<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;This is comparable to commonly reported effect sizes of pharmacotherapeutic strategies for treatment of depression in the range of 0.17-0.46.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-ReferenceA_18-1" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-ReferenceA-18" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>19<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;However, that same meta-analysis found that rTMS was significantly worse than electroconvulsive therapy (effect size -0.47), although side effects were significantly better with rTMS. An analysis of one of the studies included in the meta-analysis showed that one extra remission from depression occurs for every 3 patients given electroconvulsive therapy rather than rTMS (number needed to treat 2.36).<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-19" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-19" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>20<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n\t\t\t\t<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\tThere is evidence that rTMS can temporarily reduce chronic pain and change pain-related brain and nerve activity, and TMS has been used to predict the success of surgically implanted electrical brain stimulation for the treatment of pain.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-20" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-20" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>21<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n\t\t\t\t<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\tOther areas of research include the rehabilitation of&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aphasia" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Aphasia">aphasia</a>&nbsp;and motor disability after stroke,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Rossi_3-4" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-Rossi-3" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>4<span>]</span></a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Dimyan_8-1" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-Dimyan-8" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>9<span>]</span></a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Nowak_9-1" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-Nowak-9" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>10<span>]</span></a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-21" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-21" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>22<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tinnitus" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Tinnitus">tinnitus</a>,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-22" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-22" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>23<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Parkinson%27s_disease" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Parkinson's disease">Parkinson&#39;s disease</a><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-23" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-23" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>24<span>]</span></a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-24" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-24" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>25<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;and the negative symptoms of&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Schizophrenia" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Schizophrenia">schizophrenia</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-25" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-25" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>26<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;TMS has failed to show effectiveness for the treatment of&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brain_death" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Brain death">brain death</a>,&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coma" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Coma">coma</a>, and other&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Persistent_vegetative_state" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Persistent vegetative state">persistent vegetative states</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-26" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-26" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>27<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n\t\t\t\t<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\tIt is difficult to establish a convincing form of &quot;sham&quot; TMS to test for&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Placebo" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Placebo">placebo</a>&nbsp;effects during&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scientific_control" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Scientific control">controlled</a>&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clinical_trial" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Clinical trial">trials</a>&nbsp;in&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conscious" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Conscious">conscious</a>&nbsp;individuals, due to the neck pain, headache and twitching in the scalp or upper face associated with the intervention.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Rossi_3-5" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-Rossi-3" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>4<span>]</span></a></sup>&quot;Sham&quot; TMS manipulations can affect&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cerebrum" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Cerebrum">cerebral</a>&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glycolysis" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Glycolysis">glucose metabolism</a>&nbsp;and MEPs, which may confound results.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-pmid17655558_13-2" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-pmid17655558-13" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>14<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;This problem is exacerbated when using&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Subjectivity" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Subjectivity">subjective</a>&nbsp;measures of improvement. Depending on the research question asked and the&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Design_of_experiments" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Design of experiments">experimental design</a>, matching this discomfort to distinguish true effects from placebo can be an important and challenging issue.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Rossi_3-6" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-Rossi-3" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>4<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n\t\t\t\t<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\tA recent&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Multicenter_trial" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Multicenter trial">multicenter trial</a>&nbsp;of rTMS in depression used a &quot;sham&quot; placebo treatment that appeared to mimic the sound and scalp stimulation associated with active TMS treatment. The investigators concluded: &quot;Although the treatment effect was statistically significant on a clinically meaningful variable (remission), the overall number of remitters and responders was less than one would like with a treatment that requires daily intervention for 3 weeks or more, even with a benign adverse effect profile&quot;.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-27" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-27" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>28<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;However, a review of the trial&#39;s report has questioned the adequacy of the placebo, noting that treaters were able to guess whether patients were receiving treatment with active or sham TMS, better than chance.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-28" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-28" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>29<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n\t\t\t\t<h2 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.6em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-bottom-style: solid; border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); width: auto; font-size: 19px; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation&amp;action=edit&amp;section=7" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: FDA actions and responses">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="FDA_actions_and_responses">FDA actions and responses</span></h2>\r\n\t\t\t\t<h3 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; font-weight: bold; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.3em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: initial; border-bottom-style: none; border-bottom-color: initial; width: auto; font-size: 17px; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation&amp;action=edit&amp;section=8" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: FDA actions">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="FDA_actions">FDA actions</span></h3>\r\n\t\t\t\t<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\tIn January 2007 an advisory panel of the United States&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Food_and_Drug_Administration" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Food and Drug Administration">Food and Drug Administration</a>&nbsp;(FDA) did not recommend clearance for marketing of an rTMS device, stating that the device appeared to be reasonably safe but had failed to demonstrate&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Efficacy" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Efficacy">efficacy</a>&nbsp;in a study of people with major depression who had not benefitted from prior adequate treatment with oral antidepressants during their current major depressive episode.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Scudiero_29-0" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-Scudiero-29" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>30<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;The panel agreed that &quot;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blind_experiment" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Blind experiment">unblinding</a>&nbsp;was greater in the active group, and considering the magnitude of the&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Effect_size" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Effect size">effect size</a>, it may have influenced the study results.&quot;<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Scudiero_29-1" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-Scudiero-29" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>30<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;However, the FDA determined in December 2008 that the rTMS device was sufficiently similar to existing devices that did not require a&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Premarket_approval" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Premarket approval">premarket approval</a>&nbsp;application and allowed the device to be marketed in accordance with&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Federal_Food,_Drug,_and_Cosmetic_Act#Section_510.28k.29_and_the_device_approval_process" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act">Section 510(k)</a>&nbsp;of the&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Federal_Food,_Drug,_and_Cosmetic_Act" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act">Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act</a>&nbsp;for &quot;the treatment of Major Depressive Disorder in adult patients who have failed to achieve satisfactory improvement from one prior&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Antidepressant" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Antidepressant">antidepressant</a>&nbsp;medication at or above the minimal effective dose and duration in the current episode&quot;.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Melkerson_17-1" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-Melkerson-17" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>18<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;The user manual for the device warns that effectiveness has not been established in patients with major depressive disorder who have failed to achieve satisfactory improvement from zero and from two or more antidepressant medications in the current episode and that the device has not been studied in patients who have had no prior antidepressant medication.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-30" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-30" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>31<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n\t\t\t\t<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\tIn July 2011 the FDA published a final rule in the&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Federal_Register" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Federal Register">Federal Register</a>&nbsp;that classified the rTMS system into class II (special controls) (see:&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Medical_device#Classification" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Medical device">Medical device#Classification</a>) &quot;in order to provide a reasonable assurance of safety and effectiveness of these devices&quot;. The rule identified the rTMS system as &quot;an external device that delivers transcranial pulsed magnetic fields of sufficient magnitude to induce neural action potentials in the prefrontal cortex to treat the symptoms of major depressive disorder without inducing seizure in patients who have failed at least one antidepressant medication and are currently not on any antidepressant therapy&quot;.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-31" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-31" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>32<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;An FDA guidance document issued in conjunction with the final rule describes the special controls that support the classification of the rTMS system into Class II.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-32" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-32" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>33<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n\t\t\t\t<h3 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; font-weight: bold; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.3em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: initial; border-bottom-style: none; border-bottom-color: initial; width: auto; font-size: 17px; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation&amp;action=edit&amp;section=9" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: Response to FDA decision">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="Response_to_FDA_decision">Response to FDA decision</span></h3>\r\n\t\t\t\t<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\tSoon after the FDA cleared the device, several members of&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Public_Citizen" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Public Citizen">Public Citizen</a>&nbsp;stated in a&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Letter_to_the_editor" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Letter to the editor">letter to the editor</a>&nbsp;of the medical journal&nbsp;<i>Neuropsychopharmacology</i>&nbsp;that the FDA seemed to have based its decision on a&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Post-hoc_analysis" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Post-hoc analysis"><i>post-hoc</i>&nbsp;analysis</a>&nbsp;that did not establish the effectiveness of rTMS for the treatment of depression. The writers of the letter expressed their concern that patients would be diverted from therapies such as antidepressant medications that have an established history of effectiveness.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-33" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-33" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>34<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n\t\t\t\t<h2 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.6em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-bottom-style: solid; border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); width: auto; font-size: 19px; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation&amp;action=edit&amp;section=10" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: Technical information">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="Technical_information">Technical information</span></h2>\r\n\t\t\t\t<div class="floatright" style="clear: right; float: right; position: relative; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0.5em; border-top-width: 0px; border-right-width: 0px; border-bottom-width: 0px; border-left-width: 0px; border-style: initial; border-color: initial; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<a class="image" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:TMS_focal_field_.png" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none;
