background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><img alt="TMS focal field .png" height="133" src="http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/6f/TMS_focal_field_.png/150px-TMS_focal_field_.png" style="border-top-style: none; border-right-style: none; border-bottom-style: none; border-left-style: none; border-width: initial; border-color: initial; vertical-align: middle; " width="150" /></a></div>\r\n\t\t\t\t<div class="thumb tright" style="clear: right; float: right; margin-bottom: 1.3em; width: auto; background-color: transparent; margin-top: 0.5em; margin-right: 0px; margin-left: 1.4em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<div class="thumbinner" style="min-width: 100px; border-top-width: 1px; border-right-width: 1px; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-left-width: 1px; border-top-style: solid; border-right-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: rgb(204, 204, 204); border-right-color: rgb(204, 204, 204); border-bottom-color: rgb(204, 204, 204); border-left-color: rgb(204, 204, 204); padding-top: 3px !important; padding-right: 3px !important; padding-bottom: 3px !important; padding-left: 3px !important; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); font-size: 12px; text-align: center; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; width: 149px; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<a class="image" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:TMS_Butterfly_Coil_HEAD_.png" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><img alt="" class="thumbimage" height="192" src="http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/a/a2/TMS_Butterfly_Coil_HEAD_.png" style="border-top-style: solid; border-right-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-width: initial; border-color: initial; vertical-align: middle; border-top-width: 1px; border-right-width: 1px; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-left-width: 1px; border-top-color: rgb(204, 204, 204); border-right-color: rgb(204, 204, 204); border-bottom-color: rgb(204, 204, 204); border-left-color: rgb(204, 204, 204); background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); " width="147" /></a>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<div class="thumbcaption" style="text-align: left; border-top-style: none; border-right-style: none; border-bottom-style: none; border-left-style: none; border-width: initial; border-color: initial; line-height: 1.4em; padding-top: 3px !important; padding-right: 3px !important; padding-bottom: 3px !important; padding-left: 3px !important; font-size: 11px; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<div class="magnify" style="float: right; border-top-style: none !important; border-right-style: none !important; border-bottom-style: none !important; border-left-style: none !important; border-width: initial !important; border-color: initial !important; background-image: none !important; background-attachment: initial !important; background-origin: initial !important; background-clip: initial !important; background-color: initial !important; background-position: initial initial !important; background-repeat: initial initial !important; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<a class="internal" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:TMS_Butterfly_Coil_HEAD_.png" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none !important; background-attachment: initial !important; background-origin: initial !important; background-clip: initial !important; background-color: initial !important; display: block; border-top-style: none !important; border-right-style: none !important; border-bottom-style: none !important; border-left-style: none !important; border-width: initial !important; border-color: initial !important; background-position: initial initial !important; background-repeat: initial initial !important; " title="Enlarge"><img alt="" height="11" src="http://bits.wikimedia.org/skins-1.18/common/images/magnify-clip.png" style="border-top-style: none !important; border-right-style: none !important; border-bottom-style: none !important; border-left-style: none !important; border-width: initial; border-color: initial; vertical-align: middle; display: block; border-width: initial !important; border-color: initial !important; background-image: none !important; background-attachment: initial !important; background-origin: initial !important; background-clip: initial !important; background-color: initial !important; background-position: initial initial !important; background-repeat: initial initial !important; " width="15" /></a></div>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\tTMS - Butterfly Coils</div>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t</div>\r\n\t\t\t\t</div>\r\n\t\t\t\t<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\tTMS uses&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Electromagnetic_induction" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Electromagnetic induction">electromagnetic induction</a>&nbsp;to generate an electric current across the&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scalp" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Scalp">scalp</a>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Human_skull" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Human skull">skull</a>&nbsp;without physical contact. A plastic-enclosed coil of wire is held next to the skull and when activated, produces a<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Magnetic_field" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Magnetic field">magnetic field</a>&nbsp;oriented&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orthogonality" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Orthogonality">orthogonally</a>&nbsp;to the plane of the coil. The magnetic field passes unimpeded through the skin and skull, inducing an oppositely directed current in the brain that activates nearby nerve cells in much the same way as currents applied directly to the cortical surface.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-34" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-34" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>35<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n\t\t\t\t<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\tThe path of this current is difficult to model because the brain is irregularly shaped and electricity and magnetism are not&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Electrical_conduction" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Electrical conduction">conducted</a>&nbsp;uniformly throughout its tissues. The magnetic field is about the same strength as an&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Magnetic_resonance_imaging" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Magnetic resonance imaging">MRI</a>, and the pulse generally reaches no more than 5 centimeters into the brain.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-35" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-35" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>36<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n\t\t\t\t<h3 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; font-weight: bold; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.3em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: initial; border-bottom-style: none; border-bottom-color: initial; width: auto; font-size: 17px; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation&amp;action=edit&amp;section=11" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: Coil types">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="Coil_types">Coil types</span></h3>\r\n\t\t\t\t<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\tThe design of transcranial magnetic stimulation coils used in either treatment or diagnostic/experimental studies may differ in a variety of ways. These differences should be considered in the interpretation of any study result, and the type of coil used should be specified in the study methods for any published reports.</p>\r\n\t\t\t\t<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\tThe most important considerations include:</p>\r\n\t\t\t\t<ul style="line-height: 1.5em; list-style-type: square; margin-top: 0.3em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 1.5em; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-left: 0px; list-style-image: url(data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAUAAAANCAMAAABW4lS6AAAAGXRFWHRTb2Z0d2FyZQBBZG9iZSBJbWFnZVJlYWR5ccllPAAAAAZQTFRFAFKM////QIUK9QAAAAJ0Uk5T/wDltzBKAAAAGklEQVR42mJgBAEGokgGBjBGBxBxsBqAAAMACHwALd5r8ygAAAAASUVORK5CYII=); ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\tthe type of material used to construct the core of the coil</li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\tthe geometry of the coil configuration</li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\tthe biophysical characteristics of the pulse produced by the coil.</li>\r\n\t\t\t\t</ul>\r\n\t\t\t\t<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\tWith regard to coil composition, the core material may be either a magnetically inert substrate (i.e., the so-called &lsquo;air-core&rsquo;coil design), or possess a solid, ferromagnetically active material (ie, the so-called &lsquo;solid-core&rsquo; design). Solid core coil design result in a more efficient transfer of electrical energy into a magnetic field, with a substantially reduced amount of energy dissipated as heat, and so can be operated under more aggressive duty cycles often mandated in therapeutic protocols, without treatment interruption due to heat accumulation, or the use of an accessory method of cooling the coil during operation. Varying the geometric shape of the coil itself may also result in variations in the focality, shape, and depth of cortical penetration of the magnetic field. Differences in the coil substance as well as the electronic operation of the power supply to the coil may also result in variations in the biophysical characteristics of the resulting magnetic pulse (e.g., width or duration of the magnetic field pulse). All of these features should be considered when comparing results obtained from different studies, with respect to both safety and efficacy.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-36" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-36" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>37<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n\t\t\t\t<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\tA number of different types of coils exist, each of which produce different magnetic field patterns. Some examples:</p>\r\n\t\t\t\t<ul style="line-height: 1.5em; list-style-type: square; margin-top: 0.3em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 1.5em; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-left: 0px; list-style-image: url(data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAUAAAANCAMAAABW4lS6AAAAGXRFWHRTb2Z0d2FyZQBBZG9iZSBJbWFnZVJlYWR5ccllPAAAAAZQTFRFAFKM////QIUK9QAAAAJ0Uk5T/wDltzBKAAAAGklEQVR42mJgBAEGokgGBjBGBxBxsBqAAAMACHwALd5r8ygAAAAASUVORK5CYII=); ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\tround coil: the original type of TMS coil</li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\tfigure-eight coil (i.e. butterfly coil): results in a more focal pattern of activation</li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\tdouble-cone coil: conforms to shape of head, useful for deeper stimulation</li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\tfour-leaf coil: for focal stimulation of peripheral nerves<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-roth2_37-0" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-roth2-37" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>38<span>]</span></a></sup></li>\r\n\t\t\t\t</ul>\r\n\t\t\t\t<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\tDesign variations in the shape of the TMS coils allow much deeper penetration of the brain than the standard depth of 1.5&nbsp;cm. Circular, H-shaped, double cone coils and other experimental variations can induce excitation or inhibition of neurons deeper in the brain including activation of motor neurons for the&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cerebellum" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Cerebellum">cerebellum</a>, legs and&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pelvic_floor" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Pelvic floor">pelvic floor</a>. Though able to penetrate deeper in the brain, they are less able to produced a focused, localized response and are relatively non-focal.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Rossi_3-7" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_note-Rossi-3" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>4<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n\t\t\t\t<h2 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.6em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-bottom-style: solid; border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); width: auto; font-size: 19px; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation&amp;action=edit&amp;section=12" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: See also">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="See_also">See also</span></h2>\r\n\t\t\t\t<ul style="line-height: 1.5em; list-style-type: square; margin-top: 0.3em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 1.5em; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-left: 0px; list-style-image: url(data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAUAAAANCAMAAABW4lS6AAAAGXRFWHRTb2Z0d2FyZQBBZG9iZSBJbWFnZVJlYWR5ccllPAAAAAZQTFRFAFKM////QIUK9QAAAAJ0Uk5T/wDltzBKAAAAGklEQVR42mJgBAEGokgGBjBGBxBxsBqAAAMACHwALd5r8ygAAAAASUVORK5CYII=); ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cranial_electrotherapy_stimulation" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Cranial electrotherapy stimulation">Cranial electrotherapy stimulation</a></li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_direct_current_stimulation" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Transcranial direct current stimulation">Transcranial direct current stimulation</a></li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Electroconvulsive_therapy" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Electroconvulsive therapy">Electroconvulsive therapy</a></li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/God_helmet" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="God helmet">God helmet</a></li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<li style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Neuronetics" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Neuronetics">Neuronetics</a></li>\r\n\t\t\t\t</ul>\r\n\t\t\t\t<h2 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.6em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-bottom-style: solid; border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); width: auto; font-size: 19px; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation&amp;action=edit&amp;section=13" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: References">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="References">References</span></h2>\r\n\t\t\t\t<div class="reflist" style="font-size: 12px; list-style-type: decimal; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<ol class="references" style="line-height: 1.5em; margin-top: 0.3em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 3.2em; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-left: 0px; list-style-image: none; font-size: 12px; list-style-type: inherit; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<li id="cite_note-Barker-0" style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<b><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcranial_magnetic_stimulation#cite_ref-Barker_0-0" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; ">^</a></b>&nbsp;<span class="citation Journal" style="word-wrap: break-word; ">Barker AT, Jalinous R, Freeston IL. (May 1985). &quot;Non-invasive magnetic stimulation of human motor cortex&quot;.&nbsp;<i><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Lancet" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="The Lancet">The Lancet</a></i>&nbsp;<b>1</b>&nbsp;(8437): 1106&ndash;1107.&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Digital_object_identifier" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Digital object identifier">doi</a>:<a class="external text" href="http://dx.doi.org/10.1016%2FS0140-6736%2885%2992413-4" rel="nofollow" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(51, 102, 187); background-image: url(data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAoAAAAKCAYAAACNMs+9AAAAGXRFWHRTb2Z0d2FyZQBBZG9iZSBJbWFnZVJlYWR5ccllPAAAAFZJREFUeF59z4EJADEIQ1F36k7u5E7ZKXeUQPACJ3wK7UNokVxVk9kHnQH7bY9hbDyDhNXgjpRLqFlo4M2GgfyJHhjq8V4agfrgPQX3JtJQGbofmCHgA/nAKks+JAjFAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC); background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; padding-right: 13px; background-position: 100% 50%; background-repeat: no-repeat no-repeat; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.5em; color: rgb(51, 51, 51); font-size: 0.7em; line-height: 1.4em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t<a class="internal" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Contact_us" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; ">Contact us</a></li>\r\n\t\t</ul>\r\n\t\t<ul id="footer-places" style="line-height: 1.5em; list-style-type: none; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-left: 0px; list-style-image: none; list-style-position: initial; float: left; ">\r\n\t\t\t<li id="footer-places-privacy" style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px; " title="wikimedia:Privacy policy">Privacy policy</a></li>\r\n\t\t\t<li id="footer-places-about" style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 1em; margin-left: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-left: 0px; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-left: 0px; list-style-image: none; list-style-position: initial; float: right; ">\r\n\t\t\t<li id="footer-copyrightico" style="margin-bottom: 0px; border-right-style: none; border-bottom-style: none; border-left-style: none; border-width: initial; border-color: initial; vertical-align: middle; " width="88" /></a></li>\r\n\t\t\t<li id="footer-poweredbyico" style="margin-bottom: 0px; 33	Major depressive disorder	2	<p>\r\n\t&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t<b>Major depressive disorder</b>&nbsp;(<b>MDD</b>) (also known as&nbsp;<b>recurrent depressive disorder</b>,&nbsp;<b>clinical depression</b>,&nbsp;<b>major depression</b>,&nbsp;<b>unipolar depression</b>, or&nbsp;<b>unipolar disorder</b>) is a&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mental_disorder" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Mental disorder">mental disorder</a>characterized by an all-encompassing&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Depression_(mood)" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Depression (mood)">low mood</a>&nbsp;accompanied by low&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Self-esteem" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Self-esteem">self-esteem</a>, and by&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anhedonia" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Anhedonia">loss of interest or pleasure</a>&nbsp;in normally enjoyable activities. This cluster of symptoms (<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syndrome" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Syndrome">syndrome</a>) was named, described and classified as one of the&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mood_disorder" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Mood disorder">mood disorders</a>&nbsp;in the 1980 edition of the&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/American_Psychiatric_Association" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="American Psychiatric Association">American Psychiatric Association</a>&#39;s&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Diagnostic_and_Statistical_Manual_of_Mental_Disorders" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders">diagnostic manual</a>. The term &quot;depression&quot; is ambiguous. It is often used to denote this syndrome but may refer to other mood disorders or to lower mood states lacking&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clinical_significance" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Clinical significance">clinical significance</a>. Major depressive disorder is a disabling condition which adversely affects a person&#39;s family, work or school life, sleeping and eating habits, and general health. In the United States, around 3.4% of people with major depression commit&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Suicide" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Suicide">suicide</a>, and up to 60% of people who committed suicide had depression or another mood disorder.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-IntegrativeSuicide_0-0" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Major_depressive_disorder#cite_note-IntegrativeSuicide-0" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>1<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tThe diagnosis of major depressive disorder is based on the patient&#39;s self-reported experiences, behavior reported by relatives or friends, and a&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mental_status_examination" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Mental status examination">mental status examination</a>. There is no laboratory test for major depression, although physicians generally request tests for physical conditions that may cause similar symptoms. If depressive disorder is not detected in the early stages it may result in a slow recovery and affect or worsen the person&#39;s physical&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Health" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Health">health</a>. Standardized screening tools such as&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Major_Depression_Inventory" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Major Depression Inventory">Major Depression Inventory</a>&nbsp;can be used to detect major depressive disorder.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-1" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Major_depressive_disorder#cite_note-1" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>2<span>]</span></a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-2" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Major_depressive_disorder#cite_note-2" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>3<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;The most common time of onset is between the ages of 20 and 30 years, with a later peak between 30 and 40 years.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-3" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Major_depressive_disorder#cite_note-3" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>4<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tTypically, patients are treated with&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Antidepressant" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Antidepressant">antidepressant</a>&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pharmaceutical_drug" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Pharmaceutical drug">medication</a>&nbsp;and, in many cases, also receive&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Psychotherapy" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Psychotherapy">psychotherapy</a>&nbsp;or counseling, although the effectiveness of medication for mild or moderate cases is questionable. Hospitalization may be necessary in cases with associated&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Self-neglect" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Self-neglect">self-neglect</a>&nbsp;or a significant risk of harm to self or others. A minority are treated with&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Electroconvulsive_therapy" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Electroconvulsive therapy">electroconvulsive therapy</a>&nbsp;(ECT), under a short-acting&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/General_anaesthetic" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="General anaesthetic">general anesthetic</a>. The course of the disorder varies widely, from one episode lasting weeks to a lifelong disorder with recurrent&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Major_depressive_episode" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Major depressive episode">major depressive episodes</a>. Depressed individuals have shorter&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Life_expectancy" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Life expectancy">life expectancies</a>&nbsp;than those without depression, in part because of greater susceptibility to medical illnesses and suicide. It is unclear whether or not medications affect the risk of suicide. Current and former patients may be&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Social_stigma" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Social stigma">stigmatized</a>.</p>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tThe understanding of the nature and causes of depression has evolved over the centuries, though this understanding is incomplete and has left many aspects of depression as the subject of discussion and research. Proposed causes include&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Psychology" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Psychology">psychological</a>, psycho-social,&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Heredity" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Heredity">hereditary</a>,&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Evolution" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Evolution">evolutionary</a>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Biology" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Biology">biological</a>&nbsp;factors. Certain types of long-term drug use can both cause and worsen depressive symptoms. Psychological treatments are based on theories of&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Personality_theory" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Personality theory">personality</a>,&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Communication_theory" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Communication theory">interpersonal communication</a>, and&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Learning_theory_(education)" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Learning theory (education)">learning</a>. Most biological theories focus on the&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monoamine_neurotransmitter" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Monoamine neurotransmitter">monoamine</a>&nbsp;chemicals<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Serotonin" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Serotonin">serotonin</a>,&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Norepinephrine" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Norepinephrine">norepinephrine</a>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dopamine" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Dopamine">dopamine</a>, which are natu</p>\r\n	4	2011-10-20 18:40:15.856509	2011-10-20 18:40:15.856509	17	\N	latest
35	Child psychopathology	2	<p>\r\n\t&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t<b>Child psychopathology</b>&nbsp;is the manifestation of&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Psychological_disorder" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Psychological disorder">psychological disorders</a>&nbsp;in children and&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adolescence" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Adolescence">adolescents</a>.&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oppositional_defiant_disorder" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Oppositional defiant disorder">Oppositional defiant disorder</a>,&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Attention-deficit_hyperactivity_disorder" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Attention-deficit hyperactivity disorder">attention-deficit hyperactivity disorder</a>, and&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pervasive_developmental_disorder" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Pervasive developmental disorder">pervasive developmental disorder</a>&nbsp;are examples of child psychopathology.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-0" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Child_psychopathology#cite_note-0" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>1<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Licensed_Professional_Counselor" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Licensed Professional Counselor">Counselors</a>,&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Social_worker" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Social worker">social workers</a>,&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Psychologist" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Psychologist">psychologists</a>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Psychiatrist" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Psychiatrist">psychiatrists</a>&nbsp;who work with mentally ill children are informed by research in&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Developmental_psychology" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Developmental psychology">developmental psychology</a>, developmental psychopathology, clinical child psychology, and family systems.</p>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tThe current trend in the&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/U.S." style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="U.S.">U.S.</a>&nbsp;is to understand child psychopathology from a systems based perspective called&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Developmental_psychopathology" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Developmental psychopathology">developmental psychopathology</a>. Recent emphasis has also been on understanding psychological disorders from a relational perspective with attention also given to&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Neurobiology" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Neurobiology">neurobiology</a>.</p>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tResearch and clinical work on child psychopathology tends to fall under several main areas:&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Etiology" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Etiology">etiology</a>,&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Epidemiology" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Epidemiology">epidemiology</a>, diagnosis,&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Psychological_testing" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Psychological testing">assessment</a>, and treatment.</p>\r\n<h2 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.6em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-bottom-style: solid; border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); width: auto; font-size: 19px; ">\r\n\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Child_psychopathology&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: References">edit</a>]</span></h2>\r\n<div>\r\n\t&nbsp;</div>\r\n	5	2011-10-20 18:44:32.460768	2011-10-20 18:44:32.460768	37	\N	latest
36	Mental health professional	2	<p>\r\n\tA&nbsp;<b>mental health professional</b>&nbsp;is a&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Health_care_provider" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Health care provider">health care practitioner</a>&nbsp;who offers services for the purpose of improving an individual&#39;s&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mental_health" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Mental health">mental health</a>&nbsp;or to treat&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mental_illness" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Mental illness">mental illness</a>. This broad category includes&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Psychiatrists" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Psychiatrists">psychiatrists</a>,&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clinical_psychologists" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Clinical psychologists">clinical psychologists</a>,&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Social_work" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Social work">clinical social workers</a>,&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Psychiatric_nurses" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Psychiatric nurses">psychiatric nurses</a>,&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mental_health_counselor" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Mental health counselor">mental health counselors</a>&nbsp;as well as many other professionals. These professionals often deal with the same illnesses, disorders, conditions, and issues; however their&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scope_of_practice" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Scope of practice">scope of practice</a>&nbsp;differs. The most significant difference between mental health professionals are the laws regarding&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Healthcare_provider_requisites" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Healthcare provider requisites">required education and training</a>&nbsp;across the various professions.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-AboutPsychs_0-0" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mental_health_profession#cite_note-AboutPsychs-0" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>1<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n	5	2011-10-20 18:45:51.449174	2011-10-20 18:45:51.449174	39	\N	latest
37	Introdution	2		6	2011-10-20 18:47:33.56258	2011-10-20 18:47:33.56258	58	\N	latest
38	Yers	2		8	2011-10-20 18:48:06.333003	2011-10-20 18:48:06.333003	32	\N	latest
39	hello	2		9	2011-10-20 18:49:51.015854	2011-10-20 18:49:51.015854	45	\N	latest
40	Intro	2		13	2011-10-20 18:56:51.472228	2011-10-20 18:56:51.472228	99	\N	latest
41	Post natal	2		16	2011-10-20 19:29:45.06575	2011-10-20 19:29:45.06575	52	\N	latest
34	Introduction	2	<p>\r\n\t&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\t<b>Clinical psychology</b>&nbsp;is an integration of science, theory and clinical knowledge for the purpose of understanding, preventing, and relieving psychologically-based distress or&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mental_illness" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Mental illness">dysfunction</a>&nbsp;and to promote subjective&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mental_health" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Mental health">well-being</a>&nbsp;and personal development.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-apa1_0-0" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clinical_psychology#cite_note-apa1-0" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>1<span>]</span></a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-plante_1-0" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clinical_psychology#cite_note-plante-1" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>2<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;Central to its practice are&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Psychological_assessment" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Psychological assessment">psychological assessment</a>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Psychotherapy" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Psychotherapy">psychotherapy</a>, although clinical psychologists also engage in research, teaching, consultation, forensic testimony, and program development and administration.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-brain_2-0" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clinical_psychology#cite_note-brain-2" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>3<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;In many countries, clinical psychology is a regulated&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mental_health_profession" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Mental health profession">mental health profession</a>.</p>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tThe field is often considered to have begun in 1896 with the opening of the first psychological&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clinic" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Clinic">clinic</a>&nbsp;at the&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/University_of_Pennsylvania" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="University of Pennsylvania">University of Pennsylvania</a>&nbsp;by&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lightner_Witmer" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Lightner Witmer">Lightner Witmer</a>. In the first half of the 20th century, clinical psychology was focused on psychological assessment, with little attention given to treatment. This changed after the 1940s when World War II resulted in the need for a large increase in the number of trained clinicians. Since that time, two main educational models have developed&mdash;the&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scientist%E2%80%93practitioner_model" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Scientist–practitioner model">Ph.D. scientist&ndash;practitioner model</a>&nbsp;(focusing on research) and the&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Doctor_of_Psychology" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Doctor of Psychology">Psy.D. practitioner&ndash;scholar model</a>&nbsp;(focusing on clinical practice). Clinical psychologists are now considered experts in providing psychotherapy, psychological testing, and in diagnosing mental illness. They generally train within four primary theoretical orientations&mdash;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Psychodynamic_psychotherapy" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Psychodynamic psychotherapy">psychodynamic</a>,&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Humanistic_psychology" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Humanistic psychology">humanistic</a>,&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Behavior_therapy" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Behavior therapy">behavior therapy</a>/<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cognitive_behavioral_therapy" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Cognitive behavioral therapy">cognitive behavioral</a>, and&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Systems_or_family_therapy" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Systems or family therapy">systems or family therapy</a>.</p>\r\n<div class="toclimit-3">\r\n\t<table class="toc" id="toc" style="font-size: 12px; border-top-style: solid; border-right-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); border-right-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); border-left-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); padding-top: 5px; padding-right: 5px; padding-bottom: 5px; padding-left: 5px; ">\r\n\t\t<tbody>\r\n\t\t\t<tr>\r\n\t\t\t\t<td>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<div id="toctitle" style="direction: ltr; text-align: center; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<h2 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; width: auto; font-size: 12px; display: inline; border-top-style: none; border-right-style: none; border-left-style: none; border-width: initial; border-color: initial; padding-right: 0px; padding-left: 0px; border-width: initial; border-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\tContents</h2>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t&nbsp;<span class="toctoggle" style="font-size: 11px; ">&nbsp;[<a class="internal" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clinical_psychology#" id="togglelink" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; ">hide</a>]&nbsp;</span></div>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t<ul style="line-height: 1.5em; text-align: left; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-1" style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clinical_psychology#History" style="text-decoration: none; list-style-type: none; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 2em; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-left: 0px; list-style-image: none; text-align: left; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-10" style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clinical_psychology#Internship_crisis_in_US_clinical_psychology_programs" style="text-decoration: none; ">\r\n\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Clinical_psychology&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1" style="text-decoration: none; " title="Edit section: History">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="History">History</span></h2>\r\n<div class="rellink relarticle mainarticle" style="font-style: italic; padding-left: 2em; margin-bottom: 0.5em; ">\r\n\tMain articles:&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/History_of_psychology" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="History of psychology">History of psychology</a>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/History_of_psychotherapy" style="text-decoration: none; " title="History of psychotherapy">History of psychotherapy</a></div>\r\n<div class="rellink" style="font-style: italic; padding-left: 2em; margin-bottom: 0.5em; ">\r\n\tFurther information:&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eastern_philosophy_and_clinical_psychology" style="text-decoration: none; " title="Eastern philosophy and clinical psychology">Eastern philosophy and clinical psychology</a>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Islamic_psychology" style="text-decoration: none;
