"><span class="tocnumber">8.3</span>&nbsp;<span class="toctext">School psychology</span></a></li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-27" style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clinical_psychology#Clinical_social_work" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span class="tocnumber">8.4</span>&nbsp;<span class="toctext">Clinical social work</span></a></li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-28" style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clinical_psychology#Occupational_therapy" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span class="tocnumber">8.5</span>&nbsp;<span class="toctext">Occupational therapy</span></a></li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t</ul>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t</li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-29" style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clinical_psychology#Criticisms_and_controversies" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span class="tocnumber">9</span>&nbsp;<span class="toctext">Criticisms and controversies</span></a></li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-30" style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clinical_psychology#Clinical_psychology_journals" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span class="tocnumber">10</span>&nbsp;<span class="toctext">Clinical psychology journals</span></a></li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-31" style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clinical_psychology#Major_influences" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span class="tocnumber">11</span>&nbsp;<span class="toctext">Major influences</span></a></li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-32" style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clinical_psychology#See_also" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span class="tocnumber">12</span>&nbsp;<span class="toctext">See also</span></a></li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-33" style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clinical_psychology#References" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span class="tocnumber">13</span>&nbsp;<span class="toctext">References</span></a></li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-34" style="margin-bottom: 0.1em; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clinical_psychology#External_links" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span class="tocnumber">14</span>&nbsp;<span class="toctext">External links</span></a></li>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t</ul>\r\n\t\t\t\t</td>\r\n\t\t\t</tr>\r\n\t\t</tbody>\r\n\t</table>\r\n</div>\r\n<h2 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.6em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-bottom-style: solid; border-bottom-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); width: auto; font-size: 19px; ">\r\n\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Clinical_psychology&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: History">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="History">History</span></h2>\r\n<div class="rellink relarticle mainarticle" style="font-style: italic; padding-left: 2em; margin-bottom: 0.5em; ">\r\n\tMain articles:&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/History_of_psychology" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="History of psychology">History of psychology</a>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/History_of_psychotherapy" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="History of psychotherapy">History of psychotherapy</a></div>\r\n<div class="rellink" style="font-style: italic; padding-left: 2em; margin-bottom: 0.5em; ">\r\n\tFurther information:&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eastern_philosophy_and_clinical_psychology" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Eastern philosophy and clinical psychology">Eastern philosophy and clinical psychology</a>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Islamic_psychology" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Islamic psychology">Islamic psychology</a></div>\r\n<div class="thumb tleft" style="float: left; clear: left; margin-bottom: 1.3em; width: auto; background-color: transparent; margin-top: 0.5em; margin-right: 1.4em; margin-left: 0px; ">\r\n\t<div class="thumbinner" style="min-width: 100px; border-top-width: 1px; border-right-width: 1px; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-left-width: 1px; border-top-style: solid; border-right-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: rgb(204, 204, 204); border-right-color: rgb(204, 204, 204); border-bottom-color: rgb(204, 204, 204); border-left-color: rgb(204, 204, 204); padding-top: 3px !important; padding-right: 3px !important; padding-bottom: 3px !important; padding-left: 3px !important; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); font-size: 12px; text-align: center; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; width: 222px; ">\r\n\t\t<a class="image" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Phrenology1.jpg" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><img alt="" class="thumbimage" height="259" src="http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/fa/Phrenology1.jpg/220px-Phrenology1.jpg" style="border-top-style: solid; border-right-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-width: initial; border-color: initial; vertical-align: middle; border-top-width: 1px; border-right-width: 1px; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-left-width: 1px; border-top-color: rgb(204, 204, 204); border-right-color: rgb(204, 204, 204); border-bottom-color: rgb(204, 204, 204); border-left-color: rgb(204, 204, 204); background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); " width="220" /></a>\r\n\t\t<div class="thumbcaption" style="text-align: left; border-top-style: none; border-right-style: none; border-bottom-style: none; border-left-style: none; border-width: initial; border-color: initial; line-height: 1.4em; padding-top: 3px !important; padding-right: 3px !important; padding-bottom: 3px !important; padding-left: 3px !important; font-size: 11px; ">\r\n\t\t\t<div class="magnify" style="float: right; border-top-style: none !important; border-right-style: none !important; border-bottom-style: none !important; border-left-style: none !important; border-width: initial !important; border-color: initial !important; background-image: none !important; background-attachment: initial !important; background-origin: initial !important; background-clip: initial !important; background-color: initial !important; background-position: initial initial !important; background-repeat: initial initial !important; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t<a class="internal" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Phrenology1.jpg" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none !important; background-attachment: initial !important; background-origin: initial !important; background-clip: initial !important; background-color: initial !important; display: block; border-top-style: none !important; border-right-style: none !important; border-bottom-style: none !important; border-left-style: none !important; border-width: initial !important; border-color: initial !important; background-position: initial initial !important; background-repeat: initial initial !important; " title="Enlarge"><img alt="" height="11" src="http://bits.wikimedia.org/skins-1.18/common/images/magnify-clip.png" style="border-top-style: none !important; border-right-style: none !important; border-bottom-style: none !important; border-left-style: none !important; border-width: initial; border-color: initial; vertical-align: middle; display: block; border-width: initial !important; border-color: initial !important; background-image: none !important; background-attachment: initial !important; background-origin: initial !important; background-clip: initial !important; background-color: initial !important; background-position: initial initial !important; background-repeat: initial initial !important; " width="15" /></a></div>\r\n\t\t\tMany 18th c. treatments for psychological distress were based on pseudo-scientific ideas, such as&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Phrenology" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Phrenology">phrenology</a>.</div>\r\n\t</div>\r\n</div>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tAlthough modern, scientific psychology is often dated at the 1879 opening of the first psychological laboratory by&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wilhelm_Wundt" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Wilhelm Wundt">Wilhelm Wundt</a>, attempts to create methods for assessing and treating mental distress existed long before. The earliest recorded approaches were a combination of religious, magical and/or medical perspectives.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-benjamin_3-0" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clinical_psychology#cite_note-benjamin-3" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>4<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;Early examples of such physicians included&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pata%C3%B1jali" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Patañjali">Pata&ntilde;jali</a>,<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Padmasambhava" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Padmasambhava">Padmasambhava</a>,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-4" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clinical_psychology#cite_note-4" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>5<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Muhammad_ibn_Zakar%C4%ABya_R%C4%81zi" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Muhammad ibn Zakarīya Rāzi">Rhazes</a>,&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avicenna" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Avicenna">Avicenna</a>,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-5" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clinical_psychology#cite_note-5" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>6<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jalal_ad-Din_Muhammad_Balkhi-Rumi" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Jalal ad-Din Muhammad Balkhi-Rumi">Rumi</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-6" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clinical_psychology#cite_note-6" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>7<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tIn the early 19th century, one could have his or her head examined, literally, using phrenology, the study of personality by the shape of the skull. Other popular treatments included&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Physiognomy" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Physiognomy">physiognomy</a>&mdash;the study of the shape of the face&mdash;and&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mesmerism" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Mesmerism">mesmerism</a>,&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Franz_Anton_Mesmer" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Franz Anton Mesmer">Mesmer&#39;s</a>&nbsp;treatment by the use of&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Magnet" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Magnet">magnets</a>.&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spiritualism" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Spiritualism">Spiritualism</a>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Phineas_Quimby" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Phineas Quimby">Phineas Quimby</a>&#39;s &quot;mental healing&quot; were also popular.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-benjamin2_7-0" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clinical_psychology#cite_note-benjamin2-7" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>8<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tWhile the scientific community eventually came to reject all of these methods, academic psychologists also were not concerned with serious forms of mental illness. That area was already being addressed by the developing fields of&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Psychiatry" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Psychiatry">psychiatry</a>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Neurology" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Neurology">neurology</a>&nbsp;within the&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Psychiatric_hospital" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Psychiatric hospital">asylum</a>&nbsp;movement.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-benjamin_3-1" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clinical_psychology#cite_note-benjamin-3" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>4<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;It was not until the end of the 19th century, around the time when&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sigmund_Freud" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Sigmund Freud">Sigmund Freud</a>&nbsp;was first developing his &quot;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Psychoanalysis" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Psychoanalysis">talking cure</a>&quot; in&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vienna" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Vienna">Vienna</a>, that the first scientifically clinical application of psychology began.</p>\r\n<h3 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; font-weight: bold; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.3em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: initial; border-bottom-style: none; border-bottom-color: initial; width: auto; font-size: 17px; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; ">\r\n\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Clinical_psychology&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: Early clinical psychology">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="Early_clinical_psychology">Early clinical psychology</span></h3>\r\n<div class="thumb tright" style="clear: right; float: right; margin-bottom: 1.3em; width: auto; background-color: transparent; margin-top: 0.5em; margin-right: 0px; margin-left: 1.4em; ">\r\n\t<div class="thumbinner" style="min-width: 100px; border-top-width: 1px; border-right-width: 1px; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-left-width: 1px; border-top-style: solid; border-right-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: rgb(204, 204, 204); border-right-color: rgb(204, 204, 204); border-bottom-color: rgb(204, 204, 204); border-left-color: rgb(204, 204, 204); padding-top: 3px !important; padding-right: 3px !important; padding-bottom: 3px !important; padding-left: 3px !important; background-color: rgb(249, 249, 249); font-size: 12px; text-align: center; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; width: 177px; ">\r\n\t\t<a class="image" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Witmer.jpg" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><img alt="" class="thumbimage" height="234" src="http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/a/aa/Witmer.jpg/175px-Witmer.jpg" style="border-top-style: solid; border-right-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-width: initial; border-color: initial; vertical-align: middle; border-top-width: 1px; border-right-width: 1px; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-left-width: 1px; border-top-color: rgb(204, 204, 204); border-right-color: rgb(204, 204, 204); border-bottom-color: rgb(204, 204, 204); border-left-color: rgb(204, 204, 204); background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); " width="175" /></a>\r\n\t\t<div class="thumbcaption" style="text-align: left; border-top-style: none; border-right-style: none; border-bottom-style: none; border-left-style: none; border-width: initial; border-color: initial; line-height: 1.4em; padding-top: 3px !important; padding-right: 3px !important; padding-bottom: 3px !important; padding-left: 3px !important; font-size: 11px; ">\r\n\t\t\t<div class="magnify" style="float: right; border-top-style: none !important; border-right-style: none !important; border-bottom-style: none !important; border-left-style: none !important; border-width: initial !important; border-color: initial !important; background-image: none !important; background-attachment: initial !important; background-origin: initial !important; background-clip: initial !important; background-color: initial !important; background-position: initial initial !important; background-repeat: initial initial !important; ">\r\n\t\t\t\t<a class="internal" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Witmer.jpg" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none !important; background-attachment: initial !important; background-origin: initial !important; background-clip: initial !important; background-color: initial !important; display: block; border-top-style: none !important; border-right-style: none !important; border-bottom-style: none !important; border-left-style: none !important; border-width: initial !important; border-color: initial !important; background-position: initial initial !important; background-repeat: initial initial !important; " title="Enlarge"><img alt="" height="11" src="http://bits.wikimedia.org/skins-1.18/common/images/magnify-clip.png" style="border-top-style: none !important; border-right-style: none !important; border-bottom-style: none !important; border-left-style: none !important; border-width: initial; border-color: initial; vertical-align: middle; display: block; border-width: initial !important; border-color: initial !important; background-image: none !important; background-attachment: initial !important; background-origin: initial !important; background-clip: initial !important; background-color: initial !important; background-position: initial initial !important; background-repeat: initial initial !important; " width="15" /></a></div>\r\n\t\t\t<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lightner_Witmer" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Lightner Witmer">Lightner Witmer</a>, the father of modern clinical psychology.</div>\r\n\t</div>\r\n</div>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tBy the second half of the 1800s, the scientific study of psychology was becoming well-established in university laboratories. Although there were a few scattered voices calling for an applied psychology, the general field looked down upon this idea and insisted on &quot;pure&quot; science as the only respectable practice.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-benjamin_3-2" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clinical_psychology#cite_note-benjamin-3" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>4<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;This changed when&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lightner_Witmer" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Lightner Witmer">Lightner Witmer</a>&nbsp;(1867&ndash;1956), a past student of&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wundt" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Wundt">Wundt</a>&nbsp;and head of the psychology department at the University of Pennsylvania, agreed to treat a young boy who had trouble with spelling. His successful treatment was soon to lead to Witmer&#39;s opening of the first psychological clinic at Penn in 1896, dedicated to helping children with&nbsp;<a class="mw-redirect" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Learning_disabilities" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Learning disabilities">learning disabilities</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-heiden_8-0" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clinical_psychology#cite_note-heiden-8" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>9<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;Ten years later in 1907, Witmer was to found the first journal of this new field,&nbsp;<i>The Psychological Clinic</i>, where he coined the term &quot;clinical psychology,&quot; defined as &quot;the study of individuals, by observation or experimentation, with the intention of promoting change.&quot;<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-compass_9-0" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clinical_psychology#cite_note-compass-9" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>10<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;The field was slow to follow Witmer&#39;s example, but by 1914, there were 26 similar clinics in the US.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-evans_10-0" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clinical_psychology#cite_note-evans-10" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>11<span>]</span></a></sup></p>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tEven as clinical psychology was growing, working with issues of serious mental distress remained the domain of&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Psychiatrist" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Psychiatrist">psychiatrists</a>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Neurologist" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Neurologist">neurologists</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-routh_11-0" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clinical_psychology#cite_note-routh-11" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>12<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;However, clinical psychologists continued to make inroads into this area due to their increasing skill at psychological assessment. Psychologists&#39; reputation as assessment experts became solidified during&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_I" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="World War I">World War I</a>&nbsp;with the development of two intelligence tests,&nbsp;<i>Army Alpha</i>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<i>Army Beta</i>&nbsp;(testing verbal and nonverbal skills, respectively), which could be used with large groups of recruits.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-benjamin2_7-1" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clinical_psychology#cite_note-benjamin2-7" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>8<span>]</span></a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-heiden_8-1" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clinical_psychology#cite_note-heiden-8" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>9<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;Due in large part to the success of these tests, assessment was to become the core discipline of clinical psychology for the next quarter century, when another war would propel the field into treatment.</p>\r\n<h3 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; font-weight: bold; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.3em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: initial; border-bottom-style: none; border-bottom-color: initial; width: auto; font-size: 17px; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; ">\r\n\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Clinical_psychology&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: Early professional organizations">edit</a>]</span><span class="mw-headline" id="Early_professional_organizations">Early professional organizations</span></h3>\r\n<p style="margin-top: 0.4em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-left: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; ">\r\n\tThe field began to organize under the name &quot;clinical psychology&quot; in 1917 with the founding of the American Association of Clinical Psychology. This only lasted until 1919, after which the&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/American_Psychological_Association" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="American Psychological Association">American Psychological Association</a>&nbsp;(founded by&nbsp;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/G._Stanley_Hall" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="G. Stanley Hall">G. Stanley Hall</a>&nbsp;in 1892) developed a section on Clinical Psychology, which offered certification until 1927.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-evans_10-1" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clinical_psychology#cite_note-evans-10" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>11<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;Growth in the field was slow for the next few years when various unconnected psychological organizations came together as the American Association of Applied Psychology in 1930, which would act as the primary forum for psychologists until after World War II when the APA reorganized.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-apa100_12-0" style="line-height: 1em; font-style: normal; "><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clinical_psychology#cite_note-apa100-12" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; white-space: nowrap; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; "><span>[</span>13<span>]</span></a></sup>&nbsp;In 1945, the APA created what is now called Division 12, its division of clinical psychology, which remains a leading organization in the field. Psychological societies and associations in other English-speaking countries developed similar divisions, including in Britain, Canada, Australia and New Zealand.</p>\r\n<h3 style="color: black; background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; font-weight: bold; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.3em; margin-left: 0px; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0.17em; border-bottom-width: initial; border-bottom-style: none; border-bottom-color: initial; width: auto; font-size: 17px; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; ">\r\n\t<span class="editsection" style="float: right; margin-left: 5px; font-size: 13px; ">[<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Clinical_psychology&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4" style="text-decoration: none; color: rgb(6, 69, 173); background-image: none; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; background-color: initial; background-position: initial initial; background-repeat: initial initial; " title="Edit section: World War II and the integration of treatment">edit</a>]</span></h3>\r\n<div>\r\n\t&nbsp;</div>\r\n	5	2011-10-20 23:28:20.89236	2011-10-20 23:28:21.40677	54	34	latest
\.
